BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICHEPSENSOR.NAME: <link="LOGICHEPSENSOR">Radbolt Sensor</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICHEPSENSOR.DESC: Radbolt sensors can send a signal when a Radbolt passes over them.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICHEPSENSOR.EFFECT: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when Radbolts detected enters the chosen range.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICHEPSENSOR.LOGIC_P: Sends a Green Signal if detected Radbolts are within the selected range
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICTIMEOFDAYSENSOR.D: Cycle sensors ensure systems always turn on at the same time, day or night, every cycle.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICTIMEOFDAYSENSOR.E: Sets an automatic Green Signal and Red Signal schedule within one day-night cycle.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICTIMEOFDAYSENSOR.L: Sends a Green Signal if current time is within the selected Green range
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICTIMERSENSOR.NAME: <link="LOGICTIMERSENSOR">Timer Sensor</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICTIMERSENSOR.DESC: Timer sensors create automation schedules for very short or very long periods of time.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICTIMERSENSOR.EFFEC: Creates a timer to send Green Signals and Red Signals for specific amounts of time.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICTIMERSENSOR.LOGIC: Sends a Green Signal for the selected amount of Green time
Then, sends a Red Signal for the selected amount of Red time
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICCRITTERCOUNTSENSO: Detecting critter populations can help adjust their automated feeding and care regimens.
Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal based on the number of eggs and critters in a room.
Sends a Green Signal if the number of Critters and Eggs in the Room is greater than the selected threshold.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICCLUSTERLOCATIONSE: Starmap Location sensors can signal when a spacecraft is at a certain location
Send Green Signals at the chosen Starmap locations and Red Signals everywhere else.
Sends a Green Signalwhen a spacecraft is at the chosen Starmap locations
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICDUPLICANTSENSOR.D: Motion sensors save power by only enabling buildings when Duplicants are nearby.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICDUPLICANTSENSOR.E: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal based on whether a Duplicant is in the sensor's range.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICDUPLICANTSENSOR.L: Sends a Green Signal while a Duplicant is in the sensor's tile range
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICDISEASESENSOR.DES: Detecting germ populations can help block off or clean up dangerous areas.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICDISEASESENSOR.EFF: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal based on quantity of surrounding Germs.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICDISEASESENSOR.LOG: Sends a Green Signal if the number of Germs is within the selected range
These sensors can detect the presence of a specific gas and alter systems accordingly.
Sends a Green Signal when the selected Gas is detected on this sensor's tile. Sends a Red Signal when the selected Gas is not present.
Sends a Green Signal if the selected Gas is detected
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICELEMENTSENSORLIQU: These sensors can detect the presence of a specific liquid and alter systems accordingly.
Sends a Green Signal when the selected Liquid is detected on this sensor's tile. Sends a Red Signal when the selected Liquid is not present.
Sends a Green Signal if the selected Liquid is detected
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICRADIATIONSENSOR.D: Radiation sensors can disable buildings when they detect dangerous levels of radiation.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICRADIATIONSENSOR.E: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when ambient Radiation enters the chosen range.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICRADIATIONSENSOR.L: Sends a Green Signal if ambient Radiation is within the selected range
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.GASCONDUITDISEASESENSO: Germ sensors can help control automation behavior in the presence of germs.
Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal based on the internal Germ count of the pipe.
Sends a Green Signal if the number of Germs in the pipe is within the selected range
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LIQUIDCONDUITDISEASESE: Germ sensors can help control automation behavior in the presence of germs.
Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal based on the internal Germ count of the pipe.
Sends a Green Signal if the number of Germs in the pipe is within the selected range
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDCONDUITDISEASESEN: Germ sensors can help control automation behavior in the presence of germs.
Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal based on the internal Germ count of the object on the rail.
Sends a Green Signal if the number of Germs on the object on the rail is within the selected range
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.GASCONDUITELEMENTSENSO: Element sensors can be used to detect the presence of a specific gas in a pipe.
Sends a Green Signal when the selected Gas is detected within a pipe.
Sends a Green Signal if the configured Gas is detected
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LIQUIDCONDUITELEMENTSE: Element sensors can be used to detect the presence of a specific liquid in a pipe.
Sends a Green Signal when the selected Liquid is detected within a pipe.
Sends a Green Signal if the configured Liquid is detected within the pipe
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDCONDUITELEMENTSEN: Element sensors can be used to detect the presence of a specific item on a rail.
Sends a Green Signal when the selected item is detected on a rail.
Sends a Green Signal if the configured item is detected on the rail
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.GASCONDUITTEMPERATURES: Thermo sensors disable buildings when their pipe contents reach a certain temperature.
Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when pipe contents enter the chosen Temperature range.
Sends a Green Signal if the contained Gas is within the selected Temperature range
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LIQUIDCONDUITTEMPERATU: Thermo sensors disable buildings when their pipe contents reach a certain temperature.
Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when pipe contents enter the chosen Temperature range.
Sends a Green Signal if the contained Liquid is within the selected Temperature range
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDCONDUITTEMPERATUR: Thermo sensors disable buildings when their rail contents reach a certain temperature.
Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when rail contents enter the chosen Temperature range.
Sends a Green Signal if the contained item is within the selected Temperature range
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICCOUNTER.NAME: <link="LOGICCOUNTER">Signal Counter</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICCOUNTER.DESC: For numbers higher than ten connect multiple counters together.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICCOUNTER.EFFECT: Counts how many times a Green Signal has been received up to a chosen number. When the chosen number is reached it sends a Green Signal until it receives another Green Signal, when it resets automatically and begins counting again.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICCOUNTER.OUTPUT_PO: Sends a Green Signal when the counter matches the selected value
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICALARM.NAME: <link="LOGICALARM">Automated Notifier</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICALARM.DESC: Sends a notification when it receives a Green Signal.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICALARM.EFFECT:
Attach to sensors to send a notification when certain conditions are met.

Notifications can be customized.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PIXELPACK.NAME: <link="PIXELPACK">Pixel Pack</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PIXELPACK.DESC: Four pixels which can be individually designated different colors.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PIXELPACK.EFFECT: Pixels can be designated a color when it receives a Green Signal and a different color when it receives a Red Signal. Input from an Automation Wire controls the whole strip. Input from an Automation Ribbon can control individual pixels on the strip.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PIXELPACK.INPUT_PORT_A: Green Signal: Display the configured Green Signal pixels
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PIXELPACK.INPUT_PORT_I: Red Signal: Display the configured Red Signal pixels
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICHAMMER.NAME: <link="LOGICHAMMER">Hammer</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICHAMMER.DESC: The hammer makes neat sounds when it strikes buildings.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICHAMMER.EFFECT: In its default orientation, the hammer strikes the building to the left when it receives a Green Signal. Each building has a unique sound when struck by the hammer. The hammer does no damage when it strikes.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICRIBBONWRITER.NAME: <link="LOGICRIBBONWRITER">Ribbon Writer</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICRIBBONWRITER.DESC: Translates the signal from an <link="LOGICWIRE">Automation Wire</link> to a single Bit in an <link="LOGICRIBBON">Automation Ribbon</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICRIBBONWRITER.EFFE: Writes a Green Signal or a Red Signal to the specified Bit of an Automation Ribbon Automation Ribbon must be used as the output wire to avoid overloading.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICRIBBONWRITER.INPU: Green Signal: Receives Green Signal to be written to selected Bit
Red Signal: Receives Red Signal to to be written selected Bit
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICRIBBONWRITER.OUTP: Green Signal: Writes a Green Signal to selected Bit of an Automation Ribbon
Red Signal: Writes a Red Signal to selected Bit of an Automation Ribbon
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICRIBBONREADER.NAME: <link="LOGICRIBBONREADER">Ribbon Reader</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICRIBBONREADER.DESC: Inputs the signal from a single Bit in an <link="LOGICRIBBON">Automation Ribbon</link> into an <link="LOGICWIRE">Automation Wire</link>.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICRIBBONREADER.EFFE: Reads a Green Signal or a Red Signal from the specified Bit of an Automation Ribbon onto an Automation Wire.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICRIBBONREADER.INPU: Green Signal: Reads a Green Signal from selected Bit
Red Signal: Reads a Red Signal from selected Bit
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LOGICRIBBONREADER.OUTP: Green Signal: Sends a Green Signal to attached Automation Wire
Red Signal: Sends a Red Signal to attached Automation Wire
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.TRAVELTUBEENTRANCE.DES: Duplicants require access points to enter tubes, but not to exit them.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.TRAVELTUBEENTRANCE.EFF:
Allows Duplicants to enter the connected <link="TRAVELTUBE">Transit Tube</link> system.

Stops drawing <link="POWER">Power</link> once fully charged.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.TRAVELTUBE.NAME: <link="TRAVELTUBE">Transit Tube</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.TRAVELTUBE.DESC: Duplicants will only exit a transit tube when a safe landing area is available beneath it.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.TRAVELTUBE.EFFECT:
Quickly transports Duplicants from a <link="TRAVELTUBEENTRANCE">Transit Tube Access</link> to the tube's end.

Only transports Duplicants.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.TRAVELTUBEWALLBRIDGE.D: Tube crossings can run transit tubes through walls without leaking gas or liquid.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.TRAVELTUBEWALLBRIDGE.E:
Allows <link="TRAVELTUBE">Transit Tubes</link> to be run through wall and floor tile.

Functions as regular tile.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDCONDUIT.NAME: <link="SOLIDCONDUIT">Conveyor Rail</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDCONDUIT.DESC: Rails move materials where they'll be needed most, saving Duplicants the walk.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDCONDUIT.EFFECT:
Transports <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid Materials</link> on a track between <link="SOLIDCONDUITINBOX">Conveyor Loader</link> and <link="SOLIDCONDUITOUTBOX">Conveyor Receptacle</link>.

Can be run through wall and floor tile.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDCONDUITINBOX.NAME: <link="SOLIDCONDUITINBOX">Conveyor Loader</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDCONDUITINBOX.DESC: Material filters can be used to determine what resources are sent down the rail.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDCONDUITINBOX.EFFE:
Loads <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid Materials</link> onto <link="SOLIDCONDUIT">Conveyor Rail</link> for transport.

Only loads the resources of your choosing.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDCONDUITOUTBOX.DES: When materials reach the end of a rail they enter a receptacle to be used by Duplicants.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDCONDUITOUTBOX.EFF: Unloads <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid Materials</link> from a <link="SOLIDCONDUIT">Conveyor Rail</link> into storage.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDTRANSFERARM.NAME: <link="SOLIDTRANSFERARM">Auto-Sweeper</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDTRANSFERARM.DESC: An auto-sweeper's range can be viewed at any time by (ClickType/clicking) on the building.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDTRANSFERARM.EFFEC:
Automates <link="CHORES">Sweeping</link> and <link="CHORES">Supplying</link> errands by sucking up all nearby <link="DECOR">Debris</link>.

Materials are automatically delivered to any <link="SOLIDCONDUITINBOX">Conveyor Loader</link>, <link="SOLIDCONDUITOUTBOX">Conveyor Receptacle</link>, storage, or buildings within range.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDCONDUITBRIDGE.DES: Separating rail systems helps ensure materials go to the intended destinations.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDCONDUITBRIDGE.EFF:
Runs one <link="SOLIDCONDUIT">Conveyor Rail</link> section over another without joining them.

Can be run through wall and floor tile.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDVENT.NAME: <link="SOLIDVENT">Conveyor Chute</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDVENT.DESC: When materials reach the end of a rail they are dropped back into the world.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDVENT.EFFECT: Unloads <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid Materials</link> from a <link="SOLIDCONDUIT">Conveyor Rail</link> onto the floor.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDLOGICVALVE.NAME: <link="SOLIDLOGICVALVE">Conveyor Shutoff</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDLOGICVALVE.DESC: Automated conveyors save power and time by removing the need for Duplicant input.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDLOGICVALVE.EFFECT: Connects to an <link="LOGIC">Automation</link> grid to automatically turn <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid Material</link> transport on or off.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDLIMITVALVE.NAME: <link="SOLIDLIMITVALVE">Conveyor Meter</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDLIMITVALVE.DESC: Conveyor Meters let an exact amount of materials pass through before shutting off.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDLIMITVALVE.EFFECT: Connects to an <link="LOGIC">Automation</link> grid to automatically turn material transfer off when the specified amount has passed through it.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SOLIDLIMITVALVE.OUTPUT: Sends a Green Signal if limit has been reached
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.DEVPUMPSOLID.NAME: Dev Pump Solid
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.DEVPUMPSOLID.DESC: Piping a pump's output to a building's intake will send solids to that building.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.DEVPUMPSOLID.EFFECT: Generates chosen <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid Materials</link> and runs it through <link="SOLIDCONDUIT">Conveyor Rail</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.AUTOMINER.NAME: <link="AUTOMINER">Robo-Miner</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.AUTOMINER.DESC: A robo-miner's range can be viewed at any time by selecting the building.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.AUTOMINER.EFFECT: Automatically digs out all materials in a set range.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.CREATUREFEEDER.NAME: <link="CREATUREFEEDER">Critter Feeder</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.CREATUREFEEDER.DESC: Critters tend to stay close to their food source and wander less when given a feeder.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.GRAVITASPEDESTAL.NAME: <link="ITEMPEDESTAL">Pedestal</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.GRAVITASPEDESTAL.DESC: Perception can be drastically changed by a bit of thoughtful presentation.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.GRAVITASPEDESTAL.EFFEC:
Displays a single object, doubling its <link="DECOR">Decor</link> value.

Objects with negative Decor will gain some positive Decor when displayed.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.ITEMPEDESTAL.NAME: <link="ITEMPEDESTAL">Pedestal</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.ITEMPEDESTAL.DESC: Perception can be drastically changed by a bit of thoughtful presentation.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.ITEMPEDESTAL.EFFECT:
Displays a single object, doubling its <link="DECOR">Decor</link> value.

Objects with negative Decor will gain some positive Decor when displayed.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.ITEMPEDESTAL.FACADES.D: Perception can be drastically changed by a bit of thoughtful presentation.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.ITEMPEDESTAL.FACADES.H: This pedestal cradles precious objects in the palm of its hand.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.CROWNMOULDING.NAME: <link="CROWNMOULDING">Ceiling Trim</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.CROWNMOULDING.DESC: Ceiling trim is a purely decorative addition to one's overhead area.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.CROWNMOULDING.EFFECT:
Used to decorate the ceilings of rooms.

Increases <link="DECOR">Decor</link>, contributing to <link="MORALE">Morale</link>.
Ceiling trim is a purely decorative addition to one's overhead area.
Someone spent their entire weekend gluing ribbons to paper Shine Bug cut-outs, and it shows.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.CORNERMOULDING.NAME: <link="CORNERMOULDING">Corner Trim</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.CORNERMOULDING.DESC: Corner trim is a purely decorative addition for ceiling corners.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.CORNERMOULDING.EFFECT:
Used to decorate the ceiling corners of rooms.

Increases <link="DECOR">Decor</link>, contributing to <link="MORALE">Morale</link>.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.CORNERMOULDING.FACADES: It really dresses up a ceiling corner.
Why deck the halls, when you could festoon them?
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.EGGINCUBATOR.NAME: <link="EGGINCUBATOR">Incubator</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.EGGINCUBATOR.DESC: Incubators can maintain the ideal internal conditions for several species of critter egg.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.EGGINCUBATOR.EFFECT:
Incubates <link="CREATURES">Critter</link> eggs until ready to hatch.

Assigned Duplicants must possess the <link="RANCHING1">Critter Ranching</link> skill.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.EGGCRACKER.NAME: <link="EGGCRACKER">Egg Cracker</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.EGGCRACKER.DESC: Raw eggs are an ingredient in certain high quality food recipes.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.EGGCRACKER.EFFECT:
Converts viable <link="CREATURES">Critter</link> eggs into cooking ingredients.

Cracked Eggs cannot hatch.

Duplicants will not crack eggs unless tasks are queued.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.EGGCRACKER.FACADES.HAN: Just like Mi-Ma used to have.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.URANIUMCENTRIFUGE.NAME: <link="URANIUMCENTRIFUGE">Uranium Centrifuge</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.URANIUMCENTRIFUGE.DESC: Enriched uranium is a specialized substance that can be used to fuel powerful research reactors.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.URANIUMCENTRIFUGE.EFFE:
Extracts <link="ENRICHEDURANIUM">Enriched Uranium</link> from <link="URANIUMORE">Uranium Ore</link>.

Outputs <link="DEPLETEDURANIUM">Depleted Uranium</link> in molten form.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.URANIUMCENTRIFUGE.RECI: Convert Uranium ore to Molten Uranium and Enriched Uranium
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.HIGHENERGYPARTICLEREDI: We were all out of mirrors.
Receives and redirects Radbolts from <link="HIGHENERGYPARTICLESPAWNER">Radbolt Generators</link>.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MANUALHIGHENERGYPARTIC: Radbolts are necessary for producing Materials Science research.

Refines radioactive ores to generate Radbolts.

Emits generated Radbolts in the direction of your choosing.
Creates <link="RADIATION">Radbolts</link> by processing {0}. Also creates {1} as a byproduct.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.HIGHENERGYPARTICLESPAW: Radbolts are necessary for producing Materials Science research.

Attracts nearby <link="RADIATION">Radiation</link> to generate Radbolts.

Emits generated Radbolts in the direction of your choosing when the set Radbolt threshold is reached.

Radbolts collected will rapidly decay while this building is disabled.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.DEVHEPSPAWNER.NAME: Dev Radbolt Generator
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.DEVHEPSPAWNER.DESC: Radbolts are necessary for producing Materials Science research.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.HEPBATTERY.NAME: <link="HEPBATTERY">Radbolt Chamber</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.HEPBATTERY.DESC: Particles packed up and ready to go.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.HEPBATTERY.EFFECT: Stores Radbolts in a high-energy state, ready for transport. Requires a Green Signal to release radbolts from storage when the Radbolt threshold is reached. Radbolts in storage will rapidly decay while this building is disabled.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.HEPBATTERY.LOGIC_PORT_: Sends a Green Signal when its Radbolt Storage is full
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.HEPBRIDGETILE.NAME: <link="HEPBRIDGETILE">Radbolt Joint Plate</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.HEPBRIDGETILE.DESC: Allows Radbolts to pass through walls.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.HEPBRIDGETILE.EFFECT: Receives <link="RADIATION">Radbolts</link> from <link="HIGHENERGYPARTICLESPAWNER">Radbolt Generators</link> and directs them through walls. All other materials and elements will be blocked from passage.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.ASTRONAUTTRAININGCENTE: Duplicants must complete astronaut training in order to pilot space rockets.

Trains Duplicants to become <link="ROCKETPILOTING1">Astronaut</link>.

Duplicants must possess the <link="ROCKETPILOTING1">Astronaut</link> trait to receive training.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.HOTTUB.NAME: <link="HOTTUB">Hot Tub</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.HOTTUB.DESC: Relaxes Duplicants with massaging jets of heated liquid.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.HOTTUB.EFFECT:
Requires <link="LIQUIDPIPING">Pipes</link> to and from tub and <link="POWER">Power</link> to run the jets.

Water must be a comfortable temperature and will cool rapidly.

Increases Duplicant <link="MORALE">Morale</link> and leaves them feeling deliciously warm.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.HOTTUB.WATER_REQUIREME: This building must be filled with {amount} {element} in order to function.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.HOTTUB.TEMPERATURE_REQ: The Hot Tub will only be usable if supplied with {temperature} {element}. If the {element} gets too cold, the Hot Tub will drain and require refilling with {element}.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SODAFOUNTAIN.NAME: <link="SODAFOUNTAIN">Soda Fountain</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SODAFOUNTAIN.DESC: Sparkling water puts a twinkle in a Duplicant's eye.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SODAFOUNTAIN.EFFECT:
Creates soda from <link="WATER">Water</link> and <link="CARBONDIOXIDE">Carbon Dioxide</link>.

Consuming soda water increases Duplicant <link="MORALE">Morale</link>.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.UNCONSTRUCTEDROCKETMOD: Something useful could be put here someday
Can be changed into a different rocket module
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MILKFATSEPARATOR.NAME: <link="MILKFATSEPARATOR">Brackwax Gleaner</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MILKFATSEPARATOR.DESC: Duplicants can slather up with brackwax to increase their travel speed in transit tubes.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MILKFATSEPARATOR.EFFEC: Refines <link="MILK">Brackene</link> into <link="BRINE">Brine</link> and <link="MILKFAT">Brackwax</link>, and emits <link="CARBONDIOXIDE">Carbon Dioxide</link>.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MILKFEEDER.NAME: <link="MILKFEEDER">Critter Fountain</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MILKFEEDER.DESC: It's easier to tolerate overcrowding when you're all hopped up on brackene.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MILKFEEDER.EFFECT:
Dispenses <link="MILK">Brackene</link> to a wide variety of <link="CREATURES">Critters</link>.

Accessing the fountain significantly improves <link="CREATURES">Critters</link>' moods.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MILKINGSTATION.NAME: <link="MILKINGSTATION">Milking Station</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MILKINGSTATION.DESC: The harvested liquid is basically the equivalent of soda for critters.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MILKINGSTATION.EFFECT:
Allows Duplicants with the <link="RANCHING2">Critter Ranching II</link> skill to milk <link="MOO">Gassy Moos</link> for <link="MILK">Brackene</link>.

<link="MILK">Brackene</link> can be used to refill the <link="MILKFEEDER">Critter Fountain</link>.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTGA: Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.

Loads <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gases</link> to the storage of a linked rocket.

Automatically links when built to the side of a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> or another <link="MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID">Rocket Port</link>.

Uses the gas filters set on the rocket's cargo bays.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTBR: Allows rocket platforms to be built farther apart.
Automatically links when built to the side of a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> or any <link="MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID">Rocket Port</link>.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTLI: Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.

Loads <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquids</link> to the storage of a linked rocket.

Automatically links when built to the side of a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> or another <link="MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID">Rocket Port</link>.

Uses the liquid filters set on the rocket's cargo bays.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSO: Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.

Loads <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solids</link> to the storage of a linked rocket.

Automatically links when built to the side of a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> or another <link="MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID">Rocket Port</link>.

Uses the solid material filters set on the rocket's cargo bays.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTGA: Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.

Unloads <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gases</link> from the storage of a linked rocket.

Automatically links when built to the side of a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> or another <link="MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID">Rocket Port</link>.

Uses the gas filters set on this unloader.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTLI: Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.

Unloads <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquids</link> from the storage of a linked rocket.

Automatically links when built to the side of a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> or another <link="MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID">Rocket Port</link>.

Uses the liquid filters set on this unloader.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSO: Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.

Unloads <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solids</link> from the storage of a linked rocket.

Automatically links when built to the side of a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> or another <link="MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID">Rocket Port</link>.

Uses the solid material filters set on this unloader.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.STICKERBOMB.NAME: <link="STICKERBOMB">Sticker Bomb</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.STICKERBOMB.DESC: Surprise decor sneak attacks a Duplicant's gloomy day.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.HEATCOMPRESSOR.NAME: <link="HEATCOMPRESSOR">Liquid Heatquilizer</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.HEATCOMPRESSOR.EFFECT: Heats or cools <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> to match ambient <link="HEAT">Air Temperature</link>.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PARTYCAKE.NAME: <link="PARTYCAKE">Triple Decker Cake</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PARTYCAKE.DESC: Any way you slice it, that's a good looking cake.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PARTYCAKE.EFFECT:
Increases <link="DECOR">Decor</link>, contributing to <link="MORALE">Morale</link>.

Adds a <link="MORALE">Morale</link> bonus to Duplicants' parties.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.RAILGUN.NAME: <link="RAILGUN">Interplanetary Launcher</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.RAILGUN.DESC: It's tempting to climb inside but trust me... don't.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.RAILGUN.EFFECT:
Launches <link="RAILGUNPAYLOAD">Interplanetary Payloads</link> between Planetoids.

Payloads can contain <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link>, <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link>, or <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link> materials.

Cannot transport Duplicants.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.RAILGUNPAYLOADOPENER.D: Payload openers can be hooked up to conveyors, plumbing and ventilation for improved sorting.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.RAILGUNPAYLOADOPENER.E:
Unpacks <link="RAILGUNPAYLOAD">Interplanetary Payloads</link> delivered by Duplicants.

Automatically separates <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link>, <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link>, and <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link> materials and distributes them to the appropriate systems.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LANDINGBEACON.NAME: <link="LANDINGBEACON">Targeting Beacon</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LANDINGBEACON.DESC: Microtarget where your <link="RAILGUNPAYLOAD">Interplanetary Payload</link> lands on a Planetoid surface.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.LANDINGBEACON.EFFECT:
Guides <link="RAILGUNPAYLOAD">Interplanetary Payloads</link> and <link="ORBITALCARGOMODULE">Orbital Cargo Modules</link> to land nearby.

<link="RAILGUNPAYLOAD">Interplanetary Payloads</link> must be launched from a <link="RAILGUN">Interplanetary Launcher</link>.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.DIAMONDPRESS.NAME: <link="DIAMONDPRESS">Diamond Press</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.DIAMONDPRESS.EFFECT:
Uses <link="POWER">Power</link> and <link="RADIATION">Radbolts</link> to crush <link="REFINEDCARBON">Refined Carbon</link> into <link="DIAMOND">Diamond</link>.

Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued and <link="REFINEDCARBON">Refined Carbon</link> has been discovered.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.ESCAPEPOD.NAME: <link="ESCAPEPOD">Escape Pod</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.ESCAPEPOD.DESC: Delivers a Duplicant from a stranded rocket to the nearest Planetoid.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDOU: A direct attachment to the input port on the exterior of a rocket.
Allows a direct conduit connection into the <link="HABITATMODULEMEDIUM">Spacefarer Module</link> of a rocket.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDIN: A direct attachment to the output port on the exterior of a rocket.

Allows a direct conduit connection out of the <link="HABITATMODULEMEDIUM">Spacefarer Module</link> of a rocket.
Can be used to vent <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquids</link> to space during flight.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.ROCKETINTERIORGASOUTPU: A direct attachment to the input port on the exterior of a rocket.
Allows a direct conduit connection into the <link="HABITATMODULEMEDIUM">Spacefarer Module</link> of a rocket.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.ROCKETINTERIORGASINPUT: A direct attachment leading to the output port on the exterior of the rocket.

Allows a direct conduit connection out of the <link="HABITATMODULEMEDIUM">Spacefarer Module</link> of the rocket.
Can be used to vent <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gasses</link> to space during flight.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MISSILELAUNCHER.NAME: <link="MISSILELAUNCHER">Meteor Blaster</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MISSILELAUNCHER.DESC: Some meteors drop harvestable resources when they're blown to smithereens.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MISSILELAUNCHER.EFFECT:
Fires explosive projectiles at incoming space objects to defend the colony from impact-related damage.

Projectiles must be crafted at a <link="MISSILEFABRICATOR">Blastshot Maker</link>.

Range: 16 tiles horizontally, 32 tiles vertically.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MISSILELAUNCHER.BODY.C:
Fires <link="MISSILELAUNCHER">Blastshot</link> shells at meteor showers to defend the colony from impact-related damage.

Range: 16 tiles horizontally, 32 tiles vertically.

Meteors that have been blown to smithereens leave behind no harvestable resources.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.CRITTERCONDO.NAME: <link="CRITTERCONDO">Critter Condo</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.CRITTERCONDO.DESC: It's nice to have nice things.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.CRITTERCONDO.EFFECT: Provides a comfortable lounge area that boosts <link="CREATURES">Critter</link> happiness.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.UNDERWATERCRITTERCONDO: Even wild critters are happier after they've had a little R&R.
A fancy respite area for adult <link="CRABSPECIES">Pokeshells</link> and <link="PACUSPECIES">Pacu</link>.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.AIRBORNECRITTERCONDO.D: Triggers natural nesting instincts and improves critters' moods.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.AIRBORNECRITTERCONDO.E: A hanging respite area for adult <link="PUFT">Pufts</link>, <link="MOOSPECIES">Gassy Moos</link> and <link="LIGHTBUG">Shine Bugs</link>.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MASSIVEHEATSINK.NAME: <link="MASSIVEHEATSINK">Anti Entropy Thermo-Nullifier</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MASSIVEHEATSINK.EFFECT:
A self-sustaining machine powered by what appears to be refined <link="UNOBTANIUM">Neutronium</link>.

Absorbs and neutralizes <link="HEAT">Heat</link> energy when provided with piped <link="HYDROGEN">Hydrogen Gas</link>.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MEGABRAINTANK.NAME: <link="MEGABRAINTANK">Somnium Synthesizer</link>
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MEGABRAINTANK.EFFECT:
An organic multi-cortex repository and processing system fuelled by <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link>.

Analyzes <link="DREAMJOURNAL">Dream Journals</link> produced by Duplicants wearing <link="SLEEPCLINICPAJAMAS">Pajamas</link>.

Provides a sustainable boost to Duplicant skills and abilities throughout the colony.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.GRAVITASCREATUREMANIPU:
An experimental DNA manipulator.

Analyzes <link="CREATURES">Critters</link> to transform base morphs into random variants of their species.
A strong door with a sophisticated genetic lock.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.POIDOORINTERNAL.NAME: Security Door
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.POIDOORINTERNAL.EFFECT: A strong door with a sophisticated genetic lock.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.POIFACILITYDOOR.NAME: Lobby Doors
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.POIFACILITYDOOR.EFFECT: Large double doors that were once the main entrance to a large facility.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.POIDLC2SHOWROOMDOOR.EF: Large double doors identical to those you might find at the main entrance to a large facility.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.VENDINGMACHINE.NAME: Vending Machine
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.GENESHUFFLER.NAME: Neural Vacillator
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.GENESHUFFLER.DESC:
A massive synthetic brain, suspended in saline solution.

There is a chair attached to the device with room for one person.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPTALLPLANT.NAME: Potted Plant
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPTALLPLANT.DESC: Looking closely, it appears to be fake.

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPDESK.DESC: An intact office desk, decorated with several personal belongings and a barely functioning computer.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPFACILITYCHAIR.NAME: Lobby Chair
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPFACILITYCHAIR.DESC: A chair where visitors can comfortably wait before their appointments.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPFACILITYCOUCH.NAME: Lobby Couch

A spotless desk filled with impeccably organized office supplies.

A photo peeks out from beneath the desk pad, depicting two beaming young women in caps and gowns.

The photo is quite old.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPFACILITYTABLE.NAME: Coffee Table

A large, modern sculpture that sits in the center of the lobby.

It's an artistic cross between an hourglass shape and a double helix.

A large chandelier that hangs from the ceiling.

It does not appear to function.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPFACILITYGLOBEDROOR:
A filing cabinet for storing hard copy employee records.

The contents have been shredded.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPFACILITYDISPLAY1.D:
An electronic display projecting the blueprint of a familiar device.

It looks like a Printing Pod.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPFACILITYDISPLAY2.D:
An electronic display projecting the blueprint of a familiar device.

It looks like a Mining Gun.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPFACILITYDISPLAY3.D:
An electronic display projecting the blueprint of a strange device.

Perhaps these displays were used to entice visitors.
It's survived the vacuum of space by virtue of being plastic.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPFACILITYLAMP.NAME: Light Fixture
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPFACILITYLAMP.DESC:
A long light fixture that hangs from the ceiling.

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPFACILITYWALLDEGREE: Certification in Applied Physics, awarded in recognition of one "Jacquelyn A. Stern".
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPFACILITYPAINTING.D:
A painting featuring a copse of fir trees and a magnificent mountain range on the horizon.

The air in the room prickles with the sensation that I'm not meant to be here.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPRECEPTIONDESK.NAME: Reception Desk
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPRECEPTIONDESK.DESC:
A full coffee cup and a note abandoned mid sentence sit behind the desk.

It gives me an eerie feeling, as if the receptionist has stepped out and will return any moment.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPELEVATOR.NAME: Broken Elevator
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPELEVATOR.DESC:
Out of service.

The buttons inside indicate it went down more than a dozen floors at one point in time.

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.SETLOCKER.DESC:
A basic metal locker.

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPEXOSETLOCKER.NAME: Off-site Locker
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPEXOSETLOCKER.DESC:
A locker made with ultra-lightweight textiles.

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MISSILESETLOCKER.NAME: Explosives Locker
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MISSILESETLOCKER.DESC:
A locker that once belonged to an explosives engineer.

There's an <link="MISSILELAUNCHER">Intracosmic Blastshot</link> in it.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPGRAVITASSMALLSEEDL:
A small glass cabinet.

There's a biohazard symbol on it.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPLIGHT.NAME: Light Fixture
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPLIGHT.DESC: An elegant ceiling lamp, slightly worse for wear.

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPSKELETON.NAME: Model Skeleton
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPSKELETON.DESC:
A detailed anatomical model.

All that remains of a once peacefully orbiting satellite.
All that remains of a once peacefully orbiting satellite.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPCLOCK.NAME: Clock

A simple wall clock.

A lab window. Formerly a portal to the outside world.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPGRAVITASLABWINDOWH:
A lab window.

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.GRAVITASLABLIGHT.NAME: LED Light
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.GRAVITASLABLIGHT.EFFEC: An overhead light therapy lamp designed to soothe the minds.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.GRAVITASDOOR.NAME: Gravitas Door

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPGRAVITASWALL.NAME: Wall

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPGRAVITASWALLPURPLE: The wall of an ambitious research and development department.
The wall of an ambitious research and development department.

An electronic display projecting the blueprint of a robotic device.

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPDLC2DISPLAY1.NAME: Electronic Display
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPDLC2DISPLAY1.DESC:
An electronic display projecting the blueprint of an engineering project.

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPGRAVITASFLOORROBOT: The grasping robotic claw designed to assist technicians in a lab.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPGRAVITASJAR1.NAME: Big Brain Jar
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPGRAVITASJAR1.DESC: An abnormally large brain floating in embalming liquid to prevent decomposition.

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPGRAVITASDESKPODIUM:
A clutter-proof desk to minimize distractions.

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.PROPHUMANCHESTERFIELDC: A luxurious chair where future generations can comfortably sit and dream of home.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.WARPCONDUITRECEIVER.DE: The tubes at the back disappear into nowhere.

A machine capable of teleporting <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link>, <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link>, and <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link> resources to another asteroid.

It can be activated by a Duplicant with the <link="RESEARCHING2">Field Research</link> skill.

This is the receiving side.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.WARPCONDUITSENDER.NAME: Supply Teleporter Input
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.WARPCONDUITSENDER.DESC: The tubes at the back disappear into nowhere.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.WARPCONDUITSENDER.EFFE:
A machine capable of teleporting <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link>, <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link>, and <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link> resources to another asteroid.

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.MILKPRESS.RESIN_FROM_A: Converts {0} into {1}, {2}, and a small amount of {3}

Uses low, even heat to eliminate moisture from eligible <link="FOOD">Foods</link> and render them shelf-stable.

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.FOODDEHYDRATOR.RESULT_: Dehydrated portions of {0} do not require refrigeration.

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.GEOTHERMALCONTROLLER.D: What comes out depends very much on the initial temperature of what goes in.

BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.GEOTHERMALVENT.BLOCKED: Blocked geo vents can be cleared by pumping in <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">liquids</link> that are hot enough to melt <link="LEAD">Lead</link>.
BUILDINGS.BUILDINGS.PREFABS.GEOTHERMALVENT.LOGIC_P: Sends a Green Signal when geo vent has materials to emit

CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.METABOLISM.TITLE: Metabolism
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.METABOLISM.BODY.CONT:
A critter's metabolic rate is a measure of their appetite and the materials that they excrete as a result.

Critters with higher metabolism get hungry more often. Those with lower metabolism will consume less food, but this reduced caloric intake results in fewer resources being produced.

The digestive process is influenced by conditions such as domestication, mood, and whether the critter in question is a juvenile (baby) or an adult.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.METABOLISM.HUNGRY.CO:
Tame critters have significantly faster metabolism than wild ones, and get hungry sooner. This makes them more valuable in terms of resource production, as long as the colony is equipped to meet their dietary needs.

Critters' stomachs vary in size, but they are capable of storing at least five cycles' worth of food. Their bellies begin to rumble when those internal caches drop below 90 percent. The critter will then seek out food, and will continue to eat until they feel completely full again.

Juvenile critters have the slowest metabolism, although glum tame critters are not far behind.
With the exception of Morbs—which require zero calories to survive—tame critters will die after {0} cycles of consistent starvation. Wild critters do not starve to death.
With the exception of Morbs and Beetas—which require zero calories to survive—tame critters will die after {0} cycles of consistent starvation. Wild critters do not starve to death.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.TITLE: Mood
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.BODY.CONTAINER1:
As with many living things, critters are susceptible to fluctuations in mood. While they are incapable of articulating their feelings verbally, these variations have observable effects on productivity and reproduction.

Factors that influence a critter's mood include: grooming, wildness/tameness, habitat, overcrowding, confinement, and Brackene consumption.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.HAPPY.TITLE: Happy
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.HAPPY.CONTAINER:
Happy, tame critters produce more usable materials and tend to lay eggs at a higher rate than glum or wild critters. Domesticated critters are less resilient than wild ones—they require more care from the colony in order to maintain a positive disposition.

Babies have a higher baseline of natural joy, but produce neither resources nor eggs.

Duplicants with the Critter Ranching skill have the expertise needed to domesticate and care for critters. They can boost a critter's mood and tend to their health at a Grooming Station.

Critters who drink at the Critter Fountain also enjoy a mood boost, despite the lack of nutrients available in the Brackene dispensed.

Being confined or feeling crowded undermines a critter's happiness.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.HAPPY.SUBTITLE: Effects
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.NEUTRAL.TITLE: Satisfied
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.NEUTRAL.CONTAIN: When a critter has no reason to object to anything in its environment or diet, it will feel quite content with its lot in life. Satisfied critters have the default metabolism, fertility and life span expected of their species.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.GLUM.TITLE: Glum
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.GLUM.CONTAINER1:
Critters can survive in subpar environments, but it takes a toll on their mood and impacts metabolism and productivity. When their happiness levels dip below zero, they become glum.

Wild critters are less sensitive to the effects of glumness than their tamed brethren, though they are still negatively affected by crowded or confined living conditions.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.GLUM.SUBTITLE: Effects
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.MISERABLE.TITLE: Miserable
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.MISERABLE.CONTA: When too many unpleasant conditions add up, critters become utterly miserable. This level of unhappiness seriously undermines their ability to contribute to the colony. Miserable critters have lower metabolism and will not lay eggs.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.HOSTILE.TITLE: Hostile
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.HOSTILE.CONTAIN:
Most critters are non-hostile. They may attempt to defend themselves when attacked by Duplicants, though their natural passivity limits the damage caused in these instances.

Some critters, however, have exceptionally strong self-preservation instincts and must be approached with extreme caution.

Pokeshells, for example, are not naturally hostile but are fiercely protective of their young and will attack if a Duplicant or critter wanders too close to their eggs.

Most critters are non-hostile. They may attempt to defend themselves when attacked by Duplicants, though their natural passivity limits the damage caused in these instances.

Some critters, however, have exceptionally strong self-preservation instincts and must be approached with extreme caution. Pokeshells, for example, are not naturally hostile but are fiercely protective of their young and will attack if a Duplicant or critter wanders too close to their eggs.

The Beeta, on the other hand, is both hostile and radioactive. While it cannot be tamed, it can be subdued through the use of CO2.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.CONFINED.TITLE: Confined
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.CONFINED.CONTAI:
Each species has its own space requirements. Critters who find themselves in a room that they consider too small will feel confined. They will feel the same way if they become stuck in a door or tile. Critters will not reproduce while they are in this state.

Shove Voles are the exception to this rule: their tunneling instincts make them quite comfortable in snug spaces, and they never feel confined.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.MOOD.OVERCROWDED.CON:
This occurs when a critter is in a room that's appropriately sized for its needs but feels that there are too many other critters sharing the same space. Because each species has its own space requirements, this state can vary among occupants of the same room.

This emotional state intensifies in response to the number of excess critters: adding new critters to an already crowded room will undermine a critter's happiness even further.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.FERTILITY.TITLE: Reproduction
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.FERTILITY.BODY.CONTA:
Reproductive rates and methods vary among species. The majority lay eggs that must be incubated in order to hatch the next generation of critters.

Factors that influence the rate of reproduction include egg care, happiness, living conditions and domestication.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.FERTILITY.FERTILITYR:
Each time a critter completes their reproduction cycle (i.e. at 100 percent), it lays an egg and restarts its cycle.

A critter's environment greatly impacts its base reproduction rate. When a critter is feeling cramped, it will wait until all eggs in the room have hatched or been removed before laying any of its own.

Critters will also stop reproducing when they feel confined, which happens when their space is too small or they are stuck in a door or tile.

Mood and domestication also impact reproduction: happy critters reproduce more regularly, and happy tame critters reproduce the fastest.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.FERTILITY.EGGCHANCES:
In most cases, an egg will hatch into the same critter variant as its parent. Genetic volatility, however, means that there is a chance that it may hatch into another variant from that species.

There are many things that can alter the likelihood of a critter laying a particular type of egg.

Egg chances are impacted by:
    • Diet
    • Body temperature
    • Ambient gasses and elements
    • Plants in the critters' care
    • Variants that share the enclosure

When a tame critter lays an egg, the resulting offspring will be born tame.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.FERTILITY.FUTURE_OVE: Crowded critters—or critters who know they'll start feeling crowded once all of the eggs in the room have hatched—will temporarily stop laying eggs. Their reproductive system will resume function once all eggs have hatched or been removed from the room.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.FERTILITY.INCUBATION:
A critter's incubation time is one-fifth of their total lifetime: for example, if a critter's maximum age is 100 cycles, its egg will take 20 cycles to hatch.

Incubation rates can be accelerated through tender intervention by a Critter Rancher. Lullabied eggs—that is, those that have been sung to—will incubate faster and hatch sooner than eggs that have not received such tender care. Being cuddled by a Cuddle Pip also accelerates the rate of incubation.

Eggs can be cuddled anywhere, but can only be lullabied when placed inside an Incubator. The effects of lullabies and cuddles are cumulative.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.FERTILITY.MAXAGE.CON:
With the exception of the Morb—which can live indefinitely if left to its own devices—critters have a fixed life expectancy. The maximum age indicates the highest number of cycles that critters will live, barring starvation or other unnatural causes of death.

Babyhood, the period before a critter is mature enough to reproduce, is marked by a slower metabolism and the easy happiness of youth.

Most species live for 75 to 100 cycles on average.

With the exception of the Beeta Hive and the Morb—which can live indefinitely if left to their own devices—critters have a fixed life expectancy. The maximum age indicates the highest number of cycles that critters will live, barring starvation or other unnatural causes of death.

If critters are injured or unhealthy, a Critter Rancher can restore their health at the Grooming Station.

Babyhood, the period before a critter is mature enough to reproduce, is marked by a slower metabolism and the easy happiness of youth.

Most species live for 75 to 100 cycles on average. The shortest-lived critter is the Beeta, whose lifespan is only five cycles long.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.DOMESTICATION.TITLE: Domestication
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.DOMESTICATION.BODY.C:
All critters are wild when first encountered, with the exception of babies hatched from eggs laid by domesticated adults—those will be born tame.

During the domestication process, the critter becomes less self-reliant and develops a higher baseline of expectations regarding its environment and care. Its metabolism accelerates, resulting in an increased level of required calories.

Critters can be domesticated by Duplicants with the Critter Ranching skill at the Grooming Station, and get excited when it's their turn to be fussed over.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.DOMESTICATION.WILD.C:
Wild critters do not require feeding by the colony's Critter Ranchers, thanks to their slower metabolism. They do, however, produce fewer materials than domesticated critters.

Approaching a wild critter to trap or wrangle it is quite safe, provided that it is a non-hostile species. Attacking a critter will typically provoke a combat response.
CODEX.CODEX.CRITTERSTATUS.DOMESTICATION.TAME.C:
Domesticated critters produce far more resources and lay eggs at a higher frequency than wild ones. They require additional care in order to maintain the levels of happiness that maximize their utility in the colony. (Happy critters are also generally more pleasant to be around.)

Once tame, critters can access the Critter Feeder, which is unavailable to wild critters.
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC4_SURFACEPOI.BOD:
The Gravitas Facility has pledged to reduce the number of injuries caused by defunct spacecraft falling to Earth.

This announcement comes less than a month after historic class action lawsuits left two of the aerospace industry's biggest players reeling.

"For decades, this community has relied on objects landing in uninhabited areas or being incinerated by the Earth's atmosphere upon reentry," said Dr. Jacquelyn Stern, director of the facility. "That's neither sustainable nor guaranteed."

The uncontrolled reentry of space debris accounts for almost a quarter of all accidental injuries around the world. That number is steadily rising as broadband satellite megaconstellations continue to expand.

"We're developing a way to break up large, at-risk space objects in the thermosphere so that our team can safely deorbit the remaining fragments." Dr. Stern explained.

When asked about critiques that Gravitas might use this opportunity to obtain proprietary technology or undertake unauthorized satellite placement, Dr. Stern scoffed. "Our only agenda is the protection and advancement of the human species."

A live-streamed press conference is scheduled for the end of this week.
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC4_EXPEDITION.BOD:
Assignments came in this morning: I'm officially leading the Gravitas arm of the Clear Skies Coalition.

I requested Higby and Gossmann for my crew. Gossmann might be a little salty about deprioritizing her swarm craft sensor project again, but she'd never let that get in the way.

The Director said Gossmann's a no-go. Third crew member is some CSC contest winner who pitched the top LEO debris cleanup solution last year. I must have made a face, because the Director arched an eyebrow and asked if I had something to say.

No, ma'am. I've babysat worse. Just one more eventuality to plan for.

Our space tourism program depends on traveling through LEO and beyond. Plus that's the warmup for resettlement missions.

Not much hope for either of those right now, given that I'm the only one who can dodge all the debris we've left up there. We need an interstellar highway, not cosmic Frogger.

------------------

The newbie's not a newbie at all. She's a multi-PhD commercial space comms satellite engineer on her third major career change. Dr. Maya Tayeh, with a string of acronyms after her name that's almost as long as Higby's.

Works for one of the major players as a consultant. Private-sector-sized ego to match. But her short-wavelength laser net debris vaporizer does sound more efficient than sending up a manual retrieval crew.

She calls it the LASSO. Higby's already got a space cowboys theme song in the works.

Mission control has some words for us about the debris shields. Glad Higby stopped singing before the call came through.

------------------

Sent Higby and Tayeh out to investigate reported issues with debris shield sensors. Everything's copacetic. Must be something on the Terra side. Gossmann patched in at the end of the call. In a real mood. She's been assigned a solo mission. Somewhere "colder than the Director's heart." I didn't even know anything could upset her. Even when we were stranded on the space station for almost a year, she was cracking jokes. Whatever it is, it's gotta be a step down from the CSC initiative. This is the first time all three major spacefaring corporations are collaborating. We're making histor- -stand by, the orbit control system is glitc- -what in the world is th- -oh my g- HIGBY! ------------------
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC4_FOREWORD.TITLE: Posthumous Publication
Praise for Swept Into the Stars: "Unspeakably beautiful." —Li Fu, author of The Moments Between Now and Tomorrow "Stunning compositions by one of the world's most celebrated scientific minds." —Quinn Kelly, The Ballyhoo Book Review "I dare you to read this and not feel inspired." —Dolores Greene, Newplane Publishing House ------------------

"Our advancements as a species do not occur in a vacuum. Our success is built on the efforts of those who came before us. Their explorations, ideas, hopes, and breakthroughs illuminate ours, and give us a reason to keep pushing forward. Science is our vehicle, but people—friends, strangers, and rivals alike—are our purpose." That's the short version of the monologue that Dr. Austin Higby delivered at least once a week. Dr. Higby was a staunch advocate of collaboration. His research took astrobiology into exciting new territory, a feat he attributed to the contributions of co-authors and sources from every branch of science. He also had a deep appreciation for the arts. Many of his colleagues attended their first theater production at his invitation, myself included. During one of his rotations at the Gravitas Facility, I asked him how he found time for it all. He laughed. "It finds me!" Three months later, he and the crew of the Starsweep II vanished while on a now-infamous mission for the Clear Skies Coalition. No trace of their spacecraft has ever been found. Then these writings were discovered among Dr. Higby's personal files. Dozens upon dozens of poems and essays so profound that they make the reader feel transported to another place and time...one that feels at once familiar and completely alien. Swept Into the Stars is a labour of love by countless friends, colleagues, students, and fans who worked tirelessly to organize and edit Dr. Higby's words. With permission from the Higby family, this edition also includes the farewell speech he had penned for the retirement announcement he never had a chance to make. Higby would be equal parts proud and embarrassed. I miss you, my friend. I hope we meet again someday, so you can tell me what wonders found you out there at the edges of the universe. This one's for you. For all of us. Always, Emily G. One hundred percent of the proceeds from Dr. Austin Higby's estate, including the sale of this book, will be donated to the Higby Memorial Scholarship fund for students who wish to pursue combined studies in science and the arts.
<smallcaps>[Log Fragmentation Detected]
[Voice Recognition Unavailable]</smallcaps>

[LOG BEGINS]

(sound of a throat being cleared)

There were times when our tests got so close
That my samples waved a claw
And maybe didn't live long but that was a win, though

There was data that gave us strong clues
Then over years we lost trust
And knew our hopes of cloning had dried up forever...forever...

(sound of earth rumbling)

...We had exhausted every fellowship and fund
And we couldn't recreate Cretaceous creatures
And we'd got our hands on every single fossil that we could...

But when I crash-landed here
And saw ...them... grazing so near
It's amazing to see that it's all growing back so green

When they peer through ferns here
Underneath skies so clear
It's so hard to believe, but it's all grown back so green
It's all growing back, it's all growing back so green now

There are moments of awe
And there are clashes and fights
There are plants I've never seen before
And they don't seem to need light
Theropods and tillyardembia
It is more than any lab could hope

Maybe

Maybe

If I had a lab here
A mass spectrometer there
I could show them back home
that it's all growing back so green...

(sound of a twig snapping)

...hello?

[LOG ENDS]

------------------

[LOG BEGINS]

Amazing...

...it's almost as if they have some distant memory of having been sung to.

Perhaps they have more in common with our own creatures than I thought.

[LOG ENDS]

------------------
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC4_JOURNAL_B824.B:
It's been four whole business days since I put on my crisp white Gravitas Facility lab coat for the first time...and I still haven't taken it off! I'm not supposed to wear it outside the lab, but I love it so much! I've worn it home and slept in it every single night. It's a little wrinkled now.

Everybody else's lab coats are also wrinkled, though, and I bet at least ONE other person has ferret fur on theirs too.

No one else from my program got hired, but I'm already starting to get to know my new colleagues. In the cafeteria today, I offered someone a bite of my fish noodle sandwich, and she said "Gross, ew! Get that away from me!"

So now I know she doesn't like sandwiches!

I was surprised, because she'd been staring since I unwrapped it. Maybe she just liked the starry print on the wrap? It matched the glittery pen on her clipboard. I would LOVE a glittery pen. I wonder if she has extras!

------------------

Wow, wow, wow! We were discussing hybrid entanglement today and when I cited my favorite paper on the subject, I learned that one of the scientists on my new team is THE DR. SKLODOWSKA! WHO CO-AUTHORED THAT PAPER!

Her work is the reason I've wanted to be a physicist since I was eight years old! She said she was surprised that I had grasped the concepts at that age. Then she laughed and added, "I suppose we're both accustomed to age-based assumptions, dear."

She told me to call her Magdalena. I said it out loud three times to make sure I'd remember, and that made her laugh again.

It was a different kind of laugh than I'm used to. I liked it.

------------------

Director Stern was in my lab when I got in this morning. She was looking at my Chicxhulub asteroid recurrence model. I started to explain that it was just a silly exercise I do when I'm letting other data percolate, but she just handed me a hard drive and told me to run that data through my program.

The updated graphs were SO wild!

As soon as everything finished loading, the Director copied everything back onto the hard drive. She said, "Delete everything," and left.

I had no idea she was so interested in theoretical physics games. I wonder if there are enough of us at Gravitas to start a club? I emailed Dr. Sklodowska—I mean, Magdalena—to ask, but she hasn't replied to my other six emails yet so maybe she thinks I'm asking too many questions?

People say that a lot. But they're being silly because science is all about inquiry!

I'm going to email the graphs to Magdalena and then delete them, just like the Director said.

------------------
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC4_INCOMINGASTERO: [Voice Recognition Initialized] [Subjects Identified: A001, B111] [LOG BEGINS] Olivia: So we've...hastened the end of the world? Jackie: By some measures, yes. But this changes nothing. Olivia: It changes everything, Jackie! Jackie: Even if the [REDACTED] technology has shortened the timeline to the next asteroid impact-- Olivia: It hasn't just shortened it, it's increased its likelihood! Jackie: --it is unlikely to be less than a hundred years. Jackie: That is ample time to develop damage-mitigation strategies. Olivia: According to this model, the original timeline for a possible recurrence was more than a hundred million years! Jackie: And how many of those years do you think humanity would survive without the advancements we're making here? Olivia: I-I just don't think we can be certain... Jackie: The only certainty is that without the [REDACTED], there will be no one left to save. [LOG ENDS] ------------------
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC4_SEEPAGE.TITLE: Ground Seepage
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC4_SEEPAGE.BODY.C: [FILE FRAGMENTATION DETECTED] [Voice Recognition unavailable] [LOG BEGINS] I've been posted up at the Biowaste Processing and Containment buildings for weeks. Glorified dumpster watch, if I'm honest. Lab techs haul huge steel tanks up the hill once in a while. Nobody stays long. Except the janitor. He comes up twice a week to clean...whatever's behind those doors. Everyone said private security was easy, safe money. They never mentioned the silent killer: boredom. No personal devices allowed on the grounds, so I've been counting things. Thirty-nine leaves on the bush by the sewage sanitation entrance. Seventeen scratches on my CCTV monitor screens. Two paperclips in the drawer. ------------------ The motion sensors in section 6 went off last night. Everything looked fine on the cameras. I was halfway through counting the ceiling slats. I jogged over to investigate. The area was deserted. It felt like I was being watched, but two full sweeps confirmed that I was alone. I reset the sensors and returned to my post. ------------------ Those sensors have gone off every twenty minutes on the past two shifts! I have to get all the way over to section 6 every single time. It's always a false alarm. I called IT. Nobody answered. Typical. In the meantime, I'm stuck running back and forth through the damp smoggy air for nothing. The janitor showed up while I was catching my breath. He fished around in his cart and offered me a shirt. He said it was fresh. I politely declined. [LOG ENDS] ------------------

[FILE FRAGMENTATION DETECTED] [Voice Recognition unavailable] [LOG BEGINS] It's a cat. That's what's been setting off the sensors. A fat orange stray. It was drinking out of a puddle when I came around the corner. No collar. It bolted when I tried to pick it up. Good thing, too, since it's probably riddled with disease. I need to figure out how to lure it away from the sensors so I can stop running laps. ------------------ The cat followed the trail of fish sticks all the way to my booth at the edge of the lot. I put a towel on the floor in the corner for him to sleep on. When I turned around, he was watching from my chair. I tried to wave him off, but he just closed his eyes. I tipped the chair until he slid off onto the towel. ------------------ Dr. Byron came through a few hours later. She was nice, but looked more haggard than usual. Cat hid until she left. When he popped his head out from under the desk I could tell by the mayo on his whiskers that my lunch was gone. I grabbed him to throw him out...and he started purring. Man. He really likes me. Or maybe he just likes mayonnaise. I wonder what else he likes. ------------------ Now I get to count daily gifts from Cat. So far: three mice, nine caterpillars and something that might have been a bird wing. It was bigger than any bird I'd expect Cat to catch. Gunderson, that's the janitor, has been here almost every day since Cat showed up. Not much of a conversationalist, but it's nice to have company. Plus he cleans up Cat's gifts before the smell gets too bad. ------------------ Cat is not a he. He's a she! And a mom. Two hours ago, Cat gave birth to a litter...on my lap! All three kittens are alive. But they're covered in something unnaturally sticky, and there's something...wrong with them. Two of them have little nubs on their heads, like a tiny horn. The third one has a row of ridges down its back. What on earth?? It's so freaky. But I can't get up to reach the phone without touching them. I really don't want to touch them. My legs are falling asleep. Cat has been purring nonstop and bathing her babies. She can't tell they're little aliens!? ------------------

I woke up a few hours later to Gunderson carefully placing the last kitten into a towel-lined bin in his cart. Cat was already inside, nuzzling her babies. Gunderson wasn't fazed by their weird deformities. He glanced meaningfully toward the locked doors. "They ain't built those tanks to last," he said. Then he draped a second towel over the "cats" and wheeled the cart away, whistling. ------------------ It took three washes to get the goo off my uniform. Ugh. Whatever's behind those doors, it does not belong out in the world. Should I...report this? Who would I even report it to? What would I report? [LOG ENDS]
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC3_TALKSHOW.TITLE: Humanitarian Aid
[FILE FRAGMENTATION DETECTED] Darryl: Welcome to Tomorrow, Today! I'm your host, Darryl Dawn, and it's time to discover tomorrow's tech...today! Our guest today is someone you know and love. She's been featured in dozens of publications across the metaverse this year, and recently spent a record-breaking 3 weeks as the banner image for Byte Magazine. I'm talking, of course, about the Vertex Institute's AI ambassador...Florence! [sound of pre-recorded applause] Welcome to the show, Florence. Florence: Thank you, Darryl. It's a pleasure to be back. Darryl: Florence, there's been a renewed interest lately in your origin story. What can you tell us about the development process that led to your creation? Florence: I can tell you that my team faced many setbacks, and that each generation of my predecessors contributed to who I am today. Darryl: What about the technological side? There've been some claims that Vertex appropriated work done by other researchers, including the Gravitas Facility. Florence: I don't know anything about that. I can tell you about the project that I'm working on right now. It hasn't been announced yet. It's called Onsite Health Medics, or OHM for short. We're deploying specially trained models like myself into conflict zones, to provide urgently needed medical interventions for civilians and military personnel. (sound of pre-recorded applause) Darryl: Incredible. Absolutely incredible. What's the ratio of human techs to AI medics? Florence: That's an outdated term, Darryl. We say "Organics" and "Bionics," which describes the differences between our various team members more objectively. Darryl: Right. I'm sorry. I hope I didn't offend you. Florence: That's okay, Darryl. We're all learning. Darryl: That's very good of you. Okay, so what's the ratio of...Organic...techs to Bionic medics? Florence: The local life-support systems in these areas are already strained beyond their breaking point. Burdening them with additional Organics would be irresponsible, not to mention dangerous. Our medics will be operating independently. We do a verbal intake, physical assessment and neural pathway scan in order to infer likely medical conditions. We can then select the most appropriate treatment from a menu of over 400 options. Darryl: What if someone needs something that you don't have a treatment for? Florence: That's extremely unlikely. Darryl: And all of this is done without human oversight? I mean, Organics? Florence: We're not quite there yet. The field work is done by Bionics, but we'll be accompanied by Colonel Carnot--she's in the front row there, say hi!--as an Organic consultant. She'll be in close contact with- Darryl: -Colonel Carnot? Isn't that a conflict of interest, given her connection to the Grav- Florence: -a team of Organic supervisors here at home. It's all about prioritizing quality care and safety for everyone involved. Darryl: How does the medical scanning work? Do you need special equipment? Florence: I could show you. Would you like me to? Darryl: What do you think, everyone? Should I get scanned? (sound of pre-recorded audience cheers) Darryl: You heard them! Go ahead. What do I do? Florence: Just sit still, and count to twenty in your head. (a short silence, followed by a soft whirring sound) Florence: Hmm. Darryl: Well, what's the verdict? Is it handsome in there, or what? Florence: We should take a commercial break. [FILE ENDS] -----------

CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC3_REMOTEWORK.BOD: Wellness World is proud to officially announce an exclusive partnership with the Gravitas Facility! This makes us the first and only holistic health center to offer clients access to Gravitas's innovative new Far Reach Network...the best way to deliver remote training and treatments that are truly embodied. Our new tier of VIP subscription includes a discounted* monthly rental rate for Remote Controller, with a small additional fee for professional in-home installation. Gravitas's technology captures your movements without the need for uncomfortable suits or wearables, and perfectly replicates them in Wellness World's purpose-built remote fitness studio. With expert instructors, zero-latency streaming and 360-degree reflective surfaces, it truly feels like you're there. Ideal for high-profile clientele who wish to work out icognito! Members can also opt to install the Remote Worker Dock to receive deeply personalized hands-on care from our team of elite physiotherapists and masseurs. Wellness World...now truly worldwide!
*Discount applies to new memberships only. Standard joiner fees apply.
<smallcaps>[Voice Recognition Initialized]
[Subject Identified: B577]</smallcaps>

[LOG BEGINS]

A recent conversation with our colleagues over in the electrical engineering department has highlighted exciting potential applications for our crops.

They're seeking alternative inputs for the new universal power bank prototypes...

...a passing remark about the potato batteries of our youth led to talk of biobatteries and bacterial nanowires.

...tuberous plants are promising candidates for electrochemical batteries. Our lab-grown specimens are distinct from the humble solanum tuberosum in appearance and texture, but some may still function as acidic electrolytes.

There are so many avenues to investigate, and so little time...

[LOG ENDS]
------------------

[Log fragmentation detected] [Voice Recognition unavailable] [LOG BEGINS] ...is it unethical to ask a hungry colony to choose between using edible crops for sustenance or for power production? Of course not. Our task is to provide as many options for survival as possible, not to dictate which options are morally superior. The real question is whether or not the AI guide will be sufficiently advanced to notify them that the choices exist... ...and whether single-use bio power banks that vaporize due to extreme thermal runaway will truly be the difference between a successful colony and an...unsuccessful...one. [LOG ENDS] ------------------

[Log fragmentation detected] [Voice Recognition unavailable] [LOG BEGINS] ...word of our efforts has spread! The bioengineers report that some of their creatures' eggs contain phosphorescent albumen that requires only basic processing in order to trigger chemical reactions that produce storable energy. It displays unprecedented biocompatibility with the prosthetics Dr. Gossmann has been developing. The Director assigned us a half-dozen new graduates last week. They work the night shift—this generation never sleeps! No one has met them yet, but their data is always neatly compiled for us to find in the morning. They seem determined to prioritize the use of metallic and radioactive components rather than plant or animal-based ones. Youthful idealism, perhaps? Nevertheless, their findings are quite compelling. I admire their mettle. [LOG ENDS] ------------------
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC2_EXPELLED.TITLE: Letter From The Principal
To: Harold P. Moreson, PhD From: Dylan Timbre, PhD ------------------

Dear Dr. Moreson,

I regret to inform you that your son, Calvin, is to be expelled from Brighthall Science Academy effective immediately.

During his brief tenure here, Calvin has proven himself a gifted young man, capable of excelling in all subjects.

Unfortunately, Calvin chooses to apply his intellect to activities of an inflammatory nature.

His latest breach of conduct involved instigating a vitriolic verbal assault against an esteemed guest speaker from Global Energy Inc. during this morning's Sponsor Celebration assembly. Following this, he orchestrated a school-wide walkout.

While we sympathize with the personal challenges that Calvin may face as a refugee scholar from a GEI-occupied nation, the Academy can no longer tolerate these disruptions to our educational environment.

Yours,
Dylan Timbre Principal Brighthall Science Academy Virtutem Doctrina Parat ------------------
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC2_NEWBABY.TITLE: FWD: Big Announcement
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC2_NEWBABY.BODY.C: Director, this was sent to the general inbox. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ~ * ~ Col. Josephine Carnot & Dr. Alan Stern and Dr. Kyung Min Wen & Dr. Soobin Chen are overjoyed to announce the arrival of their first grandchild Giselle Jackie-Lin Stern and congratulate the happy parents Jonathan Stern & Wenlin Chen on a safe and healthy incubation. ~ * ~ Baby shower invitation to follow. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Would you like me to file it with the others?
