CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC2_CLEANUP.TITLE: Sanitation Order
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC2_CLEANUP.BODY.C:
Submitted by: B. Boson
Employee ID: X002
Department: Gravitas Intellectual Property Management

Job Details:

Require one (1) Robotics Engineer to travel solo to [REDACTED]. Engineer will print, program and maintain a P.E.G.G.Y. crew of eight (8) units.

Engineer will catalog all Project [REDACTED] debris.

All proprietary equipment to be returned to Facility grounds for investigation. Organic and biohazardous debris may be disposed of onsite at Engineer's discretion.

Candidate: Dr. E. Gossmann

Scope of cleanup area: [REDACTED] sq mi.
*This is an estimate only.

Timeline: 54 Ceres days (equival. 6 days at origin).

Other comments:
1. Liability waiver, power of attorney and NDA attached.
2. Allow up to 0.5 hours for signal transmission from [REDACTED], depending on orbital positioning.
3. All relevant correspondence to be sent directly to bboson@gipm.nova.

Signature: [REDACTED]
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC2_ECOTOURISM.BOD: Fascinating. I had not expected him to score quite so highly, but he is uncommonly charismatic. If I can secure a replacement, perhaps he can be of service to Dr. Techna. In the meantime, proceed as planned...with appropriate caution.

<indent=5%>Director,

Understood. No further assessments will be conducted.

One of the residents has already met with Dr. Olowe. I have attached his results below. They're incompatible with our goals, and honestly kind of frightening.

Should I exclude him from the training?</indent>

<indent=5%>These individuals were recruited by me personally, for reasons far above your pay grade. As such, consider them pre-vetted.

Failure to meet this project's timelines could mean failure in every timeline. Am I making myself clear?</indent>

<indent=5%>Director,

I've processed the first round of prospective sojourners.

Given that the applicants have no formal training in space travel, I've asked Dr. Olowe to conduct a thorough assessment of their psychological and emotional fitness.

Once his tests are complete, the prospective residents will be sent down to the biodome to begin their training.</indent></color>
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC2_THEARCHIVE.BOD: Welcome! Welcome! Welcome! Everything is under control! Your VIP package includes: - An exclusive set of bespoke survival-supporting technology! - A comprehensive Tenants' Handbook with everything you need to maintain homeostasis in your new Home! [MISSING ATTACHMENT] When life gets you down, popular wisdom says to look up! That is incorrect! Please direct your attention downward! This will ensure a pleasant stretch for tense cervical muscles. It will also help you locate the color-coded lines painted on the ground, directing you to the sustainably heated Comfort Quarters down below. And remember: Survival is Success! Gravitas accepts no liability for death, disability, personal injury, or emotional and psychological damage that may occur during residency. Please consult your booking agent for details.
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC2_VOICEMAIL.BODY: [File fragmentation detected] [Voice Recognition unavailable] [LOG BEGINS] ...Grandfather? ...one of your cardigan-wearing interns just dropped off a letter saying you're going to SPACE?? Have you gone mad? It's dated a week from now... the young fellow went completely red when he realized he'd delivered it early. I tried Miranda, and she says she hasn't heard from you since the Sustainable Futures summit. She said something about some sort of training session. Only no one at the office knows what she's on about. How am I meant to explain your absence tomorrow? GEI's going to be absolutely livid. If they back out of this deal, it won't be just the underlings who get laid off. ...What exactly do you think you'll achieve, trapped in space with four strangers for the rest of your miserable existence? You're a business man, not a bloody astronaut! Not to mention there's a war on! Who's to say your ground control team won't be dead within the year? [Sound of several phones starting to ring off the hook.] I've got to go. Call me back or I'm going straight to the Board. [FILE ENDS]
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC2_EARTHQUAKE.BOD: This morning's earthquake was an unusual one. The ground itself moved very little, but the air hummed and lapped at the walls as though it were liquid. It was so brief that I almost wondered if I'd imagined it. Then I noticed the Bow. It has thus far been unaffected by seismic disruptions, but in the past few hours there has been a marked increase in the audibility of its machinations and a 0.19 percent decrease in output. I've assigned a technician to investigate. We cannot afford to lose even the smallest amount of power at this stage. No one else seems to have noticed anything other than Dr. Ali. He says that the remote research access point project was also affected. It seems that the disruption restarted the entire teleportation system. The monitor is now displaying multiple shipping confirmation messages, despite the target building remaining in the departure dock. Reports show that an unknown number of access point blueprints have been disseminated. One shipment does appear to have reached Ceres, luckily, though it's quite far from the landing site. Dr. Ali's entire team is working to determine how many others exist, and pinpoint their geographic and temporal locations. I am not optimistic. The geologists insist that their equipment has recorded no seismic activity at all for several days. It begs the question: What was it, if not an earthquake? Where did this event originate? Dr. Ali quipped that maybe a Bow had malfunctioned in another timeline, which is absurd. Isn't it?
CODEX.CODEX.INVESTIGATIONS.DLC2_GEOTHERMALTEST: [Voice Recognition Initialized] [Subject Identified: B224] [LOG BEGINS] (throat clearing) Hello? Is this thing on? (sound of tapping on a microphone) Here we go. Ahem. Tests are progressing as anticipated and results have exceeded our hopes, particularly in regards to thermal threshold. Coming in "hot," as we used to say! (cough) Anyway. First we introduced twelve tons of brackish aquifer water cooled to sixty-five degrees. This yielded clean steam, as well as soil, salt and trace minerals. As expected. Okay, so now we flush the system... Ramp up the temperature in the water tank and run it through at two hundred degrees. (sound of liquid rushing through pipes) Clear the steam so we can- (sound of a small clang) Hang on, there's some kind of debris... We have to be cautious, one small obstruction in this system could be catastrophi- Wait, are those... oxidized iron nuggets? But how... All I changed was the tempera- Get me twelve tons of...uh, oil! Stat! Sorry, please. [LOG ENDS] ------------------ [LOG BEGINS] (long silence) (sound of machinery powering down) ...unbelievable. [LOG ENDS]
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.MEGA_BRAIN_TANK.NAME: Somnium Synthesizer
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.MEGA_BRAIN_TANK.DESCR:
Power up a colossal relic from Gravitas's underground sleep lab.

When Duplicants sleep, their minds are blissfully blank and dream-free. But under the right conditions, things could be...different.
Power up a colossal relic from Gravitas's underground sleep lab.
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.MEGA_BRAIN_TANK.BEGIN:
I've discovered a new dream-analyzing building buried deep inside our asteroid.

It seems to contain new sleep-specific suits...could these be the key to unlocking my Duplicants' ability to dream?

I've often wondered what they might be capable of, once their imaginations were awakened.
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.MEGA_BRAIN_TANK.END_P:
Meeting the initial quota of dream content analysis has triggered a surge of electromagnetic activity that appears to be enhancing performance for Duplicants everywhere.

If my Duplicants can keep this building fuelled with Dream Journals, perhaps we will continue to reap this benefit.

A small side compartment has also popped open, revealing an unfamiliar object.

A keepsake, perhaps?
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.MEGA_BRAIN_TANK.SEEDS:
<smallcaps>[Voice Recognition Initialized]
[Subject Identified: B040]</smallcaps>

[LOG BEGINS]

Three days ago, we completed our first non-fatal Duplicant trial of Nikola's comprehensive synapse microanalysis and mirroring process. Five hours from now, Subject #901 will make history as our first human test subject.

Even at the Vertex Institute, which is twice Gravitas's size, I could've spent half my career waiting for approval to advance to human trials for such an invasive process! But Director Stern is too invested in this work to let it stagnate.

My darling Bruce always said that when you're on the right path, the universe conspires to help you. He'd be so proud of the work we do here.

[LOG ENDS]

[LOG BEGINS]

My bio-printed multi-cerebral storage chambers (or "mega minds" as I've been calling them) are working! Just in time to save my job.

The Director's been getting increasingly impatient about our struggle to maintain the integrity of our growing datasets during extraction and processing. The other day, she held my report over a Bunsen burner until the flames reached her fingertips.

I can only imagine how much stress she's under.

The whole world is counting on us.

[LOG ENDS]

[LOG BEGINS]

On a hunch, I added dream content analysis to the data and...wow. Oneirology may be scientifically "fluffy", but integrating subconscious narratives has produced a new type of brainmap - one with more latent potential for complex processing.

If these results are replicable, we might be on the verge of unlocking the secret to creating synthetic life forms with the capacity to evolve beyond blindly following commands.

Nikola says that's irrelevant for our purposes. Surely Director Stern would disagree.

[LOG ENDS]

[LOG BEGINS]

Nikola gave me a dataset to plug into the mega minds. He wouldn't say where it came from, but even if he had...nothing could have prepared me for what it contained.

When he saw my face, he muttered something about how people should call me "Tremors," not "Nails" and sent me on my lunch break.

All I could think about was those poor souls.

Did they have souls?

...do we?

[LOG ENDS]

[LOG BEGINS]

It's done. My adjustments to the memory transfer protocol are hardcoded into the machine.

I finished just as Nikola stormed in.

I may be too much of a coward to stand up for those unfortunate creatures, but with these new parameters in place...someday, they might be able to stand up for themselves.

[LOG ENDS]
------------------
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.CRITTER_MANIPULATOR.D:
Explore a revolutionary genetic manipulation device designed for critters.

Whether or not it was ever used on non-critter subjects is unclear. Its DNA database has been wiped clean.
Explore a revolutionary genetic manipulation device designed for critters.
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.CRITTER_MANIPULATOR.B:
I've discovered an experiment designed to analyze the evolutionary dynamics of critter mutation.

Once it has gathered enough data, it could prove extremely useful for genetic manipulation.
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.CRITTER_MANIPULATOR.E:
Success! Sufficient samples collected.

I can now trigger genetic deviations in base morphs by sending them through the scanner.

Existing variants can also be scanned, but their genetic makeup is too unstable to tolerate further manipulation.
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.CRITTER_MANIPULATOR.U: The <link="GRAVITASCREATUREMANIPULATOR">Critter Flux-O-Matic</link> has analyzed these critter species:

DNA results confirm: this species is the very definition of "icky".

FAILURE TO FLUX: Unknown Species

This species cannot be identified due to a malfunction in the genome-parsing software.

Please note that kicking the building's exterior is unlikely to correct this issue and may result in permanent damage to the system.

Specimen attempted to snack on the buccal smear. Sample is viable, though the apparatus may be somewhat mangled.

Atomic force microscopy of the bite pattern reveals traces of goethite, a mineral notable for its exceptional strength.

This critter kept trying to befriend the reflective surfaces of the scanner's interior.

During examination, it cycled through a consistent pattern of four rapid flashes of light, a brief pause and two flashes, followed by a longer pause.

Its cells appear to contain a mutated variation of oxyluciferin similar to those catalogued in bioluminescent animals.
Incessant wriggling made it difficult to scan this critter. Difficult, but not impossible.

This critter hardly seemed to notice it was being examined at all.

The built-in scanning electron microscope has determined that the fibers on this critter's train grow in a sort of trinity stitch pattern, reminiscent of a well-crafted sweater.

The critter's leathery skin remains cool and dry, however, likely due to an apparent lack of sweat glands.
DNA results confirm: this species is the scientific definition of "icky".

This critter bumped up against the building's interior repeatedly during scanning. Despite this, its skin remains surprisingly free of contusions.

Fluorescence imaging reveals extremely low neuronal activity. Was this critter asleep during analysis?

This species flopped wildly during analysis. Surfaces that came into contact with its scales now display a thin layer of viscous scum. It does not appear to be corrosive.

Initiating fumigation sequence to neutralize fishy odor.

WARNING: METHANE OVERLOAD. This scanner was unable to analyze this subject due to overheating caused by excessive gas production.

This organism's genetic makeup will remain shrouded in mystery.
This critter felt right at home in the cramped scanning bed. It can't wait to come back!

This species has a secondary set of inner eyelids that act as a barrier against ocular splinters.

The surfaces of these secondary eyelids are a translucent blue and display a light crosshatch texture.

This has broad implications for the critter's vision, meriting further exploration.

This species responded to the hum of the scanner machinery by waving its pincers in gestures that seemed to mimic iconic moves of the disco dance era.

Is it possible that it might have been exposed to music at some point in its evolution?

Specimen responded gently to the probative apparatus, as though being careful not to cause any damage.

It also produced a series of deep, rhythmic vibrations during analysis. An attempt to communicate with the sensors, perhaps?
Warning: The electrical charge emitted by this specimen nearly short-circuited this building.

This species may not be fully sentient, but it possesses a strong collective consciousness.

It is unclear how information is communicated between members of the species. What is clear is that knowledge is being shared and passed down from one generation to another.

Monitor closely.

Specimen produced substantial stool sample directly onto scanner bed.

Remarkably, its white coat remained pristine. Analysis of coat fibers revealed that each follicle is sealed with polytetrafluoroethylene, providing strong stain resistance.

This critter's pupils appear to be permanently constricted, possibly as a result of long-term exposure to excess illumination.

Its sense of smell is extremely well-developed, however: it immediately identified areas touched by previous species, and marked each one with a small puddle of liquid ethanol.

This critter's perpetual grin grew as it observed each step of the process extremely closely.

Behavioral analysis indicates a tendency toward mischief. Close supervision - and minimal access to advanced machinery - is recommended.

This critter's x-ray imaging indicates that its cranial protrusion may not be a horn at all.

It is not composed of live bone surrounded by a keratin-and-protein shell, but rather an ennervated, calcified structure. An illogically located tooth, or perhaps a rostrum?

Fascinating.

This critter was temporarily stuck in the scanning area due to its size. It appeared to enjoy being shoved backward and forward on the conveyor belt during dislodgment.

Upon finally reaching the exit, the critter seemed confused as to why the ride was over.

On the surface of this critter's wings are thousands of microperforations. These appear to act as acoustic liners, allowing the Gnit to approach targets without the high-pitched whine of its wingbeats giving away its position.

Scanning interrupted due to instrument displacement caused by specimen's lingual grasp.

Residual markings left by specimen's tongue ridges and grooves are a 72% match to a set of unmarked fingerprints from the Gravitas personnel database.

This critter attacked the transducer.

When the swallowed component was regurgitated, it was coated in microorganisms that predate this colony by at least several millenia.

Unfortunately, it was reingested before analysis was completed.
Unknown Species

FAILURE TO FLUX: This species cannot be identified due to a malfunction in the genome-parsing software.

Please note that kicking the building's exterior is unlikely to correct this issue and may result in permanent damage to the system.
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.CRITTER_MANIPULATOR.P:
<indent=5%>Another set of masticated windshield wipers has been discovered in Parking Lot D following the Bioengineering Department's critter enclosure breach last week.

Employees are strongly encouraged to plug their vehicles in at lots A-C until further notice.

Please refrain from calling municipal animal control - all critter sightings should be reported directly to Dr. Byron.</indent>
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.CRITTER_MANIPULATOR.W:
Happy 3rd work-iversary, Ada!

I drew this to fill the space left by the cabinet that your chompy critters tore off the wall last week. Hope it's big enough!

I still can't believe they can digest solid steel—you really know how to breed 'em!

- Liam
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.LONELYMINION.NAME: Mysterious Hermit
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.LONELYMINION.DESCRIPT:
Discover a reclusive character living in a Gravitas relic, and persuade them to join this colony.

Revelations from their past could have far-reaching implications for Duplicants everywhere.

Even their makeshift shelter might be of some use...
Discover a reclusive character living in a Gravitas relic, and persuade them to join this colony.
The process of recruiting this building's lone occupant involves the completion of key tasks.
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.LONELYMINION.KNOCK_KN: Approach this building and welcome its occupant
Leave this building and its occupant alone for now
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.LONELYMINION.BEGIN_PO: An unfamiliar building has been discovered in my colony. There's movement inside but whoever the inhabitant is, they seem wary of us. If we can convince them that we mean no harm, we could very well end up with a fresh recruit and a useful new building.
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.LONELYMINION.END_POPU:
My sweet Duplicants' efforts paid off! Our reclusive neighbor has agreed to join the colony.

The only keepsake he insists on bringing with him is a toolbox which, while rusty, seems to hold great sentimental value.

Now that he'll be living among us, his former home can be deconstructed or repurposed as storage.
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.LONELYMINION.PROGRESS: The hermit is suspicious of all outsiders
The hermit is keeping an eye out for more unsolicited overtures
The hermit isn't sure why everyone is being so nice
The hermit is developing warm, fuzzy feelings about this colony
The hermit is really starting to feel like he might belong here
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.LONELYMINION.GIFTRESP:
The hermit would rather be launched straight into the sun than eat this slop.

The mailbox is ready for another delivery

Tastier than the still-warm pretzel that once fell off an unsupervised desk.

The mailbox is ready for another delivery

This meal has been offered before.

The mailbox is ready for another delivery
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.LONELYMINION.ANCIENTP:
<indent=%5>Notable improvement to nutrient retention: subjects who participated in the most recent meal intake displayed minimal symptoms of gastrointestinal distress.

Mineshaft excavation at Urvara crater resumed following resolution of tunnel wall fracture. Projected time to brine reservoir penetration at current rate: 41 days, local time. Moisture seepage along eastern wall of shaft is being monitored.

Note: Preliminary subsurface temperature data is significantly lower than programmed estimates.</indent>
------------------
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.LONELYMINION.CREEPYBA: [Voice Recognition Initialized] [Subjects Identified: B577, B997, B083, A216] [LOG BEGINS] A216: The Director said there were supposed to be three of you on this task force. Where's the geneticist? B083: In the bathroom- B997: He went home. [long pause] B997: It's the holidays. He has a family. A216: We all do. That's exactly why this project is so urgent. B997: It's not our fault this stuff sat in a subterranean ocean for a year, and took another year to get back to Earth! The microbe samples didn't fare well on the journey, and most of the mechanical components are completely corroded. There's not much to- B083: -we're analyzing it all and salvaging what we can, Jea- ...Dr. Saruhashi. A216: Good. And take down those ridiculous lights. This is a lab, not a retro "shopping mall." [LOG ENDS] ------------------ [LOG BEGINS] B577: Thanks for getting all the debris packed up for disposal. B997: I thought you did that. B577: No, I- B083: Who took my sandwich? B997: Not this again. B577: Ren, did you load the shipping container? B083: Seriously, I haven't eaten in thirteen hours. This isn't funny. B997: It's a little funny. B577: Can we focus, please? B997: Nobody took your sandwich, Rock Doc. B083: Then why does my food keep going missing? B997: Maybe the lab ghost took it. Or maybe you just shouldn't leave it out overnight. Gunderson probably thought it was garbage. B083: He doesn't even clean down here! B997: Right. Because if he did, I wouldn't have to keep sweeping up the magnesium sulfate deposits that someone keeps tracking all over the floor between shifts. B083: It's not me! B577: Listen, I know we're all tired and things have been a little strange. But the sooner we get this sent up to the launchpad, the sooner it starts its trip to the sun and we can all get out of this creepy sub-sub-basement. B083: Fine. B997: Fine. B083: Fine! [LOG ENDS] ------------------
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.LONELYMINION.HOLIDAYC:
Hey kiddo,

We missed you at your cousin's wedding last weekend. The gift was nice, but the dance floor felt empty without you.

Dariush sends his love. He's really turned a corner since he started eating those gooey pudding things you sent over. Any chance you have a version that doesn't smell like feet?

Come home sometime when you're not so busy.

- Baba
------------------
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.FOSSILHUNT.NAME: Ancient Specimen
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.FOSSILHUNT.DESCRIPTIO:
This asteroid has a few skeletons in its geological closet.

Track down the fossilized fragments of an ancient critter to assemble key pieces of Gravitas history and unlock a new resource.
Track down the fossilized fragments of an ancient critter.
Unlocking full access to the fossil cache buried beneath the ancient specimen requires excavation of all deposit sites.
Unlocking full access to the fossil cache buried beneath the ancient specimen requires excavation of all deposit sites.
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.FOSSILHUNT.STATUSITEM: Fossil mine will be operated once a Duplicant is available
Select an excavation order to begin mining
Mining will begin once materials have been delivered
This fossil must be dug out before it can be excavated
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.FOSSILHUNT.UISIDESCRE: Carefully uncover and examine this fossil
Carefully uncover and examine this fossil
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.FOSSILHUNT.BEGIN_POPU:
I've discovered a fossilized critter buried in my colony—at least, part of one—but it does not resemble any of the species we have encountered on this asteroid.

Where did it come from? How did it get here? And what other questions might these bones hold the answer to?

There is only one way to find out.
My Duplicants have meticulously reassembled as much of the giant critter's scattered remains as they could find.

Their efforts have unearthed a seemingly bottomless fossil quarry beneath the largest fragment's dig site.

Nestled among the topmost bones was a handcrafted critter collar. It's too large to have belonged to any species traditionally categorized as companion animals.
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.FOSSILHUNT.ENTITIES.F:
Here lies a significant portion of the remains of an enormous, long-dead critter.

It's not from around here.

The well-preserved partial remains of a critter of unknown origin.

It appears to belong to the same ancient specimen found at another site.

This fragment has been preserved in a resin-like substance.

The well-preserved partial remains of a critter of unknown origin.

It appears to belong to the same ancient specimen found at another site.

This fragment has been preserved in <link="ICE">Ice</link>.

The well-preserved partial remains of a critter of unknown origin.

It appears to belong to the same ancient specimen found at another site.

This fragment has been preserved in petrified <link="DIRT">Dirt</link>.
Bony debris that can be excavated for <link="FOSSIL">Fossil</link>.
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.FOSSILHUNT.ICECRITTER:
<smallcaps>[Voice Recognition Initialized]
[Subject Identified: B363]</smallcaps>

[LOG BEGINS]

...Restricting our organism design to specifically target survival in an off-planet polar climate has narrowed our focus significantly, allowing development of this project to rapidly outpace the others.

We have successfully optimized for adaptive features such as the formation of protective adipose tissue at >40% of the organism's total mass. Dr. Bubare was concerned about the consequences for muscle mass, but results confirm that reductions fall within an acceptable range.

Our next step is to adapt the organism's diet. It would be inadvisable to populate a new colony with carnivorous creatures of this size.

[LOG ENDS]
------------------
[LOG BEGINS]

...When I am alone in the lab, I find myself gravitating toward the enclosure to listen to the creature's melodic vocalizations. Sometimes the pitch changes slightly as I approach.

I am not certain what that means.

[LOG ENDS]
------------------

[LOG BEGINS]

...Some of the other departments have taken to calling our work here "Project Meat Popsicle". It is a crass misnomer. This species is not designed to be a food source: it must survive the Ceres climate long enough to establish a stable population that will enable the subsequent settlement party to access the essential research data stored in its DNA via Dr. Winslow's revolutionary genome-encoding technique.

Imagine, countless yottabytes' worth of scientific documentation wandering freely around a new colony...the ultimate self-sustaining archive, providing stable data storage that requires zero technological maintenance.

It gives new meaning to the term, "living document."

[LOG ENDS]
------------------
[LOG BEGINS]

...Today is the day. My sonorous critter and her handful of progeny are ready to be transported to their new home. They are scheduled to arrive three months in the past, to ensure that they are well established before the settlement party's arrival next week.

Dr. Techna invited me to assist with the teleportation. I was relieved to be too busy to accept. I have heard rumors about previous shipments going awry. These stories are unsubstantiated, and yet...

The urgency of our mission sometimes necessitates non-ideal compromises.

The lab is so very quiet now.

[LOG ENDS]
------------------
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.FOSSILHUNT.QUEST_AVAI:
Success! My Duplicants have safely excavated a set of strange, fossilized remains.

It appears that there are more of this giant critter's bones strewn around the asteroid. It's vital that we reassemble this skeleton for deeper analysis.
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.FOSSILHUNT.UNLOCK_DNA: There was data stored in this fossilized critter's DNA
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.FOSSILHUNT.DNADATA_EN: It appears that this creature's DNA was once used as a kind of genetic storage unit.

<indent=5%>Dear [REDACTED]

We are pleased to announce that research objectives for Operation Piazzi's Planet are nearing completion. Thank you all for your patience as we navigated the unprecedented obstacles that such groundbreaking work entails.

We are aware of rumors regarding documents leaked from Dr. [REDACTED]'s files.

Rest assured that the contents of this supposed "whistleblower" effort are entirely fabricated—our technology is far too advanced to allow for the type of miscalculation that would result in OPP shipments arriving at their destination some 10,000 years prior to the targeted date.

Our IT security team is currently investigating the document's digital footprint to determine its origin.

To express our gratitude for your continued support, we would like to invite key stakeholders to a private launch party held at the Gravitas Facility. The evening will be emceed by Dr. Olivia Broussard, who will present our groundbreaking prototypes along with a five-course meal featuring lab-crafted ingredients.

Due to the sensitive nature of our work, we regret that no additional guests or dietary restrictions can be accommodated at this time.

Director Stern will be hosting a 30-minute Q&A session after dinner. Questions must be submitted at least 24 hours in advance.

Queries about the [REDACTED] papers will be disregarded.

Please be advised that the contents of this e-mail will expire three minutes from the time of opening.</indent>
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.FOSSILHUNT.HALLWAYRAC:
<indent=5%>Employees are advised that removing organisms from the bioengineering labs without an approved requisition form is strictly prohibited.

Gravitas projects are not designed to be ridden for sport. Injuries sustained during unsanctioned activities are not eligible for coverage under corporate health benefits.

Please find a comprehensive summary of company regulations attached.

<alpha=#AA>[MISSING ATTACHMENT]</indent>
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.MORB_ROVER_MAKER.NAME: Biobot Builder
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.MORB_ROVER_MAKER.DESC:
Reboot an ambitious collaborative project spearheaded by Gravitas's bioengineering and robotics departments.

If correctly rebuilt, it could save Duplicant lives.
Reboot an ambitious collaborative project spearheaded by Gravitas's bioengineering and robotics departments.
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.MORB_ROVER_MAKER.UI_S:
Empties stored <link="STEEL">Steel</link>

Disabling the building will also prevent <link="STEEL">Steel</link> from being delivered
Assign a Duplicant to restore this building's functionality
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.MORB_ROVER_MAKER.POPU:
My Duplicants have discovered a laboratory full of dusty machinery. The vestiges of another colony's experiments, perhaps?

It is unclear whether the apparatus is intended for biological experimentation or advanced mechatronics...or both.

Our restoration work is complete!

A small plaque on this building's mechanical assembly tank reads: "Pathogen-Fueled Extravehicular Geo-Exploratory Guidebot (Y)."

The adjacent tank contains the floating shape of a half-formed organism. Its vivid coloring reminds me of the poisonous amphibians that were eradicated from our home planet's jungles.

A tattered transcript print-out was recovered from the mess.

A hermetically sealed glass cabinet.

It contains two <link="EVILFLOWER">Sporechid</link> seeds and a carefully penned note.

Success! My Duplicants' efforts to get the Biobot Builder up and running have finally paid off!

Our first fully assembled P.E.G.G.Y. biobot is ready to perform tasks in hazardous environments, which means less exposure to danger for my Duplicants. There seems to be no limit to the number of biobots that we could produce.

A small toy bot was found discarded behind the Sporb tank. It occasionally plays a deteriorated laugh track.
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.MORB_ROVER_MAKER.ENVE: Dr. Seyed Ali, You were right to be angry with me. I am the reason that the driverless workbot project was reassigned. Director Stern called me in to discuss your concerns regarding the Sporb mucin cross-contamination, and I... She said the supplemental testing on model X posed a threat to the Ceres mission. After what happened to that poor lab tech, I should have said more, but... It was already too late for him. It may be too late for all of us. You should know that the Director received a video call from someone at the Vertex Institute as I left... I lingered outside her door and heard her address them as the head of transnational security! The way they were talking about the biobot... It's not safe to write more here. I'll wait for you at the rocket hangar after your shift tonight. I hope you'll come. I understand if you don't. I am so, so sorry. - Dr. Saruhashi
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.MORB_ROVER_MAKER.VALE:
I am
   a subatomic particle
smaller than a speck of dust
  flushed from your gaze

     at the eyewash station  

   My love is like plutonium
 gray and dull and
unbearably heavy
  until    I am near you

 with every breath 
      I burn, with
    yearning
              unseen

PS: I made Steve let me in so I could leave you this, hope that's okay.
CODEX.CODEX.STORY_TRAITS.MORB_ROVER_MAKER.UNSA: [Log Fragmentation Detected] [Voice Recognition Unavailable] [LOG BEGINS] ...and then the Printing Pod says "Knock knock, goo's there!" Ugh. They'll never laugh at that stinker. What if- (sound of a ding) Hey hey, squishy little buddy! Look who's all grown up. You ready for a big robot ride? Dr. Seyed Ali should be back from his meeting any minute. He'll be so happy to see you. (sound of a wet slap on glass) Aww yeah, I'd be impatient too. You know what, why don't I go ahead and get you into your new home? I've helped him do this more than a dozen times. "See one, do one, teach one," right? [LOG ENDS]
