Memories must be embedded within the physical brainmaps of our subjects. The only question that remains is how to activate them. Hormones? Chemical supplements? Situational triggers? The Director seems eager to move past this problem, and I am concerned at her willingness to bypass essential stages of the research development process. We cannot move on to the fine polish of printing systems until the core processes have been perfected - which they have not. Dr. Broussard, signing off. [LOG ENDS]
CODEX.CODEX.B9_TELEPORTATION.TITLE: Memory Breakthrough
CODEX.CODEX.B9_TELEPORTATION.SUBTITLE: ENCRYPTION LEVEL: THREE
CODEX.CODEX.B9_TELEPORTATION.BODY.CONTAINER1: [Voice Recognition Initialized] [Subject Identified: A001] [LOG BEGINS] Dr. Techna's newest notes on Duplicant memories have revealed some interesting discoveries. It seems memories can be transferred to the cloned subject but it requires the host to be subjected to a machine that performs extremely detailed microanalysis. This in-depth dissection of the subject would produce the results we need but at the expense of destroying the host. Of course this is not ideal for our current situation. The time and energy it took to recruit Gravitas' highly trained staff would be wasted if we were to extirpate these people for the sake of experimentation. But perhaps we can use our Duplicants as experimental subjects until we perfect the process and look into finding volunteers for the future in order to obtain an ideal specimen. I will have to discuss this with Dr. Techna but I'm sure he would be enthusiastic about such an opportunity to continue his work. I am also very interested in the commercial opportunities this presents. Off the top of my head I can think of applications in genetics, AI development, and teleportation technology. This could be a significant financial windfall for the company. [LOG ENDS]
CODEX.CODEX.AUTOMATION.TITLE: <link="LOGIC">Automation</link>
CODEX.CODEX.AUTOMATION.PARAGRAPH_1:
Automation is a tool for controlling the operation of buildings based on what sensors in the colony are detecting.

A <link="CEILINGLIGHT">Ceiling Light</link> could be configured to automatically turn on when a <link="DUPLICANTSENSOR">Duplicant Motion Sensor</link> detects a Duplicant in the room.

A <link="LIQUIDPUMP">Liquid Pump</link> might activate only when a <link="LOGICELEMENTSENSORLIQUID">Liquid Element Sensor</link> detects water.

A <link="AIRCONDITIONER">Thermo Regulator</link> might activate only when the <link="LOGICTEMPERATURESENSOR">Thermo Sensor</link> detects too much heat.
CODEX.CODEX.AUTOMATION.PARAGRAPH_2: In addition to an <link="WIRE">electrical wire</link>, most powered buildings can also have an <link="LOGICWIRE">Automation Wire</link> connected to them. This wire can signal the building to turn on or off. If the other end of a <link="LOGICWIRE">Automation Wire</link> is connected to a sensor, the building will turn on and off as the sensor outputs signals.
CODEX.CODEX.AUTOMATION.PARAGRAPH_3: There are two signals that an <link="LOGICWIRE">Automation Wire</link> can send: Green and Red. The green signal will usually cause buildings to turn on, and the red signal will usually cause buildings to turn off. Sensors can often be configured to send their green signal only under certain conditions. A <link="LOGICTEMPERATURESENSOR">Thermo Sensor</link> could be configured to only send a green signal if detecting temperatures greater than a chosen value.
CODEX.CODEX.AUTOMATION.PARAGRAPH_4:
The signals of sensor wires can be combined using special buildings called "Gates" in order to create complex activation conditions.
The <link="LOGICGATEAND">AND Gate</link> can have two automation wires connected to its input slots, and one connected to its output slots. It will send a "Green" signal to its output slot only if it is receiving a "Green" signal from both its input slots. This could be used to activate a building only when multiple sensors are detecting something.
CODEX.CODEX.DECORSYSTEM.TITLE: <link="DECOR">Decor</link>
CODEX.CODEX.DECORSYSTEM.PARAGRAPH_1: Low Decor can increase Duplicant <link="STRESS">Stress</link>. Thankfully, pretty things tend to increase the Decor value of an area. Each Duplicant has a different idea of what is a high enough Decor value. If the average Decor that a Duplicant experiences in a cycle is below their expectations, they will suffer a stress penalty.
CODEX.CODEX.DECORSYSTEM.PARAGRAPH_2:
Many things have an effect on the Decor value of a tile. A building's effect is expressed as a strength value and a radius. Often that effect is positive, but many buildings also lower the decor value of an area too. <link="PLANTS">Plants</link>, <link="CREATURES">Critters</link>, and <link="BUILDCATEGORYFURNITURE">Furniture</link> often increase decor while industrial buildings, debris, and rot often decrease it. Duplicants experience the combined decor of all objects affecting a tile.

The <link="PRICKLEGRASS">Bluff Briar</link> has a decor value of 25 and a radius of 4 tiles. 
The <link="MICROBEMUSHER">Microbe Musher</link> has a decor value of -15 and a radius of 3 tiles. 
The result of placing a <link="MICROBEMUSHER">Microbe Musher</link> next to a <link="PRICKLEGRASS">Bluff Briar</link> would be a combined decor value of 10.
CODEX.CODEX.EXOBASES.TITLE: <link="EXOBASES">Space Travel</link>
CODEX.CODEX.EXOBASES.PARAGRAPH_1: Building a rocket first requires constructing a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> and adding modules from the menu. All rockets will require an engine, a nosecone and a Command Module piloted by a Duplicant possessing the <link="ROCKETPILOTING1">Rocket Piloting</link> skill or higher. Note that the <link="HABITATMODULESMALL">Solo Spacefarer Nosecone</link> functions as both a Command Module and a nosecone.
CODEX.CODEX.EXOBASES.PARAGRAPH_2:
To scan space and see nearby intersteller destinations a <link="CLUSTERTELESCOPE">Telescope</link> must first be built on the surface of a Planetoid. <link="ORBITALRESEARCHCENTER">Orbital Data Collection Lab</link> in orbit around a Planetoid, and <link="SCANNERMODULE">Cartographic Module</link> attached to a rocket can also reveal places on a Starmap.

Always check engine fuel to determine if your rocket can reach its destination, keeping in mind rockets can only land on Plantoids with a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> on it although some modules like <link="SCOUTMODULE">Rover's Modules</link> and <link="PIONEERMODULE">Trailblazer Modules</link> can be sent to the surface of a Planetoid from a rocket in orbit.
CODEX.CODEX.EXOBASES.PARAGRAPH_3:
Goods can be teleported between worlds with connected Supply Teleporters through <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link>, <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link>, and <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> conduits.

Planetoids not connected through Supply Teleporters can use rockets to transport goods, either by landing on a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> or a <link="ORBITALCARGOMODULE">Orbital Cargo Module</link> deployed from a rocket in orbit. Additionally, the <link="RAILGUN">Interplanetary Launcher</link> can send <link="RAILGUNPAYLOAD">Interplanetary Payloads</link> full of goods through space but must be opened by a <link="RAILGUNPAYLOADOPENER">Payload Opener</link>. A <link="LANDINGBEACON">Targeting Beacon</link> can guide payloads and orbital modules to land at a specific location on a Planetoid surface.
CODEX.CODEX.GENETICS.TITLE: <link="GENETICS">Genetics</link>
CODEX.CODEX.GENETICS.PARAGRAPH_1:
Plants exposed to radiation sometimes drop mutated seeds when they are harvested. Each type of mutation has its own efficiencies and trade-offs.

Mutated seeds can be planted once they have been analyzed in the <link="GENETICANALYSISSTATION">Botanical Analyzer</link>, but the resulting plants will produce no seeds of their own unless they are uprooted.
CODEX.CODEX.GENETICS.PARAGRAPH_2: Once mutated seeds have been analyzed in the Botanical Analyzer, they are ready to be planted. Continued exposure to naturally occurring radiation or a <link="RADIATIONLIGHT">Radiation Lamp</link> is necessary to prevent wilting.
CODEX.CODEX.HEALTH.TITLE: <link="HEALTH">Health</link>
CODEX.CODEX.HEALTH.PARAGRAPH_1: Duplicants can be physically damaged by some rare circumstances, such as extreme <link="HEAT">Heat</link> or aggressive <link="CREATURES">Critters</link>. Damaged Duplicants will suffer greatly reduced athletic abilities, and are at risk of incapacitation if damaged too severely.
CODEX.CODEX.HEALTH.PARAGRAPH_2:
Incapacitated Duplicants cannot move or perform errands. They must be rescued by another Duplicant before their health drops to zero. If a Duplicant's health reaches zero they will die.

Health can be restored slowly over time and quickly through rest at the <link="MEDICALCOT">Triage Cot</link>.

 Duplicants are generally more vulnerable to <link="DISEASE">Disease</link> than physical damage.
CODEX.CODEX.HEALTH.PARAGRAPH_3:
Sleep deprivation increases <link="STRESS">Stress</link> and depletes stamina. When stamina reaches zero, exhausted Duplicants will pass out from fatigue.

Each Duplicant should be assigned a <link="BED">Bed</link> of their own, and have adequate time <link="MISCELLANEOUSTIPS14">scheduled</link> for rest.
CODEX.CODEX.HEAT.TITLE: <link="HEAT">Heat</link>
CODEX.CODEX.HEAT.PARAGRAPH_1: Just about everything on the asteroid has a temperature. It's normal for temperature to rise and fall a bit, but extreme temperatures can cause all sorts of problems for a base. Buildings can stop functioning, crops can wilt, and things can even melt, boil, and freeze when they really ought not to.
CODEX.CODEX.HEAT.PARAGRAPH_2:
Most crops require their body temperatures to be within a certain range in order to grow. Values outside of this range are not fatal, but will pause growth. If a building's temperature exceeds its overheat temperature it will take damage and require repair.
At very extreme temperatures buildings may melt or boil away.
CODEX.CODEX.HEAT.PARAGRAPH_3: Temperature increase when the thermal energy of a substance increases. The value of temperature is equal to the total Thermal Energy divided by the Specific Heat Capacity of the substance. Because Specific Heat Capacity varies between substances so significantly, it is often the case a substance can have a higher temperature than another despite a lower overall thermal energy. This quality makes Water require nearly four times the amount of thermal energy to increase in temperature compared to Oxygen.
CODEX.CODEX.HEAT.PARAGRAPH_4: Thermal energy can be transferred between Buildings, Creatures, World tiles, and other world entities through Conduction. Conduction occurs when two things of different Temperatures are touching. The rate of the energy transfer is the product of the averaged Conductivity values and Temperature difference. Thermal energy will flow slowly between substances with low conductivity values (insulators), and quickly between substances with high conductivity (conductors).
CODEX.CODEX.HEAT.PARAGRAPH_5: Water ice melts into liquid water when its temperature rises above its melting point. Liquid water boils into steam when its temperature rises above its boiling point. Similar transitions in state occur for most elements, but each element has its own threshold temperatures. Sometimes the transitions are not reversible - crude oil boiled into sour gas will not condense back to crude oil when cooled. Instead, the substance might condense into a totally different element with a different utility.
CODEX.CODEX.LIGHT.TITLE: <link="LIGHT">Light</link>
CODEX.CODEX.LIGHT.PARAGRAPH_1: Most of the asteroid is dark. Light sources such as the <link="CEILINGLIGHT">Ceiling Light</link> or <link="LIGHTBUG">Shine Bug</link> improves Decor and gives Duplicants a boost to their productivity. Many plants are also sensitive to the amount of light they receive.
CODEX.CODEX.LIGHT.PARAGRAPH_2: The <link="FLOORLAMP">Lamp</link> and <link="CEILINGLIGHT">Ceiling Light</link> produce a decent amount of light when powered. The <link="LIGHTBUG">Shine Bug</link> naturally emits a halo of light. Strong solar light is available on the surface during daytime.
CODEX.CODEX.LIGHT.PARAGRAPH_3: The amount of light on a cell is measured in Lux. Lux has a dramatic range - A simple <link="CEILINGLIGHT">Ceiling Light</link> produces 1800 Lux, while the sun can produce values as high as 80000 Lux. The <link="SOLARPANEL">Solar Panel</link> generates power proportional to how many Lux it is exposed to.
CODEX.CODEX.MORALE.TITLE: <link="MORALE">Morale</link>
CODEX.CODEX.MORALE.PARAGRAPH_1: Morale describes the relationship between a Duplicant's <link="ROLES">Skills</link> and their Lifestyle. The more skills a Duplicant has, the higher their morale expectation will be. Duplicants with morale below their expectation will experience a <link="STRESS">Stress</link> penalty. Comforts such as quality <link="FOOD">Food</link>, nice rooms, and recreation will increase morale.
CODEX.CODEX.MORALE.PARAGRAPH_2: Recreation buildings such as the <link="WATERCOOLER">Water Cooler</link> and <link="ESPRESSOMACHINE">Espresso Machine</link> improve a Duplicant's morale when used. Duplicants need downtime time in their schedules to use these buildings.
CODEX.CODEX.MORALE.PARAGRAPH_3: If a Duplicant has a very high Morale value, they will spontaneously display an Overjoyed Response. Each Duplicant has a different Overjoyed Behavior - but all overjoyed responses are good. Some will positively affect Building <link="DECOR">Decor</link>, others will positively affect Duplicant morale or productivity.
CODEX.CODEX.POWER.TITLE: <link="POWER">Power</link>
CODEX.CODEX.POWER.PARAGRAPH_1: Electrical power is required to run many of the buildings in a base. Different buildings requires different amounts of power to run. Power can be transferred to buildings that require it using <link="WIRE">Wires</link>.
CODEX.CODEX.POWER.PARAGRAPH_2:
Several buildings can generate power. Duplicants can run on the <link="MANUALGENERATOR">Manual Generator</link> to generate clean power. Once generated, power can be consumed by buildings or stored in a <link="BATTERY">Battery</link> to prevent waste. Any generated power that is not consumed or stored will be wasted. Batteries and Generators tend to produce a significant amount of <link="HEAT">Heat</link> while active.

Power can also be stored in portable <link="ELECTROBANK">Power Banks</link>.
CODEX.CODEX.POWER.PARAGRAPH_3:
Power is measure in Joules when stored in a <link="BATTERY">Battery</link>. Power produced and consumed by buildings is measured in Watts, which are equal to Joules (consumed or produced) per second.

A Battery that stored 5000 Joules could power a building that consumed 240 Watts for about 20 seconds. A generator which produces 480 Watts could power two buildings which consume 240 Watts for as long as it was running.
CODEX.CODEX.POWER.PARAGRAPH_4:
A network of <link="WIRE">Wires</link> can be overloaded if it is consuming too many watts. If the wattage of a wire network exceeds its limits it may break and require repair.

<link="WIRE">Standard wires</link> have a 1000 Watt limit.
CODEX.CODEX.PRIORITY.TITLE: <link="PRIORITY">Priorities</link>
CODEX.CODEX.PRIORITY.PARAGRAPH_1: Duplicants prioritize their errands based on several factors. Some of these can be adjusted to affect errand choice, but some errands (such as seeking breathable Oxygen) are so important that they cannot be delayed. Errand priority can primarily be controlled by Errand Type prioritization, and then can be further fine-tuned by the Priority Tool {Hotkey/Prioritize}.
CODEX.CODEX.PRIORITY.PARAGRAPH_2: Each errand a Duplicant can perform falls into an Errand Category. These categories can be prioritized on a per-Duplicant basis in the Priorities Screen. Entire errand categories can also be prohibited to a Duplicant if they are meant to never perform errands of that variety. A common configuration is to assign errand type priority based on Duplicant attributes. For example, Duplicants who are good at Research could be made to prioritize the Researching errand type. Duplicants with poor Athletics could be made to deprioritize the Supplying and Storing errand types.
CODEX.CODEX.PRIORITY.PARAGRAPH_3: The priority of errands can often be modified using the Priority tool {Hotkey/Prioritize}. The values applied by this tool are always less influential than the Errand Type priorities described above. If two errands with equal Errand Type Priority are available to a Duplicant, they will choose the errand with a higher priority setting as applied by the tool.
CODEX.CODEX.RADIATION.TITLE: <link="RADIATION">Radiation</link>
CODEX.CODEX.RADIATION.PARAGRAPH_1:
When transporting radioactive materials such as <link="URANIUMORE">Uranium Ore</link>, care must be taken to avoid exposing outside objects to <link="RADIATIONSICKNESS">Radioactive Contaminants</link>.

Using proper transportation vessels, such as those which are lined with <link="LEAD">Lead</link>, is crucial to ensuring that Duplicants avoid <link="RADIATIONSICKNESS">Radiation Sickness</link>.
CODEX.CODEX.RADIATION.PARAGRAPH_2:
Duplicants who are exposed to <link="RADIATIONSICKNESS">Radioactive Contaminants</link> will need to wear protection or they risk coming down with <link="RADIATIONSICKNESS">Radiation Sickness</link>.

Some Duplicants will have more of a natural resistance to radiation, but prolonged exposure will still increase their chances of becoming sick.

Consuming <link="BASICRADPILL">Rad Pills</link> or seafood such as <link="COOKEDFISH">Cooked Seafood</link> or <link="SEALETTUCE">Waterweed</link> increases a Duplicant's radiation resistance, but will not cure a Duplicant's <link="RADIATIONSICKNESS">Radiation Sickness</link> once they have become infected.

On the other hand, exposure to radiation will kill <link="FOODPOISONING">Food Poisoning</link>, <link="SLIMELUNG">Slimelung</link> and <link="ZOMBIESPORES">Zombie Spores</link> on surfaces (including on Duplicants).
CODEX.CODEX.RADIATION.PARAGRAPH_3:
A <link="NUCLEARREACTOR">Research Reactor</link> will require <link="ENRICHEDURANIUM">Enriched Uranium</link> to run. Uranium can be enriched using a <link="URANIUMCENTRIFUGE">Uranium Centrifuge</link>.

Once supplied with <link="ENRICHEDURANIUM">Enriched Uranium</link>, a <link="NUCLEARREACTOR">Research Reactors</link> will create an enormous amount of <link="HEAT">Heat</link> which can then be placed under a source of <link="WATER">Water</link> to produce <link="STEAM">Steam</link>and connected to a <link="STEAMTURBINE2">Steam Turbine</link> to produce a considerable source of <link="POWER">Power</link>.
CODEX.CODEX.RESEARCH.TITLE: <link="RESEARCH">Research</link>
CODEX.CODEX.RESEARCH.PARAGRAPH_1: Doing research unlocks new types of buildings for the colony. Duplicants can perform research at the <link="RESEARCHCENTER">Research Station</link>.
CODEX.CODEX.RESEARCH.PARAGRAPH_2: A selected research task is completed once enough research points have been generated at the colony's research stations. Duplicants with high 'Science' attribute scores will generate research points faster than Duplicants with lower scores.
CODEX.CODEX.RESEARCH.PARAGRAPH_3:
Advanced research tasks require special research stations to generate the proper kind of research points. These research stations often consume more advanced resources.

Using higher-level research stations also requires Duplicants to have learned higher level research <link="ROLES">skills</link>.

Novice Research is performed at the <link="RESEARCHCENTER">Research Station</link>
Advanced Research is performed at the <link="ADVANCEDRESEARCHCENTER">Super Computer</link>
Interstellar Research is performed at the <link="COSMICRESEARCHCENTER">Virtual Planetarium</link>
CODEX.CODEX.RESEARCHDLC1.TITLE: <link="RESEARCHDLC1">Research</link>
CODEX.CODEX.RESEARCHDLC1.PARAGRAPH_1: Doing research unlocks new types of buildings for the colony. Duplicants can perform research at the <link="RESEARCHCENTER">Research Station</link>.
CODEX.CODEX.RESEARCHDLC1.PARAGRAPH_2: A selected research task is completed once enough research points have been generated at the colonies research stations. Duplicants with high 'Science' attribute scores will generate research points faster than Duplicants with lower scores.
CODEX.CODEX.RESEARCHDLC1.PARAGRAPH_3:
Advanced research tasks require special research stations to generate the proper kind of research points. These research stations often consume more advanced resources.

Using higher level research stations also requires Duplicants to have learned higher level research <link="ROLES">skills</link>.

Novice Research is performed at the <link="RESEARCHCENTER">Research Station</link>
Advanced Research is performed at the <link="ADVANCEDRESEARCHCENTER">Super Computer</link>
Interstellar Research is performed at the <link="COSMICRESEARCHCENTER">Virtual Planetarium</link>
Applied Sciences Research is performed at the <link="NUCLEARRESEARCHCENTER">Materials Study Terminal</link>
Data Analysis Research is performed at the <link="ORBITALRESEARCHCENTER">Orbital Data Collection Lab</link>
CODEX.CODEX.STRESS.TITLE: <link="STRESS">Stress</link>
CODEX.CODEX.STRESS.PARAGRAPH_1: A Duplicant's experiences in the colony affect their stress level. Stress increases when they have negative experiences or unmet expectations. Stress decreases with time if <link="MORALE">Morale</link> is satisfied. Duplicant behavior starts to change for the worse when stress levels get too high.
CODEX.CODEX.STRESS.PARAGRAPH_2: If a Duplicant has very high stress values they will experience a Stress Response episode. Each Duplicant has a different Stress Behavior - but all stress responses are bad. After the stress behavior episode is done, the Duplicants stress will reset to a lower value. Though, if the factors causing the Duplicant's high stress are not corrected they are bound to have another stress response episode.

COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.ACHIEVED_THIS_COLONY: The current colony fulfilled this Initiative
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.NOT_ACHIEVED_THIS_CO: The current colony hasn't fulfilled this Initiative
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.FAILED_THIS_COLONY: The current colony cannot fulfill this Initiative
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.ACHIEVED_OTHER_COLON: This Initiative was fulfilled by a past colony
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.WI: Ensure your colony's legacy by fulfilling the requirements of the Escape Imperative.
Establish your permanent home by fulfilling the requirements of the Colonize Imperative.
Uncover the past to secure your future by fulfilling the requirements of the Exploration Imperative.
Secure your colony's industrial future by fulfilling the Power Imperative.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.NO: Have Duplicants consume 400,000kcal of food without planting any seeds in Planter Boxes, Farm Tiles, or Hydroponic Farms.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.EA: Have Duplicants eat 400,000kcal of critter meat before the 100th cycle.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.BU: Improve Duplicant Morale by designating {1} areas as {0}.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.TW: Have at least 20 living Duplicants living in the colony at one time.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.SU: Reach cycle 100 with at least one living Duplicant.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.TA: Find and tame a Gassy Moo.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.SI: Reduce the temperature of a building to 6 Kelvin.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.CL: Generate 240,000kJ of power without using coal, natural gas, petrol or wood generators.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.BU: Construct a building outside the initial starting biome.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.TU: Have Duplicants travel 10,000m by Transit Tube.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.RE: Launch your first rocket into space.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.EQ: Have {0} Duplicants wear non-default clothing simultaneously.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.EX: For {0} cycles in a row, have every Duplicant in the colony complete at least one errand while wearing an Exosuit.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.HA: Produce {0} of refined metal by ranching Smooth Hatches.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.VA: Build at least one of each of the following rooms in a single colony: A Nature Reserve, a Hospital, a Recreation Room, a Great Hall, a Bedroom, a Washroom, a Greenhouse and a Stable.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.CU: Cure a sick Duplicant of disease.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.SU: Reach cycle 365.25 with a single colony.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.IN: Recover a Database entry by inspecting facility ruins.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.CL: Reveal 80% of map by exploring outside the starting biome.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.EX: Enter an oil biome for the first time.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.TA: Find and tame one of every critter species in the world. Default morphs only.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.HA: Hatch a new critter morph from an egg.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.BU: Block a meteor from hitting your base using a Bunker Door.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.AU: Automate a building using sensors or switches from the Automation tab in the Build Menu.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.CO: Use a Duplicant's Skill Points to buy out an entire branch of the Skill Tree.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.GE: Perform {0} Tune Ups on power generators.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.CO: Unlock every item in the Research Tree.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.ID: Have Auto-Sweepers complete more deliveries to machines than Duplicants over 5 cycles.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.CO: Have a Duplicant eat any cooked meal prepared at an Electric Grill or Gas Range.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.PL: Replace all the Outhouses and Wash Basins in your colony with Lavatories and Sinks.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.BA: Have at least one toilet in the colony and a bed for every Duplicant.
Distribute 1000 kg of Oxygen using gas vents.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.MA: Have a Duplicant with the Masterworks skill paint a Masterpiece quality painting.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.FI: Teleport a Duplicant and defrost a Friend on another world.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.SO: Build a launchpad on a world without a teleporter.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.LA: Land dupes or rovers on all worlds in the cluster.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.RE: Run a Research Reactor at full capacity for {0} cycles.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.GM: Successfully analyze at least one seed of all mutatable plants.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.SW: Extract Uranium from a Beeta hive without getting stung.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.SU: Have the Duplicants in one rocket survive in space for {0} cycles in a row with a morale of {1} or higher.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.DA: Produce a Data Bank using a Data Miner operating at maximum efficiency.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.MV: Install {0} boosters in a single Bionic Duplicant.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.MISC_REQUIREMENTS.ST: Platform achievements cannot be unlocked because a debug command was used in this colony.

COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.THRIVING.NAME: Home Sweet Home
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.THRIVING.MESSAGE_BOD:
Few civilizations throughout time have had the privilege of understanding their origins. The one thing that matters is that we are here now, and we make the best of the world we've been given. I am proud to say...

This asteroid is our home.
Few civilizations throughout time have had the privilege of understanding their origins.
The only thing that matters is that we are here now, and we make the best of the world we've been given. I am proud to say...
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.THRIVING.REQUIREMENT: Build all three sections of a <style="KKeyword">Great Monument</style> to mark the colony as your home
The colony must have {0} or more living Duplicants
All Duplicants must have <style="KKeyword">Morale</style> of 16 or higher
The colony must survive a minimum of {0} cycles
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.DISTANT_PLANET_REACH: Our homeworld in this universe is gone, replaced by the skeleton of a planet and a wound in the sky... But I hold out hope that other worlds exist out there, tucked away in other dimensions. I sent my Duplicant through the Temporal Tear carrying that hope on their shoulders... Perhaps one day they'll find a place to call home, and begin a thriving colony all their own.

We have always viewed the Temporal Tear as a phenomenon to fear but, like the civilizations before us, the call to adventure asks us to confront our anxiety and leap into the unknown. As a radical action of hope, I have sent enough Duplicants through the Temporal Tear to start another colony, explore dimensions beyond ours and plant the seeds of life throughout time and space.
Our homeworld in this universe is gone, replaced by the skeleton of a planet and a wound in the sky... But I hold out hope that other worlds exist out there, tucked away in other dimensions.
I sent my Duplicant through the Temporal Tear carrying that hope on their shoulders... Perhaps one day they'll find a place to call home, and begin a thriving colony all their own.
Send a Duplicant on a one-way mission to the furthest Starmap destination
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.STUDY_ARTIFACTS.NAME: Cosmic Archaeology
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.STUDY_ARTIFACTS.MESS: In exploring this corner of the universe we have found and assembled a collection of artifacts from another civilization. Studying these artifacts can give us a greater understanding of who we are and where we come from. Only by learning about the past can we build a brighter future, one where we learn from the mistakes of our predecessors.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.STUDY_ARTIFACTS.VIDE: Our homeworld in this universe is gone, replaced by the skeleton of a planet and a wound in the sky... But I hold out hope that other worlds exist out there, tucked away in other dimensions.
I sent my Duplicant through the Temporal Tear carrying that hope on their shoulders... Perhaps one day they'll find a place to call home, and begin a thriving colony all their own.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.STUDY_ARTIFACTS.REQU: Study {artifactCount} Terrestrial Artifacts at the Artifact Analysis Station
Study {artifactCount} Space Artifacts at the Artifact Analysis Station
Establish colonies on {count} asteroids by building and activating Mini-Pods
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.ASTEROID_DESTROYED.M:
We've blasted Demolior into oblivion! My colony is safe for now.

Among the impactor's remains, I've identified several useful resources as well as a small, familiar object... How did such a thing find its way onto an uninhabited asteroid? I have always hoped that other worlds existed... Perhaps they do, and we are more alike than I ever imagined.

There is so much we have yet to discover.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.ASTEROID_SURVIVED.NA: The Lab: Life Found A Way
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.ASTEROID_SURVIVED.DE: Survive 100 cycles after Demolior asteroid collides with RelicAAAA<sup>AAAGHH</sup>.
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.NO_DUPES_HAVE_DIED.R: Zero Duplicant deaths in the colony
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.COLONY_ACHIEVEMENTS.ACTIVATEGEOTHERMALPL:
Though the journey has been long and marked by challenges that often seemed insurmountable, we have prevailed in harnessing this planet's core potential.

We now stand proudly at the precipice of a sustainably powered future...it is deeply humbling.

I am hopeful that we have learned enough to wield this machinery more wisely than those who came before us.

An abandoned geothermal power plant has been discovered!

My scans indicate that this facility comprises multiple buildings located throughout the planet, with plumbing entrenched so deeply in the terrain that much of it is beyond our reach.

Most of the accessible portions look quite functional.

Success! My Duplicants have restored the plumbing system for the geothermal heat pump.

We can now use this building to pump liquids out to the connected geo vents. Constructing steam turbines at the venting sites will enable us to convert the resulting steam into power.

The vents also emit various byproducts. I'm sure I can find a use for them.

My Duplicants have successfully cleared the obstructed geo vent!

We can now maximize the full potential of this formidable heat and power source...and perhaps experiment with input temperatures to produce more interesting secondary byproducts.

My Duplicants seem keen to commemorate this accomplishment by keeping the obstruction as something of a trophy.
