CREATURES.CREATURES.BAGGED_DESC_FMT: This {0} has been captured and is now safe to relocate.
CREATURES.CREATURES.PLANT_MUTATIONS.UNIDENTIFIED_D: This seed must be identified at the <link="GENETICANALYSISSTATION">Botanical Analyzer</link> before it can be planted.
CREATURES.CREATURES.PLANT_MUTATIONS.NONE.NAME: Original
CREATURES.CREATURES.PLANT_MUTATIONS.MODERATELYLOOS: Plants with this mutation are easier to take care of, but don't yield as much produce.
CREATURES.CREATURES.PLANT_MUTATIONS.MODERATELYTIGH: Plants with this mutation are pickier about their conditions but yield more produce.
CREATURES.CREATURES.PLANT_MUTATIONS.EXTREMELYTIGHT: Plants with this mutation are very difficult to keep alive, but produce a bounty.
CREATURES.CREATURES.PLANT_MUTATIONS.BONUSLICE.NAME: Licey
CREATURES.CREATURES.PLANT_MUTATIONS.BONUSLICE.DESC: Something about this mutation causes Meal Lice to pupate on this plant.
CREATURES.CREATURES.PLANT_MUTATIONS.SUNNYSPEED.DES: This mutation provides the plant with sun-collecting leaves, allowing faster growth.
CREATURES.CREATURES.PLANT_MUTATIONS.SLOWBURN.NAME: Wildish
CREATURES.CREATURES.PLANT_MUTATIONS.SLOWBURN.DESCR: These plants grow almost as slow as their wild cousins, but also consume almost no fertilizer.
CREATURES.CREATURES.PLANT_MUTATIONS.BLOOMS.NAME: Blooming
CREATURES.CREATURES.PLANT_MUTATIONS.BLOOMS.DESCRIP: Vestigial flowers increase the beauty of this plant. Don't inhale the pollen, though!
CREATURES.CREATURES.PLANT_MUTATIONS.LOADEDWITHFRUI: This mutation produces lots of extra produce, though it also takes a long time to pick it all!
CREATURES.CREATURES.PLANT_MUTATIONS.ROTTENHEAPS.DE: Plants with this mutation grow extremely quickly, though the produce they make is sometimes questionable.
CREATURES.CREATURES.PLANT_MUTATIONS.HEAVYFRUIT.DES: Extra water in these plump mutant veggies causes them to fall right off the plant! There's no extra nutritional value, though...
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CRAB.NAME: <link="CRAB">Pokeshell</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CRAB.DESC:
Pokeshells are nonhostile critters unless their eggs are nearby.

They eat <link="TOXICSAND">Polluted Dirt</link> and <link="COMPOST">Rot Piles</link>.

The shells they leave behind after molting can be crushed into <link="LIME">Lime</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CRAB.BABY.NAME: <link="CRAB">Pokeshell Spawn</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CRAB.BABY.DESC:
A snippy little Pokeshell Spawn.

In time it will mature into a fully grown <link="CRAB">Pokeshell</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CRAB.VARIANT_WOOD.NAME: <link="CRABWOOD">Oakshell</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CRAB.VARIANT_WOOD.DESC:
Oakshells are nonhostile critters unless their eggs are nearby.

They eat <link="TOXICSAND">Polluted Dirt</link>, <link="SLIMEMOLD">Slime</link> and <link="COMPOST">Rot Piles</link>.

The shells they leave behind after molting can be crushed into <link="WOOD">Wood</link>.

Oakshells thrive in <link="ETHANOL">Ethanol</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CRAB.VARIANT_WOOD.BABY:
A knotty little Oakshell Spawn.

In time it will mature into a fully grown <link="CRABWOOD">Oakshell</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CRAB.VARIANT_FRESH_WAT:
Sanishells are nonhostile critters unless their eggs are nearby.

They thrive in <link="WATER">Water</link> and eliminate <link="DISEASE">Germs</link> from any liquid it inhabits.

They eat <link="TOXICSAND">Polluted Dirt</link>, <link="SLIMEMOLD">Slime</link> and <link="COMPOST">Rot Piles</link>.

A picky little Sanishell Spawn.

In time it will mature into a fully grown <link="CRABFRESHWATER">Sanishell</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CHAMELEON.NAME: <link="CHAMELEON">Dartle</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CHAMELEON.DESC:
Dartles are non-hostile critters who eat <link="DEWDRIP">Dewdrips</link> right off the <link="DEWDRIPPERPLANT">Dew Dripper</link> plant and excrete <link="BLEACHSTONE">Bleach Stone</link> and <link="CHLORINEGAS">Chlorine Gas</link> .

They are preyed on by <link="RAPTOR">Rhexes</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CHAMELEON.BABY.NAME: <link="CHAMELEON">Dartlet</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CHAMELEON.BABY.DESC:
A wide-eyed little Dartlet.

Someday it will mature into a fully grown <link="CHAMELEON">Dartle</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.MOSQUITO.NAME: <link="MOSQUITO">Gnit</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.MOSQUITO.DESC:
Gnits are hostile airborne critters primarily bred as food for the carnivorous <link="FLYTRAPPLANT">Lura Plants</link> to produce <link="AMBER">Amber</link>.

Their offspring must be exposed to <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> in order to survive.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.MOSQUITO.BABY.NAME: <link="MOSQUITO">Gnit Larva</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.MOSQUITO.BABY.DESC:
A wiggly little Gnit Larva.

In time, it will mature into an irritating <link="MOSQUITO">Gnit</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BEE.NAME: <link="BEE">Beeta</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BEE.DESC:
Beetas are hostile critters that thrive in <link="RADIATION">Radioactive</link> environments.

They commonly gather <link="URANIUMORE">Uranium Ore</link> for their <link="BEEHIVE">Beeta Hives</link> to produce <link="ENRICHEDURANIUM">Enriched Uranium</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BEE.BABY.NAME: <link="BEE">Beetiny</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BEE.BABY.DESC:
A harmless little Beetiny.

In time, it will mature into a vicious adult <link="BEE">Beeta</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CHLORINEGEYSER.NAME: <link="GEYSERGENERICCHLORINEGAS">Chlorine Geyser</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CHLORINEGEYSER.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with <link="CHLORINEGAS">Chlorine Gas</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PACU.NAME: <link="PACU">Pacu</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PACU.DESC:
Pacus are aquatic creatures that can live in any liquid, such as <link="WATER">Water</link> or <link="DIRTYWATER">Contaminated Water</link>.

Every organism in the known universe finds the Pacu extremely delicious.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PACU.BABY.NAME: <link="PACU">Pacu Fry</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PACU.BABY.DESC:
A wriggly little Pacu Fry.

In time, it will mature into an adult <link="PACU">Pacu</link>.
Every organism in the known universe finds the Pacu extremely delicious.

A wriggly little Tropical Fry.

In time it will mature into an adult Pacu morph, the <link="PACUTROPICAL">Tropical Pacu</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PACU.VARIANT_CLEANER.D: Every organism in the known universe finds the Pacu extremely delicious.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PACU.VARIANT_CLEANER.B:
A wriggly little Gulp Fry.

In time, it will mature into an adult <link="PACUCLEANER">Gulp Fish</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GLOM.NAME: <link="GLOM">Morb</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GLOM.DESC: Morbs are attracted to unhygienic conditions and frequently excrete bursts of <link="CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN">Polluted Oxygen</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.HATCH.NAME: <link="HATCH">Hatch</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.HATCH.DESC: Hatches excrete solid <link="CARBON">Coal</link> as waste and may be uncovered by digging up Buried Objects.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.HATCH.BABY.NAME: <link="HATCH">Hatchling</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.HATCH.BABY.DESC:
An innocent little Hatchling.

In time, it will mature into an adult <link="HATCH">Hatch</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.HATCH.VARIANT_HARD.DES: Stone Hatches excrete solid <link="CARBON">Coal</link> as waste and enjoy burrowing into the ground.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.HATCH.VARIANT_HARD.BAB:
A doofy little Stone Hatchling.

It matures into an adult Hatch morph, the <link="HATCHHARD">Stone Hatch</link>, which loves nibbling on various rocks and metals.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.HATCH.VARIANT_VEGGIE.D: Sage Hatches excrete solid <link="CARBON">Coal</link> as waste and enjoy burrowing into the ground.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.HATCH.VARIANT_VEGGIE.B:
A doofy little Sage Hatchling.

It matures into an adult Hatch morph, the <link="HATCHVEGGIE">Sage Hatch</link>, which loves nibbling on organic materials.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.HATCH.VARIANT_METAL.DE: Smooth Hatches enjoy burrowing into the ground and excrete <link="REFINEDMETAL">Refined Metal</link> when fed <link="RAWMETAL">Metal Ore</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.HATCH.VARIANT_METAL.BA:
A doofy little Smooth Hatchling.

It matures into an adult Hatch morph, the <link="HATCHMETAL">Smooth Hatch</link>, which loves nibbling on different types of metals.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.STATERPILLAR.NAME: <link="STATERPILLAR">Plug Slug</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.STATERPILLAR.DESC:
Plug Slugs are dynamic creatures that generate electrical <link="POWER">Power</link> during the night.

Their power can be harnessed by leaving an exposed wire near areas where they like to sleep.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.STATERPILLAR.BABY.NAME: <link="STATERPILLAR">Plug Sluglet</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.STATERPILLAR.BABY.DESC:
A chubby little Plug Sluglet.

In time it will mature into a fully grown <link="STATERPILLAR">Plug Slug</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.STATERPILLAR.VARIANT_G:
Smog Slugs are porous creatures that draw in unbreathable <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gases</link> during the day.

At night, they sleep near exposed <link="GASCONDUIT">Gas Pipes,</link> where they deposit their cache.

A tubby little Smog Sluglet.

In time it will mature into a fully grown <link="STATERPILLAR">Smog Slug</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.STATERPILLAR.VARIANT_L:
Sponge Slugs are thirsty creatures that soak up <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquids</link> during the day.

They deposit their stored <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquids</link> into the exposed <link="LIQUIDCONDUIT">Liquid Pipes</link> they sleep next to at night.

A chonky little Sponge Sluglet.

In time it will mature into a fully grown <link="STATERPILLAR">Sponge Slug</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.DIVERGENT.VARIANT_BEET:
Sweetles are nonhostile critters that excrete large amounts of <link="SUCROSE">Sucrose</link>.

They are closely related to the <link="DIVERGENTWORM">Grubgrub</link> and exhibit similar, albeit less effective farming behaviors.

A crawly little Sweetle Larva.

In time, it will mature into an adult <link="DIVERGENTBEETLE">Sweetle</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.DIVERGENT.VARIANT_WORM:
Grubgrubs form symbiotic relationships with plants, especially <link="WORMPLANT">Grubfruit Plants</link>, and instinctually tend to them.

Grubgrubs are closely related to <link="DIVERGENTBEETLE">Sweetles</link>.

A squirmy little Grubgrub Wormling.

In time, it will mature into an adult <link="WORM">Grubgrub</link> and drastically grow in size.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.DRECKO.NAME: <link="DRECKO">Drecko</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.DRECKO.DESC:
Dreckos are nonhostile critters that graze on <link="SPICEVINE">Pincha Pepperplants</link>, <link="SWAMPLILY">Balm Lily</link> or <link="BASICSINGLEHARVESTPLANT">Mealwood Plants</link>.

Their backsides are covered in thick woolly fibers that only grow in <link="HYDROGEN">Hydrogen</link> climates.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.DRECKO.BABY.NAME: <link="DRECKO">Drecklet</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.DRECKO.BABY.DESC:
A little, bug-eyed Drecklet.

In time it will mature into a fully grown <link="DRECKO">Drecko</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.DRECKO.VARIANT_PLASTIC:
Glossy Dreckos are nonhostile critters that graze on live <link="BASICSINGLEHARVESTPLANT">Mealwood Plants</link> and <link="PRICKLEFLOWER">Bristle Blossoms</link>.

Their backsides are covered in bioplastic scales that only grow in <link="HYDROGEN">Hydrogen Gas</link> climates.

A bug-eyed little Glossy Drecklet.

In time it will mature into an adult Drecko morph, the <link="DRECKOPLASTIC">Glossy Drecko</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.WOODDEER.NAME: <link="WOODDEER">Flox</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.WOODDEER.DESC:
Floxes are nonhostile critters that graze on <link="PRICKLEFLOWER">Bristle Blossoms</link> and <link="HARDSKINBERRY">Pikeapples</link>.

When Flox antlers are fully grown, they harden into shearable <link="WOOD">Wood</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.WOODDEER.BABY.NAME: <link="WOODDEER">Flox Fawn</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.WOODDEER.BABY.DESC:
A little yipping Flox Fawn.

In time it will mature into a fully grown <link="WOODDEER">Flox</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.ICEBELLY.NAME: <link="ICEBELLY">Bammoth</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.ICEBELLY.DESC:
Bammoths are lumbering, nonhostile creatures that subsist on <link="CARROT">Plume Squash</link>, <link="BEANPLANTSEED">Nosh Beans</link> and <link="FRIESCARROT">Squash Fries</link>.

Their thick overcoats can be shorn for <link="BASICFABRIC">Reed Fiber</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.ICEBELLY.BABY.NAME: <link="ICEBELLY">Bammini</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.ICEBELLY.BABY.DESC:
A floofy little Bammini.

In time it will mature into a fully grown <link="ICEBELLY">Bammoth</link>.
Regal Bammoths are nonhostile creatures that subsist on <link="CARROT">Plume Squash</link> and <link="BEANPLANTSEED">Nosh Beans</link>.

Their ornate crests grow only when they are fed <link="FRIESCARROT">Squash Fries</link>.

A haughty little Regal Bammini.

In time it will mature into a fully grown <link="GOLDBELLY">Regal Bammoth</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEAL.NAME: <link="SEAL">Spigot Seal</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEAL.DESC:
Spigot Seals are charismatic creatures who produce <link="ETHANOL">Ethanol</link>.

They eat <link="SUCROSE">Sucrose</link>, and drink <link="SUGARWATER">Nectar</link> straight from the <link="SPACETREE">Bonbon Tree</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEAL.BABY.NAME: <link="SEAL">Spigot Pup</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEAL.BABY.DESC:
A wobbly little Spigot Pup.

In time, it will mature into an adult <link="SEAL">Spigot Seal</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SQUIRREL.NAME: <link="SQUIRREL">Pip</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SQUIRREL.DESC:
Pips are pesky, nonhostile critters that subsist on <link="BASICFABRICPLANT">Thimble Reeds</link> and <link="FORESTTREE">Arbor Tree</link> branches.

They are known to bury <link="PLANTS">Seeds</link> in the ground whenever they can find a suitable area with enough space.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SQUIRREL.BABY.NAME: <link="SQUIRREL">Pipsqueak</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SQUIRREL.BABY.DESC:
A little purring Pipsqueak.

In time it will mature into a fully grown <link="SQUIRREL">Pip</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SQUIRREL.VARIANT_HUG.D:
Cuddle Pips are fluffy, affectionate critters who exhibit a strong snuggling instinct towards all types of eggs.

This is temporarily amplified when they are hugged by a passing Duplicant.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SQUIRREL.VARIANT_HUG.B:
A fuzzy little Cuddle Pipsqueak.

In time it will mature into a fully grown <link="SQUIRREL">Cuddle Pip</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.OILFLOATER.NAME: <link="OILFLOATER">Slickster</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.OILFLOATER.DESC: Slicksters are slimy critters that consume <link="CARBONDIOXIDE">Carbon Dioxide</link> and exude <link="CRUDEOIL">Crude Oil</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.OILFLOATER.BABY.NAME: <link="OILFLOATER">Slickster Larva</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.OILFLOATER.BABY.DESC:
A goopy little Slickster Larva.

One day it will grow into an adult <link="OILFLOATER">Slickster</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.OILFLOATER.VARIANT_HIG: Molten Slicksters are slimy critters that consume <link="CARBONDIOXIDE">Carbon Dioxide</link> and exude <link="PETROLEUM">Petroleum</link>.

A goopy little Molten Larva.

One day it will grow into an adult Slickster morph, the <link="OILFLOATERHIGHTEMP">Molten Slickster</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.OILFLOATER.VARIANT_DEC:
Longhair Slicksters are friendly critters that consume <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> and thrive in close contact with Duplicant companions.

Longhairs have extremely beautiful and luxurious coats.

A snuggly little Longhair Larva.

One day it will grow into an adult Slickster morph, the <link="OILFLOATERDECOR">Longhair Slickster</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PUFT.NAME: <link="PUFT">Puft</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PUFT.DESC: Pufts are non-aggressive critters that excrete lumps of <link="SLIMEMOLD">Slime</link> with each breath.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PUFT.BABY.NAME: <link="PUFT">Puftlet</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PUFT.BABY.DESC:
A gassy little Puftlet.

In time it will grow into an adult <link="PUFT">Puft</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PUFT.VARIANT_ALPHA.DES: The Puft Prince is a lazy critter that excretes little <link="SOLID">Solid</link> lumps of whatever it has been breathing.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PUFT.VARIANT_ALPHA.BAB:
A gassy little Puftlet Prince.

One day it will grow into an adult Puft morph, the <link="PUFTALPHA">Puft Prince</link>.

It seems a bit snobby...
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PUFT.VARIANT_OXYLITE.D: Dense Pufts are non-aggressive critters that excrete condensed <link="OXYROCK">Oxylite</link> with each breath.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PUFT.VARIANT_OXYLITE.B:
A stocky little Dense Puftlet.

One day it will grow into an adult Puft morph, the <link="PUFTOXYLITE">Dense Puft</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PUFT.VARIANT_BLEACHSTO: Squeaky Pufts are non-aggressive critters that excrete lumps of <link="BLEACHSTONE">Bleachstone</link> with each breath.

A frazzled little Squeaky Puftlet.

One day it will grow into an adult Puft morph, the <link="PUFTBLEACHSTONE">Squeaky Puft</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.MOO.NAME: <link="MOO">Gassy Moo</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.MOO.DESC:
Moos are extraterrestrial critters that feed on <link="GASGRASS">Gas Grass</link> and excrete <link="METHANE">Natural Gas</link>.

When domesticated and fed, they can be milked for <link="MILK">Brackene</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.MOLE.NAME: <link="MOLE">Shove Vole</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.MOLE.DESC:
Shove Voles are burrowing critters that eat the <link="REGOLITH">Regolith</link> collected on terrestrial surfaces.

They cannot burrow through <link="REFINEDMETAL">Refined Metals</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.MOLE.BABY.NAME: <link="MOLE">Vole Pup</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.MOLE.BABY.DESC:
A snuggly little pup.

One day it will grow into an adult <link="MOLE">Shove Vole</link>.
Delecta Voles are burrowing critters whose bodies sprout shearable <link="GINGERCONFIG">Tonic Root</link> when <link="REGOLITH">Regolith</link> is ingested at preferred temperatures.

They cannot burrow through <link="REFINEDMETAL">Refined Metals</link>.

A tender little Delecta Vole pup.

One day it will grow into an adult Shove Vole morph, the <link="MOLEDELICACY">Delecta Vole</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GREEDYGREEN.NAME: <link="GREEDYGREEN">Avari Vine</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SHOCKWORM.NAME: <link="SHOCKWORM">Shockworm</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SHOCKWORM.DESC: Shockworms are exceptionally aggressive and discharge electrical shocks to stun their prey.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.LIGHTBUG.NAME: <link="LIGHTBUG">Shine Bug</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.LIGHTBUG.DESC: Shine Bugs emit a soft <link="LIGHT">Light</link> in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.LIGHTBUG.BABY.NAME: <link="LIGHTBUG">Shine Nymph</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.LIGHTBUG.VARIANT_ORANG:
Shine Bugs emit a soft <link="LIGHT">Light</link> in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

The light of the Sun morph has been turned orange through selective breeding.

A chubby baby <link="LIGHTBUGORANGE">Shine Bug</link>.

This one is a Sun morph.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.LIGHTBUG.VARIANT_PURPL:
Shine Bugs emit a soft <link="LIGHT">Light</link> in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

The light of the Royal morph has been turned purple through selective breeding.

A chubby baby <link="LIGHTBUGPURPLE">Shine Bug</link>.

This one is a Royal morph.
Shine Bugs emit a soft <link="LIGHT">Light</link> in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

The light of the Coral morph has been turned pink through selective breeding.

A chubby baby <link="LIGHTBUGPINK">Shine Bug</link>.

This one is a Coral morph.
Shine Bugs emit a soft <link="LIGHT">Light</link> in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

The light of the Azure morph has been turned blue through selective breeding.

A chubby baby <link="LIGHTBUGBLUE">Shine Bug</link>.

This one is an Azure morph.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.LIGHTBUG.VARIANT_BLACK: This Shine Bug emits no <link="LIGHT">Light</link>, but it makes up for it by having an excellent personality.

A chubby baby <link="LIGHTBUGBLACK">Shine Bug</link>.

This one is an Abyss morph.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.LIGHTBUG.VARIANT_CRYST:
Shine Bugs emit a soft <link="LIGHT">Light</link> in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

The light of the Radiant morph has been amplified through selective breeding.

A chubby baby <link="LIGHTBUGCRYSTAL">Shine Bug</link>.

This one is a Radiant morph.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.LIGHTBUG.VARIANT_RADIO: Shine Bugs emit a dangerously radioactive <link="LIGHT">Light</link> in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.

A chubby baby <link="LIGHTBUGRADIOACTIVE">Shine Bug</link>.

This one is an Ionizing morph.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.RAPTOR.NAME: <link="RAPTOR">Rhex</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.RAPTOR.DESC:
Rhexes are carnivorous critters that feed on smaller <link="CREATURES">Critters</link> and produce <link="BRINEICE">Brine Ice</link>.

Their tailfeathers can be shorn for <link="FEATHERFABRIC">Feather Fiber</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.RAPTOR.BABY.NAME: <link="RAPTOR">Rhex Baby</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.RAPTOR.BABY.DESC:
A feathery little Rhex fledgling.

One day, it will grow into a fearsome <link="RAPTOR">Rhex</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PREHISTORICPACU.NAME: <link="PREHISTORICPACU">Jawbo</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PREHISTORICPACU.DESC:
Jawbos are carnivorous aquatic critters that feed on <link="PACU">Pacus</link> and produce <link="RUST">Rust</link>.

They pose no danger to Duplicants.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PREHISTORICPACU.BABY.D:
A grumpy little Jawbo fry.

In time, it will grow into a toothy <link="PREHISTORICPACU">Jawbo</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.STEGO.NAME: <link="STEGO">Lumb</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.STEGO.DESC:
Lumbs are non-hostile critters that subsist on <link="VINEMOTHER">Ovagro</link> vines.

When they stomp heavily near <link="PLANTS">plants</link>, the commotion causes harvestable items to fall to the ground.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.STEGO.BABY.NAME: <link="STEGO">Lumblet</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BUTTERFLY.NAME: <link="BUTTERFLY">Mimika</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BUTTERFLY.DESC:
Mimikas are airborne organisms that help nearby <link="PLANTS">Plants</link> grow more quickly.

When its leaves dry up, it will harden into <link="BUTTERFLYPLANT">Mimillet</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.NAME: <link="GEYSER">Steam Geyser</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts, spraying <link="STEAM">Steam</link> and boiling hot <link="WATER">Water</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.STEAM.NAME: <link="GEYSERGENERICSTEAM">Cool Steam Vent</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.STEAM.DESC: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with <link="STEAM">Steam</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.HOT_STEAM.NAME: <link="GEYSERGENERICHOTSTEAM">Steam Vent</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.HOT_STEAM.DESC: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with scalding <link="STEAM">Steam</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.SALT_WATER.NAME: <link="GEYSERGENERICSALTWATER">Salt Water Geyser</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.SALT_WATER.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with <link="SALTWATER">Salt Water</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.SLUSH_SALT_WATE: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with freezing <link="BRINE">Brine</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.HOT_WATER.NAME: <link="GEYSERGENERICHOTWATER">Water Geyser</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.HOT_WATER.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with hot <link="WATER">Water</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.SLUSH_WATER.DES: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with freezing <link="DIRTYWATER">Polluted Water</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.FILTHY_WATER.DE: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with boiling <link="DIRTYWATER">Contaminated Water</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.SMALL_VOLCANO.D: A miniature volcano that periodically erupts with molten <link="MAGMA">Magma</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.BIG_VOLCANO.DES: A massive volcano that periodically erupts with molten <link="MAGMA">Magma</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.LIQUID_CO2.NAME: <link="GEYSERGENERICLIQUIDCO2">Carbon Dioxide Geyser</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.LIQUID_CO2.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with boiling <link="LIQUIDCARBONDIOXIDE">Liquid Carbon Dioxide</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.HOT_CO2.NAME: <link="GEYSERGENERICHOTCO2">Carbon Dioxide Vent</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.HOT_CO2.DESC: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with hot <link="CARBONDIOXIDE">Carbon Dioxide</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.HOT_HYDROGEN.DE: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with hot gaseous <link="HYDROGEN">Hydrogen</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.HOT_PO2.NAME: <link="GEYSERGENERICHOTPO2">Hot Polluted Oxygen Vent</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.HOT_PO2.DESC: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with hot <link="CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN">Polluted Oxygen</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.SLIMY_PO2.NAME: <link="GEYSERGENERICSLIMYPO2">Infectious Polluted Oxygen Vent</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.SLIMY_PO2.DESC: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with warm <link="CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN">Polluted Oxygen</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.CHLORINE_GAS.DE: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with warm <link="CHLORINEGAS">Chlorine Gas</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.CHLORINE_GAS_CO: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with cool <link="CHLORINEGAS">Chlorine Gas</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.METHANE.NAME: <link="GEYSERGENERICMETHANE">Natural Gas Geyser</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.METHANE.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with hot <link="METHANE">Natural Gas</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.MOLTEN_COPPER.D: A large volcano that periodically erupts with <link="MOLTENCOPPER">Molten Copper</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.MOLTEN_IRON.DES: A large volcano that periodically erupts with <link="MOLTENIRON">Molten Iron</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.MOLTEN_ALUMINUM: A large volcano that periodically erupts with <link="MOLTENALUMINUM">Molten Aluminum</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.MOLTEN_TUNGSTEN: A large volcano that periodically erupts with <link="MOLTENTUNGSTEN">Molten Tungsten</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.MOLTEN_GOLD.DES: A large volcano that periodically erupts with <link="MOLTENGOLD">Molten Gold</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.MOLTEN_COBALT.D: A large volcano that periodically erupts with <link="MOLTENCOBALT">Molten Cobalt</link>.
A large volcano that periodically erupts with <link="NIOBIUM">Niobium</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.OIL_DRIP.NAME: <link="GEYSERGENERICOILDRIP">Leaky Oil Fissure</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.OIL_DRIP.DESC: A fissure that periodically erupts with boiling <link="CRUDEOIL">Crude Oil</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GEYSER.LIQUID_SULFUR.D: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with boiling <link="LIQUIDSULFUR">Liquid Sulfur</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.METHANEGEYSER.NAME: <link="GEYSERGENERICMETHANEGEYSER">Natural Gas Geyser</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.METHANEGEYSER.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with <link="METHANE">Natural Gas</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.OIL_WELL.NAME: <link="OILWELL">Oil Reservoir</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.OIL_WELL.DESC:
Oil Reservoirs are rock formations with <link="CRUDEOIL">Crude Oil</link> deposits beneath their surface.

Oil can be extracted from a reservoir with sufficient pressure.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.MUSHROOMPLANT.NAME: <link="MUSHROOMPLANT">Dusk Cap</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.MUSHROOMPLANT.DESC: Dusk Caps produce <link="MUSHROOM">Mushrooms</link>, fungal growths that can be harvested for <link="FOOD">Food</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.STEAMSPOUT.NAME: <link="GEYSERS">Steam Spout</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PROPANESPOUT.NAME: <link="GEYSERS">Propane Spout</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PROPANESPOUT.DESC: A rocky vent that spouts <link="PROPANE">Propane Gas</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.OILSPOUT.NAME: <link="OILSPOUT">Oil Spout</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.OILSPOUT.DESC: A rocky vent that spouts <link="CRUDEOIL">Crude Oil</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.HEATBULB.NAME: <link="HEATBULB">Fervine</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.HEATBULBSEED.NAME: <link="HEATBULBSEED">Fervine Bulb</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PACUEGG.NAME: <link="PACUEGG">Pacu Egg</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PACUEGG.DESC:
A tiny Pacu is nestled inside.

It is not yet ready for the world.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.MYSTERYEGG.NAME: <link="MYSTERYEGG">Mysterious Egg</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.MYSTERYEGG.DESC: What's growing inside? Something nice? Something mean?
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SWAMPLILY.NAME: <link="SWAMPLILY">Balm Lily</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SWAMPLILY.DESC: Balm Lilies produce <link="SWAMPLILYFLOWER">Balm Lily Flower</link>, a lovely bloom with medicinal properties.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SWAMPLILY.DOMESTICATED: This plant produces medicinal <link="SWAMPLILYFLOWER">Balm Lily Flower</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.JUNGLEGASPLANT.NAME: <link="JUNGLEGASPLANT">Palmera Tree</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.JUNGLEGASPLANT.DESC:
A large, chlorine-dwelling <link="PLANTS">Plant</link> that can be grown in farm buildings.

Palmeras grow inedible buds that emit unbreathable hydrogen gas.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.JUNGLEGASPLANT.DOMESTI: A large, chlorine-dwelling <link="PLANTS">Plant</link> that grows inedible buds which emit unbreathable hydrogen gas.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PRICKLEFLOWER.NAME: <link="PRICKLEFLOWER">Bristle Blossom</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PRICKLEFLOWER.DESC: Bristle Blossoms produce <link="PRICKLEFRUIT">Bristle Berry</link>, a prickly edible bud.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PRICKLEFLOWER.DOMESTIC: This plant produces edible <link="BRISTLE BERRY">Bristle Berries</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.COLDWHEAT.NAME: <link="COLDWHEAT">Sleet Wheat</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.COLDWHEAT.DESC: Sleet Wheat produces <link="COLDWHEATSEED">Sleet Wheat Grain</link>, a chilly grain that can be processed into <link="FOOD">Food</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.COLDWHEAT.DOMESTICATED: This plant produces edible <link="COLDWHEATSEED">Sleet Wheat Grain</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GASGRASS.NAME: <link="GASGRASS">Gas Grass</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GASGRASS.DESC: Gas Grass is an alien lifeform tentatively categorized as a "plant," which makes up the entirety of the <link="MOO">Gassy Moo's</link> diet.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GASGRASS.DOMESTICATEDD: An alien grass variety that is eaten by <link="MOO">Gassy Moos</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PINKROCK.NAME: Lumen Quartz
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PINKROCK.DESC:
Lumen quartz emits a soft glowing <link="LIGHT">Light</link> that makes everything look and feel a little rosier.

It's even brighter and more beautiful once it's been carved.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PINKROCKCARVED.NAME: Carved Lumen Quartz
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PINKROCKCARVED.DESC: A Duplicant has carved this Lumen quartz in a way that really maximizes its <link="DECOR">Decor</link> value and <link="LIGHT">brightness</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PRICKLEGRASS.NAME: <link="PRICKLEGRASS">Bluff Briar</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.PRICKLEGRASS.DESC: Bluff Briars exude pheromones causing critters to view them as especially beautiful.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CYLINDRICA.NAME: <link="CYLINDRICA">Bliss Burst</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CYLINDRICA.DESC: Bliss Bursts release an explosion of <link="DECOR">Decor</link> into otherwise dull environments.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.TOEPLANT.NAME: <link="TOEPLANT">Tranquil Toes</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.TOEPLANT.DESC: Tranquil Toes improve <link="DECOR">Decor</link> by giving their surroundings the visual equivalent of a foot rub.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.WINECUPS.NAME: <link="WINECUPS">Mellow Mallow</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.WINECUPS.DESC: Mellow Mallows heighten <link="DECOR">Decor</link> and alleviate <link="STRESS">Stress</link> with their calming color and cradle shape.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.EVILFLOWER.NAME: <link="EVILFLOWER">Sporechid</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.EVILFLOWER.DESC: Sporechids have an eerily alluring appearance to mask the fact that they host particularly nasty strain of brain fungus.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.EVILFLOWER.DOMESTICATE: This plant improves ambient <link="DECOR">Decor</link> but produces high quantities of <link="ZOMBIESPORES">Zombie Spores</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.LEAFYPLANT.NAME: <link="LEAFYPLANT">Mirth Leaf</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.LEAFYPLANT.DESC: Mirth Leaves sport a calm green hue known for alleviating <link="STRESS">Stress</link> and improving <link="MORALE">Morale</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CACTUSPLANT.NAME: <link="CACTUSPLANT">Jumping Joya</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CACTUSPLANT.DESC: Joyas are <link="DECOR">Decorative</link> <link="PLANTS">Plants</link> that are colloquially said to make gardeners "jump for joy".
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BULBPLANT.NAME: <link="BULBPLANT">Buddy Bud</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BULBPLANT.DESC: Buddy Buds are leafy plants that have a positive effect on <link="MORALE">Morale</link>, much like a friend.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.ICEFLOWER.NAME: <link="ICEFLOWER">Idylla Flower</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.ICEFLOWER.DESC:
Idyllas are <link="DECOR">Decorative</link> <link="PLANTS">Plants</link> with soft, pompom-shaped blossoms.

Gazing dreamily at them has a positive effect on <link="MORALE">Morale</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.HARDSKINBERRYPLANT.DES: Pikeapple bushes produce <link="HARDSKINBERRY">Pikeapple</link>, a useful yet almost unbearably fragrant <link="FOOD">Food</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CARROTPLANT.NAME: <link="CARROTPLANT">Plume Squash Plant</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CARROTPLANT.DESC: Plume Squashes are sweet, nutrient-rich tubers that can be harvested for <link="FOOD">Food</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SPACETREE.NAME: <link="SPACETREE">Bonbon Tree</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SPACETREE.DESC:
Bonbon Tree branches synthesize <link="LIGHT">Light</link> to produce <link="SUGARWATER">Nectar</link>.

Branches can be harvested for <link="WOOD">Wood</link>.

Bonbon Trees can shed most environmental debris, and rarely become entombed.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BLUE_GRASS.NAME: <link="BLUEGRASS">Alveo Vera</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BLUE_GRASS.DESC: Alveo Veras consume <link="CARBONDIOXIDE">Carbon Dioxide</link> and <link="ICE">Ice</link>, and form harvestable <link="OXYROCK">Oxylite</link> deposits.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BASICSINGLEHARVESTPLAN: Mealwoods produce <link="BASICPLANTFOOD">Meal Lice</link>, an oddly wriggly grain that can be harvested for <link="FOOD">Food</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.DEWDRIPPERPLANT.NAME: <link="DEWDRIPPERPLANT">Dew Dripper</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.DEWDRIPPERPLANT.DESC: Dew Drippers produce <link="DEWDRIP">Dewdrips</link> that can be crushed into <link="MILK">Brackene</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SWAMPHARVESTPLANT.NAME: <link="SWAMPHARVESTPLANT">Bog Bucket</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SWAMPHARVESTPLANT.DESC: Bog Buckets produce juicy, sweet <link="SWAMPFRUIT">Bog Jellies</link> for <link="FOOD">Food</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.WORMPLANT.NAME: <link="WORMPLANT">Spindly Grubfruit Plant</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.WORMPLANT.DESC:
Spindly Grubfruit Plants produce <link="WORMBASICFRUIT">Spindly Grubfruit</link> for <link="FOOD">Food</link>.

If it is tended by a <link="DIVERGENTSPECIES">Divergent</link> critter, it will produce high quality fruits instead.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SUPERWORMPLANT.NAME: <link="WORMPLANT">Grubfruit Plant</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SUPERWORMPLANT.DESC:
A Grubfruit Plant that has flourished after being tended by a <link="DIVERGENTSPECIES">Divergent</link> critter.

It will produce high quality <link="WORMSUPERFRUIT">Grubfruits</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BASICFABRICMATERIALPLA: Thimble Reeds produce indescribably soft <link="BASICFABRIC">Reed Fiber</link> for <link="EQUIPMENT">Clothing</link> production.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BASICFORAGEPLANTPLANTE: Muckroots are incapable of propagating but can be harvested for a single <link="FOOD">Food</link> serving.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.ICECAVESFORAGEPLANTPLA: Sherberries are incapable of propagating, but can be harvested for a single <link="FOOD">Food</link> serving.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.FORESTFORAGEPLANTPLANT: Hexalents are incapable of propagating but can be harvested for a single, calorie dense <link="FOOD">Food</link> serving.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SWAMPFORAGEPLANTPLANTE: Swamp Chards are incapable of propagating but can be harvested for a single low quality and calorie dense <link="FOOD">Food</link> serving.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.COLDBREATHER.NAME: <link="COLDBREATHER">Wheezewort</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.COLDBREATHER.DESC: Wheezeworts can be planted in <link="PLANTERBOX">Planter Boxes</link>, <link="FARMTILE">Farm Tiles</link> or <link="HYDROPONICFARM">Hydroponic Farms</link>, and absorb <link="HEAT">Heat</link> by respiring through their porous outer membranes.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.COLDBREATHERCLUSTER.DE: Wheezeworts can be planted in <link="PLANTERBOX">Planter Boxes</link>, <link="FARMTILE">Farm Tiles</link> or <link="HYDROPONICFARM">Hydroponic Farms</link>, and absorb <link="HEAT">Heat</link> by respiring through their porous outer membranes.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.DINOFERN.NAME: <link="DINOFERN">Megafrond</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.DINOFERN.DESC: Megafronds produce <link="FERNFOOD">Megafrond Grain</link>, an ancient grain that can be processed into <link="FOOD">Food</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.FLYTRAPPLANT.NAME: <link="FLYTRAPPLANT">Lura Plant</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.FLYTRAPPLANT.DESC:
Lura plants are carnivorous plants that trap flying critters, such as <link="MOSQUITO">Gnits</link>.

Their digestive processes produce harvestable <link="AMBER">Amber</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.KELPPLANT.NAME: <link="KELPPLANT">Seakomb</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.KELPPLANT.DESC:
Seakombs consume <link="TOXICSAND">Polluted Dirt</link>.

Their leaves can be processed to extract <link="PHYTOOIL">Phyto Oil</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SPICE_VINE.NAME: <link="SPICEVINE">Pincha Pepperplant</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SPICE_VINE.DESC: Pincha Pepperplants produce flavorful <link="SPICENUT">Pincha Peppernut</link> for spicing <link="FOOD">Food</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SALTPLANT.NAME: <link="SALTPLANT">Dasha Saltvine</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SALTPLANT.DESC: Dasha Saltvines consume small amounts of <link="CHLORINEGAS">Chlorine Gas</link> and form sodium deposits as they grow, producing harvestable <link="SALT">Salt</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.FILTERPLANT.NAME: <link="FILTERPLANT">Hydrocactus</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.FILTERPLANT.DESC: Hydrocacti act as natural <link="WATER">Water</link> filters when given access to <link="SAND">Sand</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.FILTERPLANT.DOMESTICAT: This plant uses <link="SAND">Sand</link> to convert <link="DIRTYWATER">Polluted Water</link> into <link="WATER">Water</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.VINEMOTHER.NAME: <link="VINEMOTHER">Ovagro Node</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.VINEMOTHER.DESC:
Ovagro Nodes are trellis plants that spread onto nearby available surfaces.

A single <link="VINEMOTHER">Ovagro Node</link> can support several <link="VINEMOTHER">Ovagro Vines</link> without any increase in its <link="WATER">Water</link> requirements.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.VINEBRANCH.NAME: <link="VINEMOTHER">Ovagro Vine</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.VINEBRANCH.DESC:
Ovagro Vines are invasive plants that produce edible <link="VINEFRUIT">Ovagro Fig</link>.

If a vine is cut off from its <link="VINEMOTHER">Ovagro Node</link>, it will perish.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.OXYFERN.NAME: <link="OXYFERN">Oxyfern</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.OXYFERN.DESC: Oxyferns absorb <link="CARBONDIOXIDE">Carbon Dioxide Gas</link> and exude breathable <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BEAN_PLANT.NAME: <link="BEANPLANT">Nosh Sprout</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BEAN_PLANT.DESC: Nosh Sprouts thrive in colder climates and produce edible <link="BEANPLANTSEED">Nosh Beans</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.WOOD_TREE.NAME: <link="FORESTTREE">Arbor Tree</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.WOOD_TREE.DESC: Arbor Trees grow <link="FORESTTREE">Arbor Tree Branches</link> and can be harvested for <link="WOOD">Wood</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.WOOD_TREE.DOMESTICATED: This plant produces <link="FORESTTREE">Arbor Tree Branches</link> that can be harvested for <link="WOOD">Wood</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.WOOD_TREE_BRANCH.NAME: <link="FORESTTREE">Arbor Tree Branch</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.WOOD_TREE_BRANCH.DESC: Arbor Trees Branches can be harvested for <link="WOOD">Wood</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEALETTUCE.NAME: <link="SEALETTUCE">Waterweed</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEALETTUCE.DESC: Waterweeds thrive in salty water and can be harvested for fresh, edible <link="LETTUCE">Lettuce</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CRITTERTRAPPLANT.NAME: <link="CRITTERTRAPPLANT">Saturn Critter Trap</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CRITTERTRAPPLANT.DESC: Critter Traps are carnivorous plants that consume small-to-medium-sized critters and release <link="HYDROGEN">Hydrogen Gas</link> as waste.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.CRITTERTRAPPLANT.DOMES: This plant eats small critters and produces <link="HYDROGEN">Hydrogen Gas</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SAPTREE.NAME: <link="SAPTREE">Experiment 52B</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SAPTREE.DESC:
A <link="RESIN">Sap</link>-producing cybernetic tree that shows signs of sentience.

It is rooted firmly in place, and is waiting for some brave soul to bring it food.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GARDENFOODPLANT.NAME: <link="GARDENFOODPLANT">Sweatcorn Stalk</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GARDENFOODPLANT.DESC: Sweatcorn Stalks produce <link="GARDENFOODPLANTFOOD">Sweatcorn</link>, a crisp vegetable that can be harvested for <link="FOOD">Food</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GARDENFORAGEPLANTPLANT: Snacti are incapable of propagating but can be harvested for a single <link="FOOD">Food</link> serving.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BUTTERFLYPLANT.NAME: <link="BUTTERFLYPLANT">Mimika Bud</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.BUTTERFLYPLANT.DESC:
Mimika Buds are self-harvesting plants that produce airborne <link="BUTTERFLY">Mimikas</link>.

<link="BUTTERFLY">Mimikas</link> boost growth for nearby <link="PLANTS">Plants</link> before hardening into <link="BUTTERFLYPLANT">Mimillet</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GARDENDECORPLANT.NAME: <link="GARDENDECORPLANT">Ring Rosebush</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.GARDENDECORPLANT.DESC: Ring Rosebushes are <link="DECOR">Decorative</link> <link="PLANTS">Plants</link> that add a touch of whimsy wherever they are planted.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.VINEMOTHER.NAME: <link="VINEMOTHER">Ovagro Node Seed</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.VINEMOTHER.DESC:
The <link="PLANTS">Seed</link> of a <link="VINEMOTHER">Ovagro Node Seed</link>.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover an Ovagro Node Seed.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.LEAFYPLANT.NAME: <link="LEAFYPLANT">Mirth Leaf Seed</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.LEAFYPLANT.DESC:
The <link="PLANTS">Seed</link> of a <link="LEAFYPLANT">Mirth Leaf</link>.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Mirth Leaf Seed.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.CACTUSPLANT.NAME: <link="CACTUSPLANT">Joya Seed</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.CACTUSPLANT.DESC:
The <link="PLANTS">Seed</link> of a <link="CACTUSPLANT">Jumping Joya</link>.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Joya Seed.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.BULBPLANT.NAME: <link="BULBPLANT">Buddy Bud Seed</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.BULBPLANT.DESC:
The <link="PLANTS">Seed</link> of a <link="BULBPLANT">Buddy Bud</link>.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Buddy Bud Seed.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.PRICKLEFLOWER.DE:
The <link="PLANTS">Seed</link> of a <link="PRICKLEFLOWER">Bristle Blossom</link>.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Blossom Seed.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.MUSHROOMPLANT.DE:
The <link="PLANTS">Seed</link> of a <link="MUSHROOMPLANT">Dusk Cap</link>.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Fungal Spore.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.COLDWHEAT.NAME: <link="COLDWHEAT">Sleet Wheat Grain</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.COLDWHEAT.DESC:
The <link="PLANTS">Seed</link> of a <link="COLDWHEAT">Sleet Wheat</link> plant.

Grain can be sown to cultivate more Sleet Wheat, or processed into <link="FOOD">Food</link>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.DINOFERN.NAME: <link="DINOFERN">Megafrond Spore</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.GASGRASS.NAME: <link="GASGRASS">Gas Grass Seed</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.PRICKLEGRASS.DES:
The <link="PLANTS">Seed</link> of a <link="PRICKLEGRASS">Bluff Briar</link>.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Briar Seed.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.CYLINDRICA.NAME: <link="CYLINDRICA">Bliss Burst Seed</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.CYLINDRICA.DESC:
The <link="PLANTS">Seed</link> of a <link="CYLINDRICA">Bliss Burst</link>.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Bliss Burst Seed.

CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.TOEPLANT.DESC:
The <link="PLANTS">Seed</link> of a <link="TOEPLANT">Tranquil Toes</link>.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Tranquil Toe Seed.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.WINECUPS.NAME: <link="WINECUPS">Mallow Seed</link>
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.WINECUPS.DESC:
The <link="PLANTS">Seed</link> of a <link="WINECUPS">Mellow Mallow</link>.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Mallow Seed.
CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.EVILFLOWER.NAME: <link="EVILFLOWER">Sporechid Seed</link>

CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.HARDSKINBERRYPLA:

CREATURES.CREATURES.SPECIES.SEEDS.BUTTERFLYPLANTSE:
An inedible <link="PLANTS">Fruit</link> of a <link="BUTTERFLYPLANT">Mimika Bud</link> plant.

It can be sown to cultivate more plants, or processed into <link="FOOD">Food</link>.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Mimillet Seed.

CREATURES.CREATURES.STATUSITEMS.DROWSY.TOOLTIP: This critter is looking for a place to nap
CREATURES.CREATURES.STATUSITEMS.SLEEPING.NAME: Sleeping
CREATURES.CREATURES.STATUSITEMS.CALL_ADULT.NAME: Calling Adult
CREATURES.CREATURES.STATUSITEMS.CALL_ADULT.TOOLTIP: This baby's craving attention from one of its own kind
CREATURES.CREATURES.STATUSITEMS.HOT.NAME: Toasty surroundings
CREATURES.CREATURES.STATUSITEMS.HOT.TOOLTIP: This critter cannot let off enough Heat to keep cool in this environment It prefers Temperatures between {0} and {1}

CREATURES.CREATURES.STATUSITEMS.CROP_TOO_BRIGHT.TO: Growth will resume when <style="KKeyword">Light</style> requirements are met

CREATURES.CREATURES.STATS.ELEMENTGROWTH.TOOLTIP: The amount of time required for this critter to regrow its <style="KKeyword">Tonic Root</style>
CREATURES.CREATURES.STATS.AIRPRESSURE.NAME: Air Pressure
CREATURES.CREATURES.STATS.AIRPRESSURE.TOOLTIP: The average <style="KKeyword">Gas</style> density of the air surrounding this plant
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.VIABILITYDELTA.NAME: Viability Loss Rate
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.SCALEGROWTHDELTA.TO: Determines how long this <style="KKeyword">Critter's</style> scales will take to grow back.
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.MILKPRODUCTIONDELTA: Determines how long this <style="KKeyword">Critter</style> takes to replenish its natural supply of <style="KKeyword">Brackene</style>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.WILDNESSDELTA.NAME: Wildness
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.WILDNESSDELTA.DESC: Wild creatures can survive on fewer <style="KKeyword">Calories</style> than domesticated ones.
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.FERTILITYDELTA.NAME: Reproduction Rate
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.FERTILITYDELTA.DESC: Determines the amount of time needed for a <style="KKeyword">Critter</style> to lay new <style="KKeyword">Eggs</style>.
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.MATURITYDELTA.NAME: Growth Speed
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.MATURITYDELTA.DESC: Determines the amount of time needed to reach maturation.
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.MATURITYMAX.NAME: Life Cycle
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.MATURITYMAX.DESC: The amount of time it takes this plant to grow.
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.MATURITY2DELTA.NAME: Fruiting Speed
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.MATURITY2DELTA.DESC: The amount of time it takes this fruit to grow.
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.MATURITY2MAX.NAME: Fruiting Speed
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.MATURITY2MAX.DESC: The amount of time it takes this fruit to grow.
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.ROTDELTA.NAME: Freshness
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.ROTDELTA.TOOLTIP: Food items become stale at fifty percent <style="KKeyword">Freshness</style>, and rot at zero percent
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.BECKONINGDELTA.NAME: Accu-moo-lation
CREATURES.CREATURES.ATTRIBUTES.BECKONINGDELTA.DESC: Accu-moo-lation increases when this critter eats.
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.DOMESTICATION_INCREA: This critter is very happy its needs are being met
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.DOMESTICATION_DECREA: Unfavorable conditions are making this critter unhappy
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.BASE_FERTILITY.NAME: Base Reproduction
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.BASE_FERTILITY.TOOLT: This is the base speed with which critters produce new <style="KKeyword">Eggs</style>
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.INCUBATOR_SONG.NAME: Lullabied
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.INCUBATOR_SONG.TOOLT:
This egg was recently sung to by a kind Duplicant

Increased <style="KKeyword">Incubation Rate</style>

Duplicants must possess the <style="KKeyword">Critter Ranching</style> skill to sing to eggs
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.EGGHUG.NAME: Cuddled
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.EGGHUG.TOOLTIP:
This egg was recently hugged by an affectionate critter

Increased <style="KKeyword">Incubation Rate</style>
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.HUGGINGFRENZY.NAME: Hugging Spree
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.HUGGINGFRENZY.TOOLTI:
This critter was recently hugged by a Duplicant and is feeling extra affectionate

While in this state, it hugs <style="KKeyword">Eggs</style> more frequently
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.INCUBATING.NAME: Incubating
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.INCUBATING_SUPPRESSE:
Environmental conditions are preventing this egg from developing

It will not hatch if current conditions continue
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.GOTMILK.NAME: Hydrated
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.GOTMILK.TOOLTIP:
This critter recently drank <style="KKeyword">Brackene</style>

It doesn't mind overcrowding quite as much right now
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.RANCHED.NAME: Groomed
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.RANCHED.TOOLTIP:
This critter has recently been attended to by a kind Duplicant

Duplicants must possess the <style="KKeyword">Critter Ranching</style> skill to care for critters
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.MOSQUITO_FED.NAME: Stung a Target
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.MOSQUITO_FED.TOOLTIP: This critter recently ruined someone's day
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.DUPE_MOSQUITO_BITE.T: This Duplicant was recently stung by a <style="KKeyword">Gnit</style> and is feeling annoyed
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.DUPE_MOSQUITO_BITE_S: This Duplicant is unbothered by their recent <style="KKeyword">Gnit</style> sting, thanks to <style="KKeyword">Allergy Medication</style>
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.CRITTER_MOSQUITO_BIT: This critter was recently stung by a <style="KKeyword">Gnit</style> and is feeling upset about it
This critter is unbothered by its recent <style="KKeyword">Gnit</style> sting thanks to <style="KKeyword">Allergy Medication</style>
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.HAPPY_WILD.NAME: Mood: Happy
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.HAPPY_WILD.TOOLTIP: This critter's in high spirits because its needs are being exceeded
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.HAPPY_TAME.NAME: Mood: Happy
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.HAPPY_TAME.TOOLTIP:
This critter's in high spirits because its needs are being exceeded

It will lay more eggs as a result
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.NEUTRAL.NAME: Mood: Satisfied
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.NEUTRAL.TOOLTIP:
This critter's needs are being adequately met

It will produce its default amount of materials
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.GLUM.NAME: Mood: Glum
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.GLUM.TOOLTIP:
This critter's feeling down because its needs aren't being met

It will produce less materials as a result
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.MISERABLE.NAME: Mood: Miserable
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.MISERABLE.TOOLTIP:
This critter's wallowing in despair because its needs aren't being met

It will produce less materials as a result, and will not lay eggs
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.ATE_FROM_FEEDER.NAME: Ate From Feeder
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.ATE_FROM_FEEDER.TOOL: This critter is getting more <style="KKeyword">Tame</style> because it ate from a feeder
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.HUNT_FAILED.NAME: Missed Prey
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.HUNT_FAILED.TOOLTIP:
This critter failed to catch a prey critter

It will fare better with elderly or  <style="KKeyword">Tame</style> targets
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.EVADED_HUNT.NAME: Escaped a Predator
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.EVADED_HUNT.TOOLTIP:
This prey critter recently evaded a predator

Whew!
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.WILD.NAME: Wild
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.AGE.NAME: Aging
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.AGE.TOOLTIP: Time takes its toll on all things
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.BABY.NAME: Tiny Baby!
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.BABY.TOOLTIP: This critter will grow into an adult as it ages and becomes wise to the ways of the world
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.TAME.NAME: Tame
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.OUT_OF_CALORIES.NAME: Starving
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.OUT_OF_CALORIES.TOOL: Get this critter something to eat!
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.FUTURE_OVERCROWDED.T:
This <style="KKeyword">Room</style> will become too crowded once all nearby <style="KKeyword">Eggs</style> hatch

The selected critter has slowed its <style="KKeyword">Reproduction</style> to prevent further overpopulation
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.OVERCROWDED.NAME: Crowded
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.OVERCROWDED.TOOLTIP: This critter isn't comfortable with so many other critters in a <style="KKeyword">Room</style> of this size
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.OVERCROWDED.FISHTOOL: This critter is uncomfortable with either the size of this pool, or the number of other critters sharing it
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.CONFINED.NAME: Confined
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.CONFINED.TOOLTIP:
This critter is trapped inside a door, tile, or confined space

Sounds uncomfortable!
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.DIVERGENTPLANTTENDED: A <link="DIVERGENTBEETLE">Sweetle</link> rubbed against this <style="KKeyword">Plant</style> for a tiny growth boost
A <link="DIVERGENTWORM">Grubgrub</link> rubbed against this <style="KKeyword">Plant</style>, dramatically boosting growth
A <link="BUTTERFLY">Mimika</link> visited this <style="KKeyword">Plant</style>, boosting its growth
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.MOOWELLFED.NAME: Welcoming Moo'd
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.MOOWELLFED.TOOLTIP:
This critter's recent meal is boosting their <style="KKeyword">Brackene</style> supply and making them wish all their friends were here

They're thinking about calling a new Gassy Moo to this asteroid
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.WOODDEERWELLFED.NAME: Just Ate
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.WOODDEERWELLFED.TOOL: This critter's recent meal is boosting their antler growth
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.ICEBELLYWELLFED.NAME: Just Ate
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.ICEBELLYWELLFED.TOOL: This critter's recent meal is boosting their fur growth
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.GOLDBELLYWELLFED.TOO: This critter's recent meal is boosting their <style="KKeyword">Regal Bammoth Crest</style> growth
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.RAPTORWELLFED.NAME: Just Ate
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.RAPTORWELLFED.TOOLTI: This critter's recent meal is boosting their feather growth
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.CRITTERCONDOINTERACT: This critter recently enjoyed a visit to a critter condo
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.UNDERWATERCRITTERCON: This critter recently enjoyed a visit to a water fort
CREATURES.CREATURES.MODIFIERS.AIRBORNECRITTERCONDO: This critter recently nested in an airborne critter condo
CREATURES.CREATURES.FERTILITY_MODIFIERS.DIET.NAME: Diet

DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.MODEL.STANDARD.NAME: Standard Duplicant
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.MODEL.STANDARD.DESC:
Standard Duplicants are hard workers who enjoy good <link="FOOD">Food</link>, fresh <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> and creative colony-building.

They will complete errands in order of <link="PRIORITY">Priority</link>.
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.MODEL.BIONIC.NAME: Bionic Duplicant
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.MODEL.BIONIC.NAME_TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is a curious combination of organic and inorganic parts
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.MODEL.BIONIC.DESC:
Bionic Duplicants run on <link="ELECTROBANK">Power Banks</link>, <link="LUBRICATINGOIL">Gear Oil</link> and unbridled enthusiasm.

They should not be permitted to use standard <link="MISCELLANEOUSTIPS">Toilets</link>.
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.MODEL.REMOTEWORKER.NAME: Remote Worker
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.MODEL.REMOTEWORKER.DESC:
A remotely operated work robot.

It performs chores as instructed by a <link="REMOTEWORKTERMINAL">Remote Controller</link> on the same planetoid.
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.GENDER.MALE.NAME: M
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.GENDER.FEMALE.NAME: F
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.GENDER.NB.NAME: X
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.BIONICINTERNALBATTERY.T: A Bionic Duplicant with zero remaining <style="KKeyword">Power</style> will become incapacitated until replacement <style="KKeyword">Power Banks</style> are installed
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.BIONICOXYGENTANK.NAME: Oxygen Tank
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.BIONICOXYGENTANK.TOOLTI:
Bionic Duplicants have internal <style="KKeyword">Oxygen</style> tanks that enable them to work in low breathability areas

They will prioritize <style="KKeyword">Oxygen</style> intake from equipped <style="KKeyword">Exosuits</style> to conserve their internal tanks
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.BIONICOIL.NAME: Gear Oil
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.BIONICOIL.TOOLTIP:
Bionic Duplicants will slow down significantly when <style="KKeyword">Gear Oil</style> levels reach zero

They can oil their joints by visiting a <style="KKeyword">Lubrication Station</style> or using <style="KKeyword">Gear Balm</style>
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.BIONICGUNK.NAME: Gunk
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.BIONICGUNK.TOOLTIP:
Bionic Duplicants become <style="KKeyword">Stressed</style> when too much <style="KKeyword">Gunk</style> builds up in their bionic parts

Regular visits to the <style="KKeyword">Gunk Extractor</style> are required
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.BREATH.NAME: Breath
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.BREATH.TOOLTIP: A Duplicant with zero remaining <style="KKeyword">Breath</style> will die immediately
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.STAMINA.NAME: Stamina
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.STAMINA.TOOLTIP: Duplicants will pass out from fatigue when <style="KKeyword">Stamina</style> reaches zero
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.CALORIES.NAME: Calories
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.TEMPERATURE.NAME: Body Temperature
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.DECOR.NAME: Decor
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.DECOR.TOOLTIP: Duplicants become stressed in areas with Decor lower than their expectations Open the Decor Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay8} to view current Decor values
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.STRESS.NAME: Stress
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.STRESS.TOOLTIP: Duplicants exhibit their Stress Reactions at one hundred percent <style="KKeyword">Stress</style>
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.RADIATIONBALANCE.NAME: Absorbed Rad Dose
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.RADIATIONBALANCE.TOOLTI: Duplicants accumulate Rads in areas with Radiation and recover when using the toilet Open the Radiation Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay15} to view current Rad readings
Duplicants accumulate Rads in areas with Radiation and recover when using the toilet Open the Radiation Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay15} to view current Rad readings
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.BLADDER.NAME: Bladder
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.BLADDER.TOOLTIP: Duplicants make "messes" if no toilets are available at one hundred percent <style="KKeyword">Bladder</style>
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.HITPOINTS.NAME: Health
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.HITPOINTS.TOOLTIP:
When Duplicants reach zero <style="KKeyword">Health</style> they become incapacitated and require rescuing

When critters reach zero <style="KKeyword">Health</style>, they will die immediately
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.SKIN_THICKNESS.NAME: Skin Thickness
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.SKIN_DURABILITY.NAME: Skin Durability
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.TRUNKHEALTH.NAME: Trunk Health
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.TRUNKHEALTH.TOOLTIP: Tree branches will die if they do not have a healthy trunk to grow from
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.VINEMOTHERHEALTH.NAME: Node Health
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.STATS.VINEMOTHERHEALTH.TOOLTI: Vines cannot grow if they do not have a healthy node to grow from

DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.DEATHS.COMBAT.NAME: Slain
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.DEATHS.COMBAT.DESCRIPTION: {Target} succumbed to their wounds after being incapacitated.
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.DEATHS.FATALDISEASE.NAME: Succumbed to Disease
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.DEATHS.FATALDISEASE.DESCRIPTI: {Target} has died of a fatal illness.
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.DEATHS.RADIATION.NAME: Irradiated
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.DEATHS.HITBYHIGHENERGYPARTICL: {Target} was struck by a radioactive <style="KKeyword">Radbolt</style> and perished.
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.THINKING.NAME: Ponder
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.THINKING.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is mulling over what they should do next
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.ASTRONAUT.NAME: Space Mission
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.ASTRONAUT.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is exploring the vast universe
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.DIE.NAME: Die
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.ENTOMBED.NAME: Entombed
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.ENTOMBED.TOOLTIP: Entombed Duplicants are at risk of suffocating and must be dug out by others in the colony
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.BEINCAPACITATED.NAME: Incapacitated
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.BEINCAPACITATED.TOOLTI: This Duplicant will die soon if they do not receive assistance
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.BEOFFLINE.NAME: Powerless
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.BEOFFLINE.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant does not have enough <style="KKeyword">Power</style> to function
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.BIONICBEDTIMEMODE.NAME: Defragment
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.BIONICBEDTIMEMODE.TOOL: This Duplicant is reorganizing their data cache during bedtime
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.GENESHUFFLE.NAME: Use Neural Vacillator
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.GENESHUFFLE.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is being experimented on!
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.MIGRATE.NAME: Use Teleporter
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.MIGRATE.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant's molecules are hurtling through the air!
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.DEBUGGOTO.NAME: DebugGoTo
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.DISINFECT.NAME: Disinfect
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.DISINFECT.TOOLTIP: Buildings can be disinfected to remove contagious <style="KKeyword">Germs</style> from their surface
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.EQUIPPINGSUIT.NAME: Equip Exosuit
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.EQUIPPINGSUIT.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is putting on protective gear
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.STRESSIDLE.NAME: Antsy
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.STRESSIDLE.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is a workaholic and gets stressed when they have nothing to do
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.MOVETO.NAME: Move to
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.MOVETO.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant was manually directed to move to a specific location
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.ROCKETENTEREXIT.NAME: Rocket Recrewing
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.ROCKETENTEREXIT.TOOLTI: This Duplicant is getting into (or out of) their assigned rocket
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.DROPUNUSEDINVENTORY.TO: This Duplicant is dropping carried items they no longer need
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.PEE.NAME: Relieve Self
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.PEE.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant didn't find a toilet in time. Oops
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.EXPELLGUNK.NAME: Expel Gunk
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.EXPELLGUNK.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant didn't get to a <style="KKeyword">Gunk Extractor</style> in time. Urgh
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.OILCHANGE.NAME: Refill Oil
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.OILCHANGE.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is making sure their internal mechanisms stay lubricated
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.BREAK_PEE.NAME: Downtime: Use Toilet
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.BREAK_PEE.TOOLTIP:
This Duplicant has scheduled <style="KKeyword">Downtime</style> and is using their break to go to the toilet

Duplicants have to use the toilet at least once per day
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.STRESSVOMIT.NAME: Stress Vomit
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.STRESSVOMIT.TOOLTIP: Some people deal with <style="KKeyword">Stress</style> better than others
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.UGLY_CRY.NAME: Ugly Cry
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.UGLY_CRY.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is having a healthy cry to alleviate their <style="KKeyword">Stress</style>
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.STRESSSHOCK.NAME: Shock
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.STRESSSHOCK.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant's inability to handle <style="KKeyword">Stress</style> is pretty shocking
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.BINGE_EAT.NAME: Binge Eat
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.BINGE_EAT.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is attempting to eat their emotions due to <style="KKeyword">Stress</style>
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.BANSHEE_WAIL.NAME: Banshee Wail
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.BANSHEE_WAIL.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is emitting ear-piercing shrieks to relieve pent-up <style="KKeyword">Stress</style>
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.EMOTEHIGHPRIORITY.NAME: Express Themselves
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.EMOTEHIGHPRIORITY.TOOL: This Duplicant needs a moment to express their feelings, then they'll be on their way
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.HUG.NAME: Hug
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.HUG.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is enjoying a big warm hug
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.FLEE.NAME: Flee
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.RECOVERBREATH.NAME: Recover Breath
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.RECOVERFROMHEAT.NAME: Recover from Heat
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.RECOVERFROMHEAT.TOOLTI: This Duplicant's trying to cool down
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.RECOVERWARMTH.NAME: Recover from Cold
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.RECOVERWARMTH.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant's trying to warm up
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.MOVETOQUARANTINE.NAME: Move to Quarantine
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.MOVETOQUARANTINE.TOOLT: This Duplicant will isolate themselves to keep their illness away from the colony
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.ATTACK.NAME: Attack
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.CAPTURE.NAME: Wrangle
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.CAPTURE.TOOLTIP: Duplicants that possess the Critter Ranching Skill can wrangle most critters without traps
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.SINGTOEGG.NAME: Sing To Egg
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.SINGTOEGG.TOOLTIP:
A gentle lullaby from a supportive Duplicant encourages developing <style="KKeyword">Eggs</style>

Increases <style="KKeyword">Incubation Rate</style>

Duplicants must possess the <link="RANCHING1">Critter Ranching I</link> skill to sing to an egg
DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.CHORES.USETOILET.NAME: Use Toilet

DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.DISEASES.RADIATIONPOISONING.D: Items tainted with Radioactive Contaminants emit low levels of <link="RADIATION">Radiation</link> that can cause <link="RADIATIONSICKNESS">Radiation Sickness</link>. They are unaffected by pressure or temperature, but do degrade over time.

DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.STARTING_BIONIC_BOOSTE:

DUPLICANTS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.GRANTED_SKILL_SHARED_S: This Duplicant receives a free <style="KKeyword">Skill</style> without the drawback of increased <style="KKeyword">Morale Requirements</style>
