ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.PLACEBO.NAME: Placebo
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.PLACEBO.DESC:
A general, all-purpose <link="MEDICINE">Medicine</link>.

The less one knows about it, the better it works.
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.BASICBOOSTER.NAME: <link="BASICBOOSTER">Vitamin Chews</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.BASICBOOSTER.DESC: Minorly reduces the chance of becoming sick.
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.BASICBOOSTER.RECIPEDESC:
A supplement that minorly reduces the chance of contracting a <style="KKeyword">Germ</style>-based <link="DISEASE">Disease</link>.

Must be taken daily.
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.INTERMEDIATEBOOSTER.NAME: <link="INTERMEDIATEBOOSTER">Immuno Booster</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.INTERMEDIATEBOOSTER.DESC: Significantly reduces the chance of becoming sick.
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.INTERMEDIATEBOOSTER.RECIPEDE:
A supplement that significantly reduces the chance of contracting a <style="KKeyword">Germ</style>-based <link="DISEASE">Disease</link>.

Must be taken daily.
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.ANTIHISTAMINE.NAME: <link="ANTIHISTAMINE">Allergy Medication</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.ANTIHISTAMINE.RECIPEDESC: A strong antihistamine Duplicants can take to halt an allergic reaction. <link="ANTIHISTAMINE">Allergy Medication</link> will also prevent further reactions from occurring for a short time after ingestion.
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.BASICCURE.NAME: <link="BASICCURE">Curative Tablet</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.BASICCURE.DESC: A simple, easy-to-take remedy for minor germ-based diseases.
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.BASICCURE.RECIPEDESC:
Duplicants can take this to cure themselves of minor <style="KKeyword">Germ</style>-based <link="DISEASE">Diseases</link>.

Curative Tablets are very effective against <link="FOODSICKNESS">Food Poisoning</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.INTERMEDIATECURE.NAME: <link="INTERMEDIATECURE">Medical Pack</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.INTERMEDIATECURE.DESC: A doctor-administered cure for moderate ailments.
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.INTERMEDIATECURE.RECIPEDESC:
A doctor-administered cure for moderate <link="DISEASE">Diseases</link>. <link="INTERMEDIATECURE">Medical Pack</link>s are very effective against <link="SLIMESICKNESS">Slimelung</link>.

Must be administered by a Duplicant with the <link="MEDICINE2">Bedside Manner</link> Skill.
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.ADVANCEDCURE.NAME: <link="ADVANCEDCURE">Serum Vial</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.ADVANCEDCURE.DESC: A doctor-administered cure for severe ailments.
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.ADVANCEDCURE.RECIPEDESC:
An extremely powerful medication created to treat severe <link="DISEASE">Diseases</link>. <link="ADVANCEDCURE">Serum Vial</link> is very effective against <link="ZOMBIESPORES">Zombie Spores</link>.

Must be administered by a Duplicant with the <link="MEDICINE3">Advanced Medical Care</link> Skill.
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.BASICRADPILL.NAME: <link="BASICRADPILL">Basic Rad Pill</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.BASICRADPILL.DESC: Increases a Duplicant's natural radiation absorption rate.
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.BASICRADPILL.RECIPEDESC:
A supplement that speeds up the rate at which a Duplicant body absorbs radiation, allowing them to manage increased radiation exposure.

Must be taken daily.
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.INTERMEDIATERADPILL.NAME: <link="INTERMEDIATERADPILL">Intermediate Rad Pill</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.INTERMEDIATERADPILL.DESC: Increases a Duplicant's natural radiation absorption rate.
ITEMS.ITEMS.PILLS.INTERMEDIATERADPILL.RECIPEDE:
A supplement that speeds up the rate at which a Duplicant body absorbs radiation, allowing them to manage increased radiation exposure.

Must be taken daily.
ITEMS.ITEMS.LUBRICATIONSTICK.NAME: <link="LUBRICATIONSTICK">Gear Balm</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.LUBRICATIONSTICK.DESC:
Provides a small amount of lubricating <link="LUBRICATINGOIL">Gear Oil</link>.

Can be produced at the <link="APOTHECARY">Apothecary</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.LUBRICATIONSTICK.RECIPEDESC: A self-administered mechanical lubricant for Duplicants with bionic parts.
ITEMS.ITEMS.TALLOWLUBRICATIONSTICK.NAME: <link="TALLOWLUBRICATIONSTICK">Tallow Gear Balm</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.TALLOWLUBRICATIONSTICK.DESC:
Provides a small amount of extra-silky lubricating <link="LUBRICATINGOIL">Gear Oil</link>.

Can be produced at the <link="APOTHECARY">Apothecary</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.TALLOWLUBRICATIONSTICK.RECIPEDESC: An advanced self-administered mechanical lubricant for Duplicants with bionic parts.
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.FABRICATION_SOURCE: This booster can be manufactured at the {0}.
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_DIG1.NAME: <link="BOOSTERDIG1">Digging Booster</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_DIG1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the skill required to dig hard things.
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_DIG2.NAME: <link="BOOSTERDIG2">Extreme Digging Booster</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_DIG2.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the digging skill required to get through anything.
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_CONSTRUCT1: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the ability to build fast, and demolish buildings that others cannot.
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_FARM1.NAME: <link="BOOSTERFARM1">Crop Tending Booster</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_FARM1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant unparalleled farming and botanical analysis skills.
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_RANCH1.DES: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the skills required to care for <link="CREATURES">Critters</link> in every way.
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_COOK1.NAME: <link="BOOSTERCOOK1">Grilling Booster</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_COOK1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant deliciously professional culinary skills.
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_ART1.NAME: <link="BOOSTERART1">Masterworks Art Booster</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_ART1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant flawless decorating skills.
Grants a Bionic Duplicant the expertise required to study <link="GEYSERS">geysers</link> and other advanced topics.
Grants a Bionic Duplicant a keen grasp of science and usage of space-research buildings.
Grants a Bionic Duplicant a deeply pragmatic approach to scientific research.
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_PILOT1.DES: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the expertise required to explore the skies in person.
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_PILOTVANIL: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the expertise required to command a rocket.
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_SUITS1.DES: Enables a Bionic Duplicant to maximize durability of equipped <link="EQUIPMENT">Exosuits</link> and maintain their runspeed.
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_CARRY1.DES: Grants a Bionic Duplicant increased carrying capacity and athletic prowess.
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_OP1.NAME: <link="BOOSTEROP1">Electrical Engineering Booster</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_OP1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the skills requried to tinker and solder to their heart's content.
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_OP2.NAME: <link="BOOSTEROP2">Mechatronics Engineering Booster</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_OP2.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant complete mastery of engineering skills.
Grants a Bionic Duplicant the ability to perform all doctoring errands.
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_TIDY1.NAME: <link="BOOSTERTIDY1">Tidying Booster</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.BIONIC_BOOSTERS.BOOSTER_TIDY1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the full range of tidying skills, including blasting unwanted meteors out of the sky.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FOODSPLAT.NAME: Food Splatter
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FOODSPLAT.DESC: Food smeared on the wall from a recent Food Fight
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BURGER.NAME: <link="BURGER">Frost Burger</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BURGER.DESC:
<link="MEAT">Meat</link> and <link="LETTUCE">Lettuce</link> on a chilled <link="COLDWHEATBREAD">Frost Bun</link>.

It's the only burger best served cold.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BURGER.DEHYDRATED.NAME: Dried Frost Burger
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BURGER.DEHYDRATED.DESC:
A dehydrated <link="BURGER">Frost Burger</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link="FOOD">Food</link>.

Dry rations have no expiry date.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FIELDRATION.NAME: <link="FIELDRATION">Nutrient Bar</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FIELDRATION.DESC: A nourishing nutrient paste, sandwiched between thin wafer layers.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.MUSHBAR.NAME: <link="MUSHBAR">Mush Bar</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.MUSHBAR.DESC:
An edible, putrefied mudslop.

Mush Bars are preferable to starvation, but only just barely.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.MUSHBAR.RECIPEDESC:
An edible, putrefied mudslop.

<link="MUSHBAR">Mush Bar</link>s are preferable to starvation, but only just barely.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.MUSHROOMWRAP.NAME: <link="MUSHROOMWRAP">Mushroom Wrap</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.MUSHROOMWRAP.DESC:
Flavorful <link="MUSHROOM">Mushrooms</link> wrapped in <link="LETTUCE">Lettuce</link>.

It has an earthy flavor punctuated by a refreshing crunch.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.MUSHROOMWRAP.DEHYDRATED.NAME: Dried Mushroom Wrap
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.MUSHROOMWRAP.DEHYDRATED.DESC:
A dehydrated <link="MUSHROOMWRAP">Mushroom Wrap</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link="FOOD">Food</link>.

Dry rations have no expiry date.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.MICROWAVEDLETTUCE.NAME: <link="MICROWAVEDLETTUCE">Microwaved Lettuce</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.MICROWAVEDLETTUCE.DESC: <link="LETTUCE">Lettuce</link> scrumptiously wilted in the <link="GAMMARAYOVEN">Gamma Ray Oven</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.MICROWAVEDLETTUCE.RECIPEDESC: <link="LETTUCE">Lettuce</link> scrumptiously wilted in the <link="GAMMARAYOVEN">Gamma Ray Oven</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.GAMMAMUSH.NAME: <link="GAMMAMUSH">Gamma Mush</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.GAMMAMUSH.DESC: A disturbingly delicious mixture of irradiated dirt and water.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.GAMMAMUSH.RECIPEDESC: <link="FRIEDMUSHBAR">Mush Fry</link> reheated in a <link="GAMMARAYOVEN">Gamma Ray Oven</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FRUITCAKE.NAME: <link="FRUITCAKE">Berry Sludge</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FRUITCAKE.DESC:
A mashed up <link="PRICKLEFRUIT">Bristle Berry</link> sludge with an exceptionally long shelf life.

Its aggressive, overbearing sweetness can leave the tongue feeling temporarily numb.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FRUITCAKE.RECIPEDESC: A mashed up <link="PRICKLEFRUIT">Bristle Berry</link> sludge with an exceptionally long shelf life.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.POPCORN.NAME: <link="POPCORN">Popcorn</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.POPCORN.DESC:
<link="COLDWHEATSEED">Sleet Wheat Grain</link> popped in a <link="GAMMARAYOVEN">Gamma Ray Oven</link>.

Completely devoid of any fancy flavorings.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SUSHI.NAME: <link="SUSHI">Sushi</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SUSHI.DESC:
Raw <link="FISHMEAT">Pacu Fillet</link> wrapped with fresh <link="LETTUCE">Lettuce</link>.

While the salt of the lettuce may initially overpower the flavor, a keen palate can discern the subtle sweetness of the fillet beneath.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.HATCHEGG.NAME: <link="HATCH">Hatch Egg</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.HATCHEGG.DESC:
An egg laid by a <link="HATCH">Hatch</link>.

If incubated, it will hatch into a <link="HATCH">Hatchling</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.DRECKOEGG.NAME: <link="DRECKO">Drecko Egg</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.DRECKOEGG.DESC:
An egg laid by a <link="DRECKO">Drecko</link>.

If incubated, it will hatch into a new <link="DRECKO">Drecklet</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.LIGHTBUGEGG.NAME: <link="LIGHTBUG">Shine Bug Egg</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.LIGHTBUGEGG.DESC:
An egg laid by a <link="LIGHTBUG">Shine Bug</link>.

If incubated, it will hatch into a <link="LIGHTBUG">Shine Nymph</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.LIGHTBUGEGG.RECIPEDESC: An egg laid by a <link="LIGHTBUG">Shine Bug</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.LETTUCE.NAME: <link="LETTUCE">Lettuce</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.LETTUCE.DESC: Crunchy, slightly salty leaves from a <link="SEALETTUCE">Waterweed</link> plant.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PASTA.NAME: <link="PASTA">Pasta</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PASTA.DESC: pasta made from egg and wheat
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PASTA.RECIPEDESC: pasta made from egg and wheat
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PANCAKES.NAME: <link="PANCAKES">Soufflé Pancakes</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PANCAKES.DESC:
Sweet discs made from <link="RAWEGG">Raw Egg</link> and <link="COLDWHEATSEED">Sleet Wheat Grain</link>.

They're so thick!
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PANCAKES.RECIPEDESC: Sweet discs made from <link="RAWEGG">Raw Egg</link> and <link="COLDWHEATSEED">Sleet Wheat Grain</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.OILFLOATEREGG.NAME: <link="OILFLOATER">Slickster Egg</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.OILFLOATEREGG.DESC:
An egg laid by a <link="OILFLOATER">Slickster</link>.

If incubated, it will hatch into a <link="OILFLOATER">Slickster Larva</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PUFTEGG.NAME: <link="PUFT">Puft Egg</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PUFTEGG.DESC:
An egg laid by a <link="PUFT">Puft</link>.

If incubated, it will hatch into a <link="PUFT">Puftlet</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PREHISTORICPACUFILLET.NAME: <link="PREHISTORICPACUFILLET">Jawbo Fillet</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PREHISTORICPACUFILLET.DESC: An uncooked fillet from a very dead <link="PREHISTORICPACU">Jawbo</link>. It has a silky texture.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FISHMEAT.NAME: <link="FISHMEAT">Pacu Fillet</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FISHMEAT.DESC: An uncooked fillet from a very dead <link="PACU">Pacu</link>. Yum!
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.MEAT.NAME: <link="MEAT">Meat</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.MEAT.DESC: Uncooked meat from a very dead critter. Yum!
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.DINOSAURMEAT.NAME: <link="DINOSAURMEAT">Tough Meat</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.DINOSAURMEAT.DESC:
Uncooked meat from a very dead critter.

It's inedible until cooked in the <link="SMOKER">Smoker</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SMOKEDDINOSAURMEAT.NAME: <link="SMOKEDDINOSAURMEAT">Tender Brisket</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SMOKEDDINOSAURMEAT.DESC: A cooked stack of tough meat that's been marinated and slow-smoked to tender perfection.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SMOKEDDINOSAURMEAT.RECIPEDESC: A stack of tender, slow-smoked meat.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SMOKEDFISH.NAME: <link="SMOKEDFISH">Smoked Fish</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SMOKEDFISH.DESC:
A buttery smoked fish fillet.

It flakes nicely when pulled apart with a fork.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SMOKEDVEGETABLES.NAME: <link="SMOKEDVEGETABLES">Veggie Poppers</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SMOKEDVEGETABLES.DESC: Crisp vegetables stuffed with herbs and smoked for hours.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PLANTMEAT.NAME: <link="PLANTMEAT">Plant Meat</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PLANTMEAT.DESC: Planty plant meat from a plant. How nice!
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SHELLFISHMEAT.NAME: <link="SHELLFISHMEAT">Raw Shellfish</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SHELLFISHMEAT.DESC: An uncooked chunk of very dead <link="CRABFRESHWATER">Sanishell</link>. Yum!
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.MUSHROOM.NAME: <link="MUSHROOM">Mushroom</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.MUSHROOM.DESC: An edible, flavorless fungus that grew in the dark.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.COOKEDFISH.NAME: <link="COOKEDFISH">Cooked Seafood</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.COOKEDFISH.DESC:
A cooked piece of freshly caught aquatic critter.

Unsurprisingly, it tastes a bit fishy.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.COOKEDFISH.RECIPEDESC: A cooked piece of freshly caught aquatic critter.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.COOKEDMEAT.NAME: <link="COOKEDMEAT">Barbeque</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.COOKEDMEAT.DESC:
The cooked meat of a defeated critter.

It has a delightful smoky aftertaste.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.COOKEDMEAT.RECIPEDESC: The cooked meat of a defeated critter.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FRIESCARROT.NAME: <link="FRIESCARROT">Squash Fries</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FRIESCARROT.RECIPEDESC: Crunchy sticks of <link="CARROT">Plume Squash</link> deep-fried in <link="TALLOW">Tallow</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.DEEPFRIEDFISH.NAME: <link="DEEPFRIEDFISH">Fish Taco</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.DEEPFRIEDFISH.DESC: Deep-fried fish cradled in a crunchy fin.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.DEEPFRIEDFISH.RECIPEDESC: <link="FISHMEAT">Pacu Fillet</link> lightly battered and deep-fried in <link="TALLOW">Tallow</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.DEEPFRIEDSHELLFISH.NAME: <link="DEEPFRIEDSHELLFISH">Shellfish Tempura</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.DEEPFRIEDSHELLFISH.RECIPEDESC: A tender chunk of battered <link="SHELLFISHMEAT">Raw Shellfish</link> deep-fried in <link="TALLOW">Tallow</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.DEEPFRIEDMEAT.NAME: <link="DEEPFRIEDMEAT">Deep Fried Steak</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.DEEPFRIEDMEAT.DESC: A juicy slab of meat with a crunchy deep-fried upper layer.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.DEEPFRIEDMEAT.RECIPEDESC: A juicy slab of <link="MEAT">Raw Meat</link> deep-fried in <link="TALLOW">Tallow</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.DEEPFRIEDNOSH.NAME: <link="DEEPFRIEDNOSH">Nosh Noms</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.DEEPFRIEDNOSH.DESC: A snackable handful of crunchy beans.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.DEEPFRIEDNOSH.RECIPEDESC: A crunchy stack of <link="BEANPLANTSEED">Nosh Beans</link> deep-fried in <link="TALLOW">Tallow</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PICKLEDMEAL.NAME: <link="PICKLEDMEAL">Pickled Meal</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PICKLEDMEAL.DESC:
Meal Lice preserved in vinegar.

It's a rarely acquired taste.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FRIEDMUSHBAR.NAME: <link="FRIEDMUSHBAR">Mush Fry</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FRIEDMUSHBAR.DESC:
Pan-fried, solidified mudslop.

The inside is almost completely uncooked, despite the crunch on the outside.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.RAWEGG.NAME: <link="RAWEGG">Raw Egg</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.RAWEGG.DESC:
A raw Egg that has been cracked open for use in <link="FOOD">Food</link> preparation.

It will never hatch.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.RAWEGG.RECIPEDESC: A raw egg that has been cracked open for use in <link="FOOD">Food</link> preparation.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.COOKEDEGG.NAME: <link="COOKEDEGG">Omelette</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.COOKEDEGG.DESC:
Fluffed and folded Egg innards.

It turns out you do, in fact, have to break a few eggs to make it.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FRIEDMUSHROOM.NAME: <link="FRIEDMUSHROOM">Fried Mushroom</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FRIEDMUSHROOM.DESC:
A pan-fried dish made with a fruiting <link="MUSHROOM">Dusk Cap</link>.

It has a thick, savory flavor with subtle earthy undertones.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FRIEDMUSHROOM.RECIPEDESC: A pan-fried dish made with a fruiting <link="MUSHROOM">Dusk Cap</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.COOKEDPIKEAPPLE.NAME: <link="COOKEDPIKEAPPLE">Pikeapple Skewer</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.COOKEDPIKEAPPLE.DESC:
Grilling a <link="HARDSKINBERRY">Pikeapple</link> softens its spikes, making it slighly less awkward to eat.

It does not diminish the smell.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.COOKEDPIKEAPPLE.RECIPEDESC: A grilled dish made with a fruiting <link="HARDSKINBERRY">Pikeapple</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PRICKLEFRUIT.NAME: <link="PRICKLEFRUIT">Bristle Berry</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PRICKLEFRUIT.DESC: A sweet, mostly pleasant-tasting fruit covered in prickly barbs.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.GRILLEDPRICKLEFRUIT.NAME: <link="GRILLEDPRICKLEFRUIT">Gristle Berry</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.GRILLEDPRICKLEFRUIT.DESC:
The grilled bud of a <link="PRICKLEFRUIT">Bristle Berry</link>.

Heat unlocked an exquisite taste in the fruit, though the burnt spines leave something to be desired.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.GRILLEDPRICKLEFRUIT.RECIPEDES: The grilled bud of a <link="PRICKLEFRUIT">Bristle Berry</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SWAMPFRUIT.NAME: <link="SWAMPFRUIT">Bog Jelly</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SWAMPFRUIT.DESC: A fruit with an outer film that contains chewy gelatinous cubes.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SWAMPDELIGHTS.NAME: <link="SWAMPDELIGHTS">Swampy Delights</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SWAMPDELIGHTS.DESC:
Dried gelatinous cubes from a <link="SWAMPFRUIT">Bog Jelly</link>.

Each cube has a wonderfully chewy texture and is lightly coated in a delicate powder.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SWAMPDELIGHTS.RECIPEDESC: Dried gelatinous cubes from a <link="SWAMPFRUIT">Bog Jelly</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.WORMBASICFRUIT.NAME: <link="WORMBASICFRUIT">Spindly Grubfruit</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.WORMBASICFRUIT.DESC:
A <link="WORMSUPERFRUIT">Grubfruit</link> that failed to develop properly.

It is nonetheless edible, and vaguely tasty.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.WORMBASICFOOD.NAME: <link="WORMBASICFOOD">Roast Grubfruit Nut</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.WORMBASICFOOD.DESC:
Slow roasted <link="WORMBASICFRUIT">Spindly Grubfruit</link>.

It has a smoky aroma and tastes of coziness.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.WORMSUPERFRUIT.NAME: <link="WORMSUPERFRUIT">Grubfruit</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.WORMSUPERFRUIT.DESC: A plump, healthy fruit with a honey-like taste.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.WORMSUPERFOOD.NAME: <link="WORMSUPERFOOD">Grubfruit Preserve</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.WORMSUPERFOOD.DESC:
A long lasting <link="WORMSUPERFRUIT">Grubfruit</link> jam preserved in <link="SUCROSE">Sucrose</link>.

The thick, goopy jam retains the shape of the jar when poured out, but the sweet taste can't be matched.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.WORMSUPERFOOD.RECIPEDESC: A long lasting <link="WORMSUPERFRUIT">Grubfruit</link> jam preserved in <link="SUCROSE">Sucrose</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.VINEFRUITJAM.NAME: <link="VINEFRUITJAM"></link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BERRYPIE.NAME: <link="BERRYPIE">Mixed Berry Pie</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BERRYPIE.DESC:
A pie made primarily of <link="WORMSUPERFRUIT">Grubfruit</link> and <link="PRICKLEFRUIT">Gristle Berries</link>.

The mixture of berries creates a fragrant, colorful filling that packs a sweet punch.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BERRYPIE.RECIPEDESC: A pie made primarily of <link="WORMSUPERFRUIT">Grubfruit</link> and <link="PRICKLEFRUIT">Gristle Berries</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BERRYPIE.DEHYDRATED.NAME: Dried Berry Pie
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BERRYPIE.DEHYDRATED.DESC:
A dehydrated <link="BERRYPIE">Mixed Berry Pie</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link="FOOD">Food</link>.

Dry rations have no expiry date.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.COLDWHEATBREAD.NAME: <link="COLDWHEATBREAD">Frost Bun</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.COLDWHEATBREAD.DESC:
A simple bun baked from <link="COLDWHEATSEED">Sleet Wheat Grain</link>.

Each bite leaves a mild cooling sensation in one's mouth, even when the bun itself is warm.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.COLDWHEATBREAD.RECIPEDESC: A simple bun baked from <link="COLDWHEATSEED">Sleet Wheat Grain</link> grain.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BEAN.NAME: <link="BEAN">Nosh Bean</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BEAN.DESC:
The crisp bean of a <link="BEANPLANT">Nosh Sprout</link>.

Each bite tastes refreshingly natural and wholesome.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SPICENUT.NAME: <link="SPICENUT">Pincha Peppernut</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SPICENUT.DESC:
The flavorful nut of a <link="SPICEVINE">Pincha Pepperplant</link>.

The bitter outer rind hides a rich, peppery core that is useful in cooking.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.VINEFRUIT.NAME: <link="VINEFRUIT">Ovagro Fig</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.VINEFRUIT.DESC:
These fruit from an <link="VINEMOTHER">Ovagro Vine</link>.

It's fun to squeeze as many as possible in a single mouthful.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SPICEBREAD.NAME: <link="SPICEBREAD">Pepper Bread</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SPICEBREAD.DESC:
A loaf of bread, lightly spiced with <link="SPICENUT">Pincha Peppernut</link> for a mild bite.

There's a simple joy to be had in pulling it apart in one's fingers.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SPICEBREAD.RECIPEDESC: A loaf of bread, lightly spiced with <link="SPICENUT">Pincha Peppernut</link> for a mild bite.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SPICEBREAD.DEHYDRATED.NAME: Dried Pepper Bread
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SPICEBREAD.DEHYDRATED.DESC:
A dehydrated <link="SPICEBREAD">Pepper Bread</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link="FOOD">Food</link>.

Dry rations have no expiry date.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SURFANDTURF.NAME: <link="SURFANDTURF">Surf'n'Turf</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SURFANDTURF.DESC:
A bit of <link="MEAT">Meat</link> from the land and <link="COOKEDFISH">Cooked Seafood</link> from the sea.

It's hearty and satisfying.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SURFANDTURF.RECIPEDESC: A bit of <link="MEAT">Meat</link> from the land and <link="COOKEDFISH">Cooked Seafood</link> from the sea.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SURFANDTURF.DEHYDRATED.NAME: Dried Surf'n'Turf
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SURFANDTURF.DEHYDRATED.DESC:
A dehydrated <link="SURFANDTURF">Surf'n'Turf</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link="FOOD">Food</link>.

Dry rations have no expiry date.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.TOFU.NAME: <link="TOFU">Tofu</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.TOFU.DESC:
A bland curd made from <link="BEANPLANTSEED">Nosh Beans</link>.

It has an unusual but pleasant consistency.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.TOFU.RECIPEDESC: A bland curd made from <link="BEANPLANTSEED">Nosh Beans</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SPICYTOFU.NAME: <link="SPICYTOFU">Spicy Tofu</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SPICYTOFU.DESC:
<link="TOFU">Tofu</link> marinated in a flavorful <link="SPICENUT">Pincha Peppernut</link> sauce.

It packs a delightful punch.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SPICYTOFU.RECIPEDESC: <link="TOFU">Tofu</link> marinated in a flavorful <link="SPICENUT">Pincha Peppernut</link> sauce.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SPICYTOFU.DEHYDRATED.NAME: Dried Spicy Tofu
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SPICYTOFU.DEHYDRATED.DESC:
A dehydrated <link="SPICYTOFU">Spicy Tofu</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link="FOOD">Food</link>.

Dry rations have no expiry date.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.CURRY.NAME: <link="CURRY">Curried Beans</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.CURRY.DESC:
Chewy <link="BEANPLANTSEED">Nosh Beans</link> simmered with chunks of <link="GINGERCONFIG">Tonic Root</link>.

It's so spicy!
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.CURRY.RECIPEDESC: Chewy <link="BEANPLANTSEED">Nosh Beans</link> simmered with chunks of <link="GINGERCONFIG">Tonic Root</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.CURRY.DEHYDRATED.NAME: Dried Curried Beans
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.CURRY.DEHYDRATED.DESC:
A dehydrated <link="CURRY">Curried Beans</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link="FOOD">Food</link>.

Dry rations have no expiry date.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SALSA.NAME: <link="SALSA">Stuffed Berry</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SALSA.DESC: A baked <link="PRICKLEFRUIT">Bristle Berry</link> stuffed with delectable spices and vibrantly flavored.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SALSA.RECIPEDESC: A baked <link="PRICKLEFRUIT">Bristle Berry</link> stuffed with delectable spices and vibrantly flavored.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SALSA.DEHYDRATED.NAME: Dried Stuffed Berry
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SALSA.DEHYDRATED.DESC:
A dehydrated <link="SALSA">Stuffed Berry</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link="FOOD">Food</link>.

Dry rations have no expiry date.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.HARDSKINBERRY.NAME: <link="HARDSKINBERRY">Pikeapple</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.HARDSKINBERRY.DESC: An edible fruit encased in a thorny husk.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.CARROT.NAME: <link="CARROT">Plume Squash</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.CARROT.DESC: An edible tuber with an earthy, elegant flavor.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FERNFOOD.NAME: <link="FERNFOOD">Megafrond Grain</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FERNFOOD.DESC: An ancient grain that can be processed into <link="FOOD">Food</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PEMMICAN.NAME: <link="PEMMICAN">Pemmican</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PEMMICAN.DESC:
<link="MEAT">Meat</link> and <link="TALLOW">Tallow</link> pounded into a calorie-dense brick with an exceptionally long shelf life.

Survival never tasted so good.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.PEMMICAN.RECIPEDESC: <link="MEAT">Meat</link> and <link="TALLOW">Tallow</link> pounded into a nutrient-dense brick with an exceptionally long shelf life.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BASICPLANTFOOD.NAME: <link="BASICPLANTFOOD">Meal Lice</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BASICPLANTFOOD.DESC: A flavorless grain that almost never wiggles on its own.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BASICPLANTBAR.NAME: <link="BASICPLANTBAR">Liceloaf</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BASICPLANTBAR.DESC: <link="BASICPLANTFOOD">Meal Lice</link> compacted into a dense, immobile loaf.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BASICPLANTBAR.RECIPEDESC: <link="BASICPLANTFOOD">Meal Lice</link> compacted into a dense, immobile loaf.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BASICFORAGEPLANT.NAME: <link="BASICFORAGEPLANT">Muckroot</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BASICFORAGEPLANT.DESC:
A seedless fruit with an upsettingly bland aftertaste.

It cannot be replanted.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a <link="BASICFORAGEPLANT">Muckroot</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FORESTFORAGEPLANT.NAME: <link="FORESTFORAGEPLANT">Hexalent Fruit</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.FORESTFORAGEPLANT.DESC:
A seedless fruit with an unusual rubbery texture.

It cannot be replanted.

Hexalent fruit is much more calorie dense than Muckroot fruit.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SWAMPFORAGEPLANT.NAME: <link="SWAMPFORAGEPLANT">Swamp Chard Heart</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.SWAMPFORAGEPLANT.DESC:
A seedless plant with a squishy, juicy center and an awful smell.

It cannot be replanted.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.ICECAVESFORAGEPLANT.NAME: <link="ICECAVESFORAGEPLANT">Sherberry</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.ICECAVESFORAGEPLANT.DESC:
A cold seedless fruit that triggers mild brain freeze.

It cannot be replanted.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.ROTPILE.NAME: <link="COMPOST">Rot Pile</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.ROTPILE.DESC:
An inedible glop of former foodstuff.

<link="COMPOST">Rot Pile</link>s break down into <link="TOXICSAND">Polluted Dirt</link> over time.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.COLDWHEATSEED.NAME: <link="COLDWHEATSEED">Sleet Wheat Grain</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.COLDWHEATSEED.DESC: An edible grain that leaves a cool taste on the tongue.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BEANPLANTSEED.NAME: <link="BEANPLANTSEED">Nosh Bean</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BEANPLANTSEED.DESC: An inedible bean that can be processed into delicious foods.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.QUICHE.NAME: <link="QUICHE">Mushroom Quiche</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.QUICHE.DESC: Omelette, Fried Mushroom and Lettuce piled onto a yummy crust. Somehow, it's both soggy and crispy.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.QUICHE.RECIPEDESC: <link="COOKEDEGG">Omelette</link>, <link="FRIEDMUSHROOM">Fried Mushroom</link> and <link="LETTUCE">Lettuce</link> piled onto a yummy crust.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.QUICHE.DEHYDRATED.NAME: Dried Mushroom Quiche
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.QUICHE.DEHYDRATED.DESC:
A dehydrated <link="QUICHE">Mushroom Quiche</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link="FOOD">Food</link>.

Dry rations have no expiry date.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.GARDENFOODPLANTFOOD.NAME: <link="GARDENFOODPLANTFOOD">Sweatcorn</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.GARDENFOODPLANTFOOD.DESC:
The sugary fruit of a <link="GARDENFOODPLANT">Sweatcorn Stalk</link>

Sweatcorn is more calorie-dense than <link="GARDENFORAGEPLANT">Snac Fruit</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.GARDENFORAGEPLANT.NAME: <link="GARDENFORAGEPLANT">Snac Fruit</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.GARDENFORAGEPLANT.DESC:
A seedless fruit that loses its flavor long before it is fully chewed.

It cannot be replanted.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a <link="GARDENFORAGEPLANT">Snac Fruit</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BUTTERFLYPLANTSEED.NAME: <link="BUTTERFLYPLANT">Mimillet</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BUTTERFLYPLANTSEED.DESC:
An inedible seed from a <link="BUTTERFLYPLANT">Mimika Bud</link>.

It can be sown to cultivate more plants, or processed into <link="FOOD">Food</link>.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Mimillet Seed.
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BUTTERFLYFOOD.NAME: <link="BUTTERFLYFOOD">Toasted Mimillet</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.FOOD.BUTTERFLYFOOD.DESC:
A lightly toasted <link="BUTTERFLYPLANT">Mimillet</link>.

It makes the tummy feel a bit fluttery.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INGREDIENTS.SWAMPLILYFLOWER.NAME: <link="SWAMPLILYFLOWER">Balm Lily Flower</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.INGREDIENTS.SWAMPLILYFLOWER.DESC:
A medicinal flower that soothes most minor maladies.

It is exceptionally fragrant.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INGREDIENTS.GINGER.NAME: <link="GINGERCONFIG">Tonic Root</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.INGREDIENTS.GINGER.DESC: A chewy, fibrous rhizome with a fiery aftertaste.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INGREDIENTS.KELP.NAME: <link="KELP">Seakomb Leaf</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.INGREDIENTS.KELP.DESC:
The leaf of a <link="KELPPLANT">Seakomb</link>.

It can be processed into <link="PHYTOOIL">Phyto Oil</link> or used as an ingredient in <link="ANTIHISTAMINE ">Allergy Medication</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.ELECTROBANK_UR:
A disposable <link="ELECTROBANK">Power Bank</link> made with <link="URANIUMORE">Uranium Ore</link>.

It can power buildings via <link="LARGEELECTROBANKDISCHARGER">Large Dischargers</link> or <link="SMALLELECTROBANKDISCHARGER">Compact Dischargers</link>.

Duplicants can produce new <link="ELECTROBANK">Uranium Ore Power Banks</link> at the <link="CRAFTINGTABLE">Crafting Station</link>.

Must be kept dry.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.ELECTROBANK_ME:
A disposable <link="ELECTROBANK">Power Bank</link> made with <link="METAL">Metal Ore</link>.

It can power buildings via <link="LARGEELECTROBANKDISCHARGER">Large Dischargers</link> or <link="SMALLELECTROBANKDISCHARGER">Compact Dischargers</link>.

Duplicants can produce new <link="ELECTROBANK">Metal Power Banks</link> at the <link="CRAFTINGTABLE">Crafting Station</link>.

Must be kept dry.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.ELECTROBANK_SE:
A self-charging <link="ELECTROBANK">Power Bank</link> made with <link="ENRICHEDURANIUM">Enriched Uranium</link>.

It can power buildings via <link="LARGEELECTROBANKDISCHARGER">Large Dischargers</link> or <link="SMALLELECTROBANKDISCHARGER">Compact Dischargers</link>.

Its low <link="POWER">wattage</link> and high <link="RADIATION">Radioactivity</link> make it unsuitable for Bionic Duplicant use.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.ELECTROBANK.DE:
A rechargeable <link="ELECTROBANK">Power Bank</link>.

It can power buildings via <link="LARGEELECTROBANKDISCHARGER">Large Dischargers</link> or <link="SMALLELECTROBANKDISCHARGER">Compact Dischargers</link>.

Duplicants can produce new <link="ELECTROBANK">Eco Power Banks</link> at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>.

Must be kept dry.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.ELECTROBANK_EM:
A depleted <link="ELECTROBANK">Power Bank</link>.

It must be recharged at a <link="ELECTROBANKCHARGER">Power Bank Charger</link> before it can be reused.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.ELECTROBANK_GA:
A <link="ELECTROBANK">Power Bank</link> that has reached the end of its lifetime.

It can be salvaged for <link="KATAIRITE">Abyssalite</link> at the <link="ROCKCRUSHER">Rock Crusher</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.FUEL_BRICK.DES:
A densely compressed brick of combustible material.

It can be burned to produce a one-time burst of <link="POWER">Power</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.BASIC_FABRIC.D: A ball of raw cellulose used in the production of <link="EQUIPMENT">Clothing</link> and textiles.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.FEATHER_FABRIC: A stalk of raw keratin used in the production of <link="EQUIPMENT">Clothing</link> and textiles.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.DEWDRIP.NAME: <link="DEWDRIP">Dewdrip</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.DEWDRIP.DESC: A crystallized blob of <link="MILK">Brackene</link> from the <link="DEWDRIPPERPLANT">Dew Dripper</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.TRAP_PARTS.DES: These components can be assembled into a <link="CREATURETRAP">Critter Trap</link> and used to catch <link="CREATURES">Critters</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.POWER_STATION_:
A specialized <link="POWERSTATIONTOOLS">Microchip</link> created by a professional engineer.

Tunes up <link="REQUIREMENTCLASSGENERATORTYPE">Generators</link> to increase their <link="POWER">Power</link> output.

Also used in the production of <link="BOOSTER">Boosters</link> for Bionic Duplicants.
Can only be used by a Duplicant with <link="TECHNICALS2">Electrical Engineering</link> to apply a <style="KKeyword">Tune Up</style>.
Can be used to Tune Up a generator, increasing its {0} by {1}.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.FARM_STATION_T:
Specialized <link="FERTILIZER">Fertilizer</link> mixed by a Duplicant with the <link="FARMING2">Crop Tending</link> Skill.

Increases the <style="KKeyword">Growth Rate</style> of one <link="PLANTS">Plant</link>.
Specialized Parts crafted by a professional engineer.

<style="KKeyword">Jerry Rig</style> machine buildings to increase their efficiency.
Can only be used by a Duplicant with <link="ENGINEERING1">Mechatronics Engineering</link> to apply a <style="KKeyword">Jerry Rig</style>.
Can be used to Jerry Rig upgrades to a machine building, increasing its {0} by {1}.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.RESEARCH_DATAB: Raw data that can be processed into <link="RESEARCH">Interstellar Research</link> points.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.ORBITAL_RESEAR: Raw Data that can be processed into <link="RESEARCHDLC1">Data Analysis Research</link> points.

Data Banks of raw data generated from exploring, either by exploring new areas with Duplicants, or by using an <link="ORBITALRESEARCHCENTER">Orbital Data Collection Lab</link>.

Used by the <link="DLC1COSMICRESEARCHCENTER">Virtual Planetarium</link> to conduct research.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.EGG_SHELL.NAME: <link="EGGSHELL">Egg Shell</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.GOLD_BELLY_CRO: Can be crushed to produce <link="GOLDAMALGAM">Gold Amalgam</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.WOOD.NAME: <link="WOOD">Wood</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.WOOD.DESC:
Natural resource harvested from certain <link="CREATURES">Critters</link> and <link="PLANTS">Plants</link>.

Used in construction or <link="HEAT">Heat</link> production.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.GENE_SHUFFLER_: Replenishes one charge to a depleted Neural Vacillator.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.TABLE_SALT.DES: A seasoning that Duplicants can add to their Food to boost Morale. Duplicants will automatically use Table Salt while sitting at a Mess Table during mealtime. Only the finest grains are chosen.
A seasoning that Duplicants can add to their Food to boost Morale. Duplicants will automatically use Refined Sugar while sitting at a Mess Table during mealtime. Only the finest grains are chosen.
ITEMS.ITEMS.INDUSTRIAL_PRODUCTS.ICE_BELLY_POOP:
A little treat left behind by a very large critter.

It can be crushed to extract <link="PHOSPHORITE">Phosphorite</link> and <link="CLAY">Clay</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.CARGO_CAPSULE.NAME: Care Package
ITEMS.ITEMS.CARGO_CAPSULE.DESC:
A delivery system for recently printed resources.

It will dematerialize shortly.
ITEMS.ITEMS.RAILGUNPAYLOAD.NAME: <link="RAILGUNPAYLOAD">Interplanetary Payload</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.RAILGUNPAYLOAD.DESC:
Contains resources packed for interstellar shipping.

Can be launched by a <link="RAILGUN">Interplanetary Launcher</link> or unpacked with a <link="RAILGUNPAYLOADOPENER">Payload Opener</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.MISSILE_BASIC.NAME: <link="MISSILELAUNCHER">Blastshot</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.MISSILE_BASIC.DESC:
An explosive projectile designed to defend against meteor showers.

Must be launched by a <link="MISSILELAUNCHER">Meteor Blaster</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.MISSILE_LONGRANGE_VANILLADLC4.NAME: <link="MISSILELAUNCHER">Intracosmic Blastshot</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.MISSILE_LONGRANGE_VANILLADLC4.DESC:
A long-range explosive projectile that defends against distant space objects.

Must be launched by <link="MISSILELAUNCHER">Meteor Blaster</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.MISSILE_LONGRANGE.NAME: <link="MISSILELAUNCHER">Intracosmic Blastshot</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.MISSILE_LONGRANGE.DESC:
A long-range explosive projectile that defends against distant space objects.

Must be launched by <link="MISSILELAUNCHER">Meteor Blaster</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.DEBRISPAYLOAD.NAME: Rocket Debris
ITEMS.ITEMS.DEBRISPAYLOAD.DESC: Whatever is left over from a Rocket Self-Destruct can be recovered once it has crash-landed.
ITEMS.ITEMS.RADIATION.HIGHENERGYPARITCLE.NAME: Radbolts
ITEMS.ITEMS.RADIATION.HIGHENERGYPARITCLE.DESC: A concentrated field of <style="KKeyword">Radbolts</style> that can be largely redirected using a <link="HIGHENERGYPARTICLEREDIRECTOR">Radbolt Reflector</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.DREAMJOURNAL.NAME: Dream Journal
ITEMS.ITEMS.DREAMJOURNAL.DESC:
A hand-scrawled account of <link="SLEEPCLINICPAJAMAS">Pajama</link>-induced dreams.

Can be analyzed using a <link="MEGABRAINTANK">Somnium Synthesizer</link>.
ITEMS.ITEMS.DEHYDRATEDFOODPACKAGE.NAME: Dry Ration
ITEMS.ITEMS.DEHYDRATEDFOODPACKAGE.DESC:
A package of non-perishable dehydrated food.

It requires no refrigeration, but must be rehydrated before consumption.
ITEMS.ITEMS.SPICES.MACHINERY_SPICE.NAME: <link="MACHINERYSPICE">Machinist Spice</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.SPICES.PILOTING_SPICE.NAME: <link="PILOTINGSPICE">Rocketeer Spice</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.SPICES.PILOTING_SPICE.DESC: Provides a boost to piloting abilities.
ITEMS.ITEMS.SPICES.PRESERVING_SPICE.NAME: <link="PRESERVINGSPICE">Freshener Spice</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.SPICES.PRESERVING_SPICE.DESC: Slows the decomposition of perishable foods.
ITEMS.ITEMS.SPICES.STRENGTH_SPICE.NAME: <link="STRENGTHSPICE">Brawny Spice</link>
ITEMS.ITEMS.SPICES.STRENGTH_SPICE.DESC: Strengthens even the weakest of muscles.

LORE.LORE.BUILDINGS.PropLocker.ENTRY:
To all employees;

The facility is pleased to announced that starting this week, all Fridays will now be Casual Fridays!

Please enjoy the clinically proven destressing benefits of casual attire by wearing your favorite shirt to the lab.

NOTE: Any personnel found on facility premises without regulation fullbody protection will be put on immediate notice.

Thank-you and have fun!
-Admin
LORE.LORE.BUILDINGS.SET_LOCKER1.ENTRY:
FIRST LAW
Energy can neither be created or destroyed, only change forms.

SECOND LAW
Entropy in an isolated system that is not in equilibrium tends to increase over time, approaching the maximum value at equilibrium.

THIRD LAW
Entropy in a system approaches a constant minimum as temperature approaches absolute zero.

ZEROTH LAW
If two thermodynamic systems are in thermal equilibrium with a third, then they are in thermal equilibrium with each other.
LORE.LORE.BUILDINGS.SET_LOCKER2.ENTRY: A powerful stench emanates from this locker.
LORE.LORE.BUILDINGS.Desk.ENTRY:
TO: JSTERN@GRAVITASFACILITY.NOVA
FROM: EJONES@GRAVITASFACILITY.NOVA
SUBJECT: Preliminary Calculations

Director,

Even with dramatic optimization we can't make the sheer volume of resources required to sustain a colony seed fit for even a small interplanetary travel duration. We'll need to consider serious changes if this is going to work.

E Jones
Information and Statistics Department
The Gravitas Facility
LORE.LORE.BUILDINGS.SET_OBJECT.TITLE: Reminder to Staff
LORE.LORE.BUILDINGS.SET_OBJECT.SUBTITLE: SUBJECT: IMPORTANT
LORE.LORE.BUILDINGS.SET_OBJECT.BODY.CONTAINER: Reminder to All Personnel! From: Admin TO: All ------------------ To all employees; The Gravitas Facility does not officially host a "Bring Your Child To Work Day" office event. We ask that personnel please do not bring children into top secret research departments, and especially that they do not let said children play with the high velocity particle accelerators. We thank you for your understanding.
LORE.LORE.BUILDINGS.VendingMachine.ENTRY:
TO: ALL
FROM: ADMIN@GRAVITASFACILITY.NOVA
SUBJECT: Unattended Cultures

For the health and safety of your fellow Facility employees, please do not store unlabeled bacterial cultures in the cafeteria fridge.
Similarly, be advised that the cafeteria dishwasher is incapable of handling petri "dishes", despite the nomenclature.

We thank you for your consideration.
-The Gravitas Facility
LORE.LORE.BUILDINGS.GeneShuffler.ENTRY: "--fascinating that memories are not already inherent in our subjects; however, none as of yet have shown signs of recognition when introduced to familiar stimuli." "Refer to Experiment 7D." "Refer to Experiment 7F." "Memories must be embedded within the physical brainmaps of our subjects. The only question that remains is--"

MISC.MISC.TAGS.FILTER_DESC:
Filtration Mediums are materials used to separate purified <link="ELEMENTSGAS">gases</link> or <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">liquids</link> from their polluted forms.

They are consumables that will be transformed by the filtering process. For example, <link="SAND">Sand</link> that has been used to filter <link="DIRTYWATER">Polluted Water</link> will become <link="TOXICSAND">Polluted Dirt</link>.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.ICEORE_DESC:
Ice is a class of materials made up mostly (if not completely) of <link="WATER">Water</link> in a frozen or partially frozen form.

As a material in a frigid solid or semi-solid state, these elements are very useful as a low-cost way to cool the environment around them.

When heated, ice will melt into its original liquified form (ie.<link="BRINEICE">Brine Ice</link> will liquify into <link="BRINE">Brine</link>). Each ice element has a different freezing and melting point based upon its composition and state.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.BUILDABLERAW_DESC: Raw minerals are the unrefined forms of organic solids. Almost all raw minerals can be processed in the <link="ROCKCRUSHER">Rock Crusher</link>, although a handful require the use of the <link="SUPERMATERIALREFINERY">Molecular Forge</link>.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.FOSSILS_DESC:
Fossil is a category of composite rocks and minerals that contain traces of petrified lifeforms.

They have varied uses as basic building materials, sculpting blocks, or raw ingredients in the production of higher-grade materials.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.PLASTIFIABLELIQUID_DESC:
Plastic monomers are organic compounds that can be processed into <link="PLASTIC">Plastics</link> that have valuable applications as advanced building materials.

Plastics derived from these monomers can also be used as packaging materials for <link="FOOD">Food</link> preservation.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.UNREFINEDOIL_DESC: Oils in their raw, minimally processed forms. They can be used as industrial lubricants or refined for other applications at designated buildings.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.REFINEDMETAL_DESC:
Refined metals are purified forms of metal often used in higher-tier electronics due to their tendency to be able to withstand higher temperatures when they are made into wires. Other benefits include the increased decor value for some metals which can greatly improve the well-being of a colony.

Metal ore can be refined in either the <link="ROCKCRUSHER">Rock Crusher</link> or the <link="METALREFINERY">Metal Refinery</link>.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.METAL_DESC:
Metal ore is the raw form of metal, and has a wide variety of practical applications in electronics and general construction.

Metal ore is typically processed into <link="REFINEDMETAL">Refined Metal</link> using the <link="ROCKCRUSHER">Rock Crusher</link> or the <link="METALREFINERY">Metal Refinery</link>.

Some rare metal ores can also be refined in the <link="SUPERMATERIALREFINERY">Molecular Forge</link>.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.PRECIOUSROCK_DESC:
Precious rocks are raw minerals. Their extreme hardness produces durable <link="DECOR">Decor</link>.

Some precious rocks are inherently attractive even in their natural, unfinished form.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.BUILDINGFIBER_DESC: Fibers are organically sourced polymers which are both sturdy and sensorially pleasant, making them suitable in the construction of <link="MORALE">Morale</link>-boosting buildings.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.BUILDINGWOOD_DESC: Wood is a renewable building material which can also be used as a valuable source of fuel and electricity when refined at the <link="WOODGASGENERATOR">Wood Burner</link> or the <link="ETHANOLDISTILLERY">Ethanol Distiller</link>.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.LUBRICATINGOIL_DESC: Gear oils are lubricating fluids useful in the maintenance of complex machinery, protecting gear systems from damage and minimizing friction between moving parts to support optimal performance.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.REMOTEOPERABLE_DESC: These buildings can be operated from a distance by a <link="REMOTEWORKTERMINAL">Remote Controller</link> so long as they are built within range of a <link="REMOTEWORKERDOCK">Remote Worker Dock</link>.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.FARMABLE_DESC: Cultivable soil is a fundamental building block of basic agricultural systems and can also be useful in the production of clean <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link>.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.SUBLIMATING_DESC:
Sublimators are a class of <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> elements that passively convert to a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gaseous</link> state. When off-gassing is complete, no trace of the original solid remains.

This passive conversion persists when the element is left in storage.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.COMPOSTABLE_DESC:
Compostables are biological materials which can be put into a <link="COMPOST">Compost</link> to generate clean <link="DIRT">Dirt</link>.

Composting also generates a small amount of <link="HEAT">Heat</link>.

Once it starts to rot, consumable food should be composted to prevent <link="FOODSICKNESS">Food Poisoning</link>.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.PLASTIC_DESC: Plastics are synthetic <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solids</link> that are pliable and minimize the transfer of <link="HEAT">Heat</link>. They typically have a low melting point, although more advanced plastics have been developed to circumvent this issue.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.TRANSPARENT_DESC:
Transparent materials allow <link="LIGHT">Light</link> to pass through. Illumination boosts Duplicant productivity during working hours, but undermines sleep quality.

Transparency is also important for buildings that require a clear line of sight in order to function correctly, such as the <link="COMETDETECTOR">Space Scanner</link>.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.INSULATOR_DESC: Insulators have low thermal conductivity, and effectively reduce the speed at which <link="HEAT">Heat</link> is transferred through them.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.COMBUSTIBLEGAS_DESC: Combustible Gases can be burned as fuel to be used in the production of <link="POWER">Power</link> and <link="FOOD">Food</link>.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.COMBUSTIBLELIQUID_DESC:
Combustible Liquids can be burned as fuels to be used in energy production, such as in a <link="PETROLEUMGENERATOR">Petroleum Generator</link> or a <link="KEROSENEENGINE">Petroleum Engine</link>.

Though these liquids have other uses, such as fertilizer for growing a <link="BEANPLANTSEED">Nosh Bean</link>, their primary usefulness lies in their ability to be burned for <link="POWER">Power</link>.
MISC.MISC.TAGS.COMBUSTIBLESOLID_DESC: Combustible Solids can be burned as fuel to be used in <link="POWER">Power</link> production.

MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.BASICCONTROLS.NAME: Tutorial: Basic Controls
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.BASICCONTROLS.MESSAGE:
• I can use {Hotkey/PanLeft} and {Hotkey/PanRight} to pan my view left and right, and {Hotkey/PanUp} and {Hotkey/PanDown} to pan up and down.

• {Hotkey/ZoomIn} lets me zoom in, and {Hotkey/ZoomOut} zooms out.

• {Hotkey/CameraHome} returns my view to the Printing Pod.

• I can speed or slow my perception of time using the top left corner buttons, or by pressing {Hotkey/SpeedUp} or {Hotkey/SlowDown}. Pressing {Hotkey/TogglePause} will pause the flow of time entirely.

• I'll keep records of everything I discover in my personal DATABASE {Hotkey/ManageDatabase} to refer back to if I forget anything important.

• I can use {Hotkey/AnalogCamera} to pan my view.

• {Hotkey/ZoomIn} lets me zoom in, and {Hotkey/ZoomOut} zooms out.

• I can speed or slow my perception of time using the top left corner buttons, or by pressing {Hotkey/CycleSpeed}. Pressing {Hotkey/TogglePause} will pause the flow of time entirely.

• I'll keep records of everything I discover in my personal DATABASE {Hotkey/ManageDatabase} to refer back to if I forget anything important.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.CODEXUNLOCK.NAME: New Log Entry
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.CODEXUNLOCK.MESSAGEBO: I've added a new log entry to my Database
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.CODEXUNLOCK.TOOLTIP: I've added a new log entry to my Database
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.WELCOMEMESSAGE.NAME: Tutorial: Colony Management
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.WELCOMEMESSAGE.MESSAG: I can use the Dig Tool {Hotkey/Dig} and the Build Menu in the lower left of the screen to begin planning my first construction tasks. Once I've placed a few errands my Duplicants will automatically get to work, without me needing to direct them individually.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.WELCOMEMESSAGE.TOOLTI: Notes on getting Duplicants to do my bidding
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.STRESSMANAGEMENTMESSA:
At 100% <link="STRESS">Stress</link>, a Duplicant will have a nervous breakdown and be unable to work.

Breakdowns can manifest in different colony-threatening ways, such as the destruction of buildings or the binge eating of food.

I can help my Duplicants manage stressful situations by giving them access to good <link="FOOD">Food</link>, fancy <link="DECOR">Decor</link> and comfort items which boost their <link="MORALE">Morale</link>.

I can select a Duplicant and mouse over <link="STRESS">Stress</link> or <link="MORALE">Morale</link> in their CONDITION TAB to view current statuses, and hopefully manage things before they become a problem.

Related <link="VIDEOS13">Video: Duplicant Morale</link>
Notes on keeping Duplicants happy and productive
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.TASKPRIORITIESMESSAGE: Duplicants always perform errands in order of highest to lowest priority. They will harvest Food before they build, for example, or always build new structures before they mine materials. I can open the Priorities Screen {Hotkey/ManagePriorities} to set which Errand Types Duplicants may or may not perform, or to specialize skilled Duplicants for particular Errand Types.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.MOPPINGMESSAGE.NAME: Tutorial: Polluted Water
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.MOPPINGMESSAGE.MESSAG: Polluted Water slowly emits Polluted Oxygen which accelerates the spread of Disease. Duplicants will also be Stressed by walking through Polluted Water, so I should have my Duplicants clean up spills by (ClickType/clicking) and dragging the Mop Tool {Hotkey/Mop}
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.LOCOMOTIONMESSAGE.MES: Duplicants have limited jumping and climbing abilities. They can only climb two tiles high and cannot fit into spaces shorter than two tiles, or cross gaps wider than one tile. I should keep this in mind while placing errands. To check if an errand I've placed is accessible, I can select a Duplicant and (ClickType/click) Show Navigation to view all areas within their reach.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.PRIORITIESMESSAGE.MES: Duplicants will choose where to work based on the priority of the errands that I give them. I can open the Priorities Screen {Hotkey/ManagePriorities} to set their Duplicant Priorities, and the Priority Tool {Hotkey/Prioritize} to fine tune Building Priority. Many buildings will also let me change their Priority level when I select them.
By building a Pitcher Pump from the Plumbing Tab {Hotkey/Plan5} over a pool of liquid, my Duplicants will be able to bottle it up and manually deliver it wherever it needs to go.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.SCHEDULEMESSAGE.NAME: Tutorial: Scheduling
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.SCHEDULEMESSAGE.MESSA: My Duplicants will only eat, sleep, work, or bathe during the times I allot for such activities. To make the best use of their time, I can open the Schedule Tab {Hotkey/ManageSchedule} to adjust the colony's schedule and plan how they should utilize their day.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.SCHEDULEMESSAGE.TOOLT: Notes on scheduling my Duplicants' time
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.THERMALCOMFORT.NAME: Tutorial: Duplicant Temperature
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.THERMALCOMFORT.TOOLTI: Notes on helping Duplicants keep their cool
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.THERMALCOMFORT.MESSAG: Environments that are extremely Hot or Cold affect my Duplicants' internal body temperature and cause undue Stress or unscheduled naps. Opening the Temperature Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay3} and checking the Thermal Tolerance box allows me to view all areas where my Duplicants will feel discomfort and be unable to regulate their internal body temperature. Related Video: Insulation
Notes on preventing building from breaking

When constructing buildings, I should always take note of their Overheat Temperature and plan their locations accordingly. Maintaining low ambient temperatures and good ventilation in the colony will also help keep building temperatures down. The Relative Temperature slider tool in the Temperature Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay3} allows me to change adjust the overlay's color-coding in order to highlight specific temperature ranges. If I allow buildings to exceed their Overheat Temperature they will begin to take damage, and if left unattended, they will break down and be unusable until repaired.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.LOTS_OF_GERMS.NAME: Tutorial: Germs and Disease
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.LOTS_OF_GERMS.MESSAGE: Germs such as Food Poisoning and Slimelung can cause Disease in my Duplicants. I can use the Germ Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay9} to view all germ concentrations in my colony, and even detect the sources spawning them. Building Wash Basins from the Medicine Tab {Hotkey/Plan8} near colony toilets will tell my Duplicants they need to wash up. Related Video: Plumbing and Ventilation
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.BEING_INFECTED.NAME: Tutorial: Immune Systems
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.BEING_INFECTED.TOOLTI: Notes on keeping Duplicants in peak health
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.BEING_INFECTED.MESSAG: When Duplicants come into contact with various Germs, they'll need to expend points of Immunity to resist them and remain healthy. If repeated exposes causes their Immunity to drop to 0%, they'll be unable to resist germs and will contract the next disease they encounter. Doors with Access Permissions can be built from the BASE TAB [1] of the Build menu to block Duplicants from entering biohazardous areas while they recover their spent immunity points.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.DISEASE_COOKING.NAME: Tutorial: Food Safety
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.DISEASE_COOKING.MESSA: The Food my Duplicants cook will only ever be as clean as the ingredients used to make it. Storing food in sterile or Refrigerated environments will keep food free of Germs, while carefully placed hygiene stations like Wash Basin or Shower will prevent the cooks from infecting the food by handling it. Dangerously contaminated food can be sent to compost by (ClickType/clicking) the Compost button on the selected item.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.SUITS.NAME: Tutorial: Atmo Suits
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.SUITS.MESSAGEBODY:
<link="ATMOSUIT">Atmo Suits</link> can be equipped to protect my Duplicants from environmental hazards like extreme <link="HEAT">Heat</link>, airborne <link="DISEASE">Germs</link>, or unbreathable <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link>. In order to utilize these suits, I'll need to hook up an <link="SUITLOCKER">Atmo Suit Dock</link> to an <link="SUITMARKER">Atmo Suit Checkpoint</link> , then store one of the suits inside.

Duplicants will equip a suit when they walk past the checkpoint in the chosen direction, and will unequip their suit when walking back the opposite way.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.RADIATION.NAME: Tutorial: Radiation
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.RADIATION.MESSAGEBODY: Objects such as Uranium Ore and Beeta Hives emit a Radioactive energy that can be toxic to my Duplicants. I can use the Radiation Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay15} to check the scope of the Radiation field. Building thick walls around radiation emitters will dampen the field and protect my Duplicants from getting Radiation Sickness .
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.SPACETRAVEL.NAME: Tutorial: Space Travel
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.SPACETRAVEL.MESSAGEBO:
Building a rocket first requires constructing a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> and adding modules from the menu. All components of the Rocket Checklist will need to be complete before being capable of launching.

A <link="CLUSTERTELESCOPE">Telescope</link> needs to be built on the surface of a Planetoid in order to use the <style="KKeyword">Starmap Screen</style> {Hotkey/ManageStarmap} to see and set course for new destinations.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.MORALE.NAME: Video: Duplicant Morale
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.MORALE.MESSAGEBODY:
Food, Rooms, Decor, and Recreation all have an effect on Duplicant Morale. Good experiences improve their Morale, while poor experiences lower it. When a Duplicant's Morale is below their Expectations, they will become Stressed.

Duplicants' Expectations will get higher as they are given new Skills, and the colony will have to be improved to keep up their Morale. An overview of Morale and Stress can be viewed on the Vitals screen.

Related <link="MISCELLANEOUSTIPS">Tutorial: Stress Management</link>
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.POWER.NAME: Video: Power Circuits
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.POWER.MESSAGEBODY:
Generators are considered "Producers" of Power, while the various buildings and machines in the colony are considered "Consumers". Each Consumer will pull a certain wattage from the power circuit it is connected to, which can be checked at any time by (ClickType/clicking) the building and going to the Energy Tab.

I can use the Power Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay2} to quickly check the status of all my circuits. If the Consumers are taking more wattage than the Generators are creating, the Batteries will drain and there will be brownouts.

Additionally, if the Consumers are pulling more wattage through the Wires than the Wires can handle, they will overload and burn out. To correct both these situations, I will need to reorganize my Consumers onto separate circuits.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.BIONICBATTERY.NAME: Tutorial: Powering Bionics
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.BIONICBATTERY.TOOLTIP: Notes on Duplicant power bank needs
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.BIONICBATTERY.MESSAGE:
Bionic Duplicants require <link="ELECTROBANK">Power Banks</link> to function. Bionic Duplicants who run out of <link="POWER">Power</link> will become incapacitated and require another Duplicant to reboot them.

Basic power banks can be made at the <link="CRAFTINGTABLE">Crafting Station</link>.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.GUNKEDTOILET.NAME: Tutorial: Gunked Toilets
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.GUNKEDTOILET.MESSAGEB: Bionic Duplicants can dump built-up Gunk into Toilets if no other options are available. This invariably clogs the plumbing, however, and must be removed before facilities can be used by other Duplicants. Building a Gunk Extractor from the Plumbing Tab {Hotkey/Plan5} will ensure that Bionic Duplicants can dispose of their waste appropriately.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.SLIPPERYSURFACE.NAME: Tutorial: Wet Surfaces
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.SLIPPERYSURFACE.MESSA: My Duplicants may slip and fall on wet surfaces, and Duplicants with bionic systems can experience disruptive glitching. I can help my colony avoid undue Stress and potential injury by using the Mop Tool {Hotkey/Mop} to clean up spills. Building Toilets and Gunk Extractors can help minimize the incidence of spills.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.BIONICOIL.NAME: Tutorial: Oiling Bionics
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.BIONICOIL.TOOLTIP: Notes on keeping Bionics working efficiently
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.BIONICOIL.MESSAGEBODY: Bionic Duplicants with insufficient Gear Oil will slow down significantly to avoid grinding their gears. I can keep them running smoothly by supplying Gear Balm, or by building a Lubrication Station from the Medicine Tab {Hotkey/Plan8}.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.DIGGING.NAME: Video: Digging for Resources
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.DIGGING.MESSAGEBODY:
Everything a colony needs to get going is found in the ground. Instructing Duplicants to dig out areas means we can find food, mine resources to build infrastructure, and clear space for the colony to grow. I can access the Dig Tool with {Hotkey/Dig}, which allows me to select the area where I want my Duplicants to dig.

Duplicants will need to gain the Superhard Digging skill to mine Abyssalite and the Superduperhard Digging skill to mine Diamond and Obsidian. Without the proper skills, these materials will be undiggable.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.INSULATION.NAME: Video: Insulation
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.INSULATION.MESSAGEBOD:
The temperature of an environment can have positive or negative effects on the well-being of my Duplicants, as well as the plants and critters in my colony. Selecting {Hotkey/Overlay3} will open the Temperature Overlay where I can check for any hot or cold spots.

I can use a Utility building like an Ice-E Fan or a Space Heater to make an area colder or warmer. However, I will have limited success changing the temperature of a room unless I build the area with insulating tiles to prevent cold or warm air from escaping.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.PLUMBING.NAME: Video: Plumbing and Ventilation
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.PLUMBING.TOOLTIP: Notes on connecting buildings with pipes
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.PLUMBING.MESSAGEBODY:
When connecting pipes for plumbing, it is useful to have the Plumbing Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay6} selected. Each building which requires plumbing must have their Building Intake connected to the Output Pipe from a source such as a Liquid Pump. Liquid Pumps must be submerged in liquid and attached to a power source to function.

Buildings often output contaminated water which must flow out of the building through piping from the Output Pipe. The water can then be expelled through a Liquid Vent, or filtered through a Water Sieve for reuse.

Ventilation applies the same principles to gases. Select the Ventilation Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay7} to see how gases are being moved around the colony.
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.NEW_AUTOMATION_WARNIN: This building has a new automation port and is unintentionally connected to an existing <link="LOGICWIRE">Automation Wire</link>
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.DTU.NAME: Tutorial: Duplicant Thermal Units
MISC.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.DTU.MESSAGEBODY:
My Duplicants measure heat energy in Duplicant Thermal Units or DTU.

1 DTU = 1055.06 J

RESEARCH.RESEARCH.MESSAGING.NO_RESEARCHER_SKILL_T: The selected research focus requires {ResearchType} to complete Open the Skills Panel {Hotkey/ManageSkills} and teach a Duplicant the {ResearchType} Skill to use this building
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.MESSAGING.MISSING_RESEARCH_STAT: The selected research focus requires a {0} to perform Open the Stations Tab {Hotkey/Plan10} of the Build Menu to construct one
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TYPES.ALPHA.NAME: Novice Research
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TYPES.ALPHA.DESC:
<link="RESEARCH">Novice Research</link> is required to unlock basic technologies.
It can be conducted at a <link="RESEARCHCENTER">Research Station</link>.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TYPES.BETA.NAME: Advanced Research
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TYPES.BETA.DESC:
<link="RESEARCH">Advanced Research</link> is required to unlock improved technologies.
It can be conducted at a <link="ADVANCEDRESEARCHCENTER">Super Computer</link>.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TYPES.GAMMA.NAME: Interstellar Research
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TYPES.GAMMA.DESC:
<link="RESEARCH">Interstellar Research</link> is required to unlock space technologies.
It can be conducted at a <link="COSMICRESEARCHCENTER">Virtual Planetarium</link>.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TYPES.DELTA.NAME: Applied Sciences Research
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TYPES.DELTA.DESC:
<link="RESEARCH">Applied Sciences Research</link> is required to unlock materials science technologies.
It can be conducted at a <link="NUCLEARRESEARCHCENTER">Materials Study Terminal</link>.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TYPES.ORBITAL.NAME: Data Analysis Research
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TYPES.ORBITAL.DESC:
<link="RESEARCH">Data Analysis Research</link> is required to unlock Data Analysis technologies.
It can be conducted at a <link="ORBITALRESEARCHCENTER">Orbital Data Collection Lab</link>.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.JET_SUIT.NAME: <style="KKeyword">Jet Suit</style> Pattern
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.JET_SUIT.DESC: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Jet Suits</style> at the <link="SUITFABRICATOR">Exosuit Forge</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.OXYGEN_MASK.DE: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Oxygen Masks</style> at the <link="CRAFTINGTABLE">Crafting Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.LEAD_SUIT.NAME: <style="KKeyword">Lead Suit</style> Pattern
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.LEAD_SUIT.DESC: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Lead Suits</style> at the <link="SUITFABRICATOR">Exosuit Forge</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.ATMO_SUIT.NAME: <style="KKeyword">Atmo Suit</style> Pattern
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.ATMO_SUIT.DESC: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Atmo Suits</style> at the <link="SUITFABRICATOR">Exosuit Forge</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.BETA_RESEARCH_: Allows <style="KKeyword">Advanced Research</style> points to be accumulated, unlocking higher technology tiers.

RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.DELTA_RESEARCH: Allows <style="KKeyword">Materials Science Research</style> points to be accumulated, unlocking higher technology tiers.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.ORBITAL_RESEAR: Allows <style="KKeyword">Data Analysis Research</style> points to be accumulated, unlocking higher technology tiers.

RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.LUBRICATION_ST: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Gear Balm</style> at the <link="APOTHECARY">Apothecary</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.DISPOSABLE_ELE: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Metal Power Banks</style> at the <link="CRAFTINGTABLE">Crafting Station</link>
Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Uranium Ore Power Banks</style> at the <link="CRAFTINGTABLE">Crafting Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.ELECTROBANK.DE: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Eco Power Banks</style> at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.SELFCHARGINGEL: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Atomic Power Bank</style> at the <link="SUPERMATERIALREFINERY">Molecular Forge</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.FETCHDRONE.DES: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Flydo</style> at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.PILOTINGBOOSTE: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Rocketry Boosters</style> for Bionic Duplicants at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.CONSTRUCTIONBO: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Building Boosters</style> for Bionic Duplicants at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.EXCAVATIONBOOS: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Digging Boosters</style> for Bionic Duplicants at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.EXPLORERBOOSTE: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Dowsing Boosters</style> for Bionic Duplicants at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.MACHINERYBOOST: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Operating Boosters</style> for Bionic Duplicants at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.ATHLETICSBOOST: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Athletics Boosters</style> for Bionic Duplicants at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.SCIENCEBOOSTER: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Researching Boosters</style> for Bionic Duplicants at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.COOKINGBOOSTER: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Cooking Boosters</style> for Bionic Duplicants at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.MEDICINEBOOSTE: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Doctoring Boosters</style> for Bionic Duplicants at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.STRENGTHBOOSTE: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Strength Boosters</style> for Bionic Duplicants at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.CREATIVITYBOOS: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Decorating Boosters</style> for Bionic Duplicants at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.AGRICULTUREBOO: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Farming Boosters</style> for Bionic Duplicants at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.OTHER_TECH_ITEMS.HUSBANDRYBOOST: Enables fabrication of <style="KKeyword">Ranching Boosters</style> for Bionic Duplicants at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.JOBS.NAME: <link="JOBS">Employment</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.JOBS.DESC: Exchange the skill points earned by Duplicants for new traits and abilities.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.IMPROVEDOXYGEN.NAME: <link="IMPROVEDOXYGEN">Air Systems</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.IMPROVEDOXYGEN.DESC: Maintain clean, breathable air in the colony.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.FARMINGTECH.NAME: <link="FARMINGTECH">Basic Farming</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.FARMINGTECH.DESC: Learn the introductory principles of <link="PLANTS">Plant</link> domestication.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.AGRICULTURE.NAME: <link="AGRICULTURE">Agriculture</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.AGRICULTURE.DESC: Master the agricultural art of crop raising.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.RANCHING.NAME: <link="RANCHING">Ranching</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.RANCHING.DESC: Tame and care for wild critters.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ANIMALCONTROL.NAME: <link="ANIMALCONTROL">Animal Control</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ANIMALCONTROL.DESC: Useful techniques to manage critter populations in the colony.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ANIMALCOMFORT.NAME: <link="ANIMALCOMFORT">Creature Comforts</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ANIMALCOMFORT.DESC: Strategies for maximizing critters' quality of life.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.DAIRYOPERATION.NAME: <link="DAIRYOPERATION">Brackene Flow</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.DAIRYOPERATION.DESC: Advanced production, processing and distribution of this fluid resource.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.FOODREPURPOSING.NAME: <link="FOODREPURPOSING">Food Repurposing</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.FOODREPURPOSING.DESC: Blend that leftover <link="FOOD">Food</link> into a <link="MORALE">Morale</link>-boosting slurry.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.FINEDINING.NAME: <link="FINEDINING">Meal Preparation</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.FINEDINING.DESC: Prepare more nutritious <link="FOOD">Food</link> and store it longer before spoiling.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.FINERDINING.NAME: <link="FINERDINING">Gourmet Meal Preparation</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.FINERDINING.DESC: Raise colony Morale by cooking the most delicious, high-quality <link="FOOD">Foods</link>.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.GASPIPING.NAME: <link="GASPIPING">Ventilation</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.IMPROVEDGASPIPING.NAME: <link="IMPROVEDGASPIPING">Improved Ventilation</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.IMPROVEDGASPIPING.DESC: <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link> infrastructure capable of withstanding more intense conditions, such as <link="HEAT">Heat</link> and pressure.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.FLOWREDIRECTION.NAME: <link="FLOWREDIRECTION">Flow Redirection</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.LIQUIDDISTRIBUTION.NAME: <link="LIQUIDDISTRIBUTION">Liquid Distribution</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.LIQUIDDISTRIBUTION.DESC: Advanced fittings ensure that <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> resources get where they need to go.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.TEMPERATUREMODULATION.DES: Precise <link="HEAT">Temperature</link> altering technologies to keep my colony at the perfect Kelvin.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.HVAC.NAME: <link="HVAC">HVAC</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.HVAC.DESC: Regulate <link="HEAT">Temperature</link> in the colony for <link="PLANTS">Plant</link> cultivation and Duplicant comfort.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.GASDISTRIBUTION.NAME: <link="GASDISTRIBUTION">Gas Distribution</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.GASDISTRIBUTION.DESC: Design building hookups to get <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link> resources circulating properly.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.LIQUIDTEMPERATURE.NAME: <link="LIQUIDTEMPERATURE">Liquid Tuning</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.LIQUIDTEMPERATURE.DESC: Easily manipulate <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> <link="TEMPERATURES">Heat</link> with these temperature regulating technologies.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.INSULATION.NAME: <link="INSULATION">Insulation</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.INSULATION.DESC: Improve <link="HEAT">Heat</link> distribution within the colony and guard buildings from extreme temperatures.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.PRESSUREMANAGEMENT.NAME: <link="PRESSUREMANAGEMENT">Pressure Management</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.PRESSUREMANAGEMENT.DESC: Unlock technologies to manage colony pressure and atmosphere.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.PORTABLEGASSES.NAME: <link="PORTABLEGASSES">Portable Gases</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.PORTABLEGASSES.DESC: Unlock technologies to easily move gases around your colony.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.DIRECTEDAIRSTREAMS.NAME: <link="DIRECTEDAIRSTREAMS">Decontamination</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.DIRECTEDAIRSTREAMS.DESC: Instruments to help reduce <link="DISEASE">Germ</link> spread within the base.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.LIQUIDFILTERING.NAME: <link="LIQUIDFILTERING">Liquid-Based Refinement Processes</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.LIQUIDFILTERING.DESC: Use pumped <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquids</link> to filter out unwanted elements.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.LIQUIDPIPING.NAME: <link="LIQUIDPIPING">Plumbing</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.IMPROVEDLIQUIDPIPING.NAME: <link="IMPROVEDLIQUIDPIPING">Improved Plumbing</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.IMPROVEDLIQUIDPIPING.DESC: <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> infrastructure capable of withstanding more intense conditions, such as <link="HEAT">Heat</link> and pressure.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.PRECISIONPLUMBING.NAME: <link="PRECISIONPLUMBING">Advanced Caffeination</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.PRECISIONPLUMBING.DESC: Let Duplicants relax after a long day of subterranean digging with a shot of warm beanjuice.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SANITATIONSCIENCES.NAME: <link="SANITATIONSCIENCES">Sanitation</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SANITATIONSCIENCES.DESC: Make daily ablutions less of a hassle.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ADVANCEDSANITATION.NAME: <link="ADVANCEDSANITATION">Advanced Sanitation</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.MEDICINEI.NAME: <link="MEDICINEI">Pharmacology</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.MEDICINEI.DESC: Compound natural cures to fight the most common <link="SICKNESSES">Sicknesses</link> that plague Duplicants.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.MEDICINEII.NAME: <link="MEDICINEII">Medical Equipment</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.MEDICINEII.DESC: The basic necessities doctors need to facilitate patient care.

RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ACOUSTICS.DESC: Precise control of the audio spectrum allows Duplicants to get funky.

RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.AMPLIFIERS.DESC: Further increased efficacy of <link="POWER">Power</link> management to prevent those wasted joules.

RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ENVIRONMENTALAPPRECIATION: Improve <link="MORALE">Morale</link> by lazing around in <link="LIGHT">Light</link> with a high Lux value.

RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.REFRACTIVEDECOR.DESC: New methods for working with extremely high quality art materials.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.RENAISSANCEART.NAME: <link="RENAISSANCEART">Renaissance Art</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.RENAISSANCEART.DESC: The kind of art that culture legacies are made of.

RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.GLASSFURNISHINGS.DESC: The decorative benefits of glass are both apparent and transparent.

RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SCREENS.DESC: High tech displays with lots of pretty colors.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ADVANCEDPOWERREGULATION.D: Circuit components required for large scale <link="POWER">Power</link> management.

RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.PLASTICS.DESC: Stable, lightweight, durable. Plastics are useful for a wide array of applications.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SUITS.NAME: <link="SUITS">Hazard Protection</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SUITS.DESC: Vital gear for surviving in extreme conditions and environments.

RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.DISTILLATION.DESC: Distill difficult mixtures down to their most useful parts.
