RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.CATALYTICS.NAME: <link="CATALYTICS">Catalytics</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.CATALYTICS.DESC: Advanced gas manipulation using unique catalysts.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ADVANCEDRESEARCH.NAME: <link="ADVANCEDRESEARCH">Advanced Research</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ADVANCEDRESEARCH.DESC: The tools my colony needs to conduct more advanced, in-depth research.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SPACEPROGRAM.NAME: <link="SPACEPROGRAM">Space Program</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SPACEPROGRAM.DESC: The first steps in getting a Duplicant to space.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.CRASHPLAN.NAME: <link="CRASHPLAN">Crash Plan</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.CRASHPLAN.DESC: What goes up, must come down.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.DURABLELIFESUPPORT.NAME: <link="DURABLELIFESUPPORT">Durable Life Support</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.DURABLELIFESUPPORT.DESC: Improved devices for extended missions into space.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ARTIFICIALFRIENDS.NAME: <link="ARTIFICIALFRIENDS">Artificial Friends</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ROBOTICTOOLS.NAME: <link="ROBOTICTOOLS">Robotic Tools</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ROBOTICTOOLS.DESC: The goal of every great civilization is to one day make itself obsolete.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.LOGICCONTROL.NAME: <link="LOGICCONTROL">Smart Home</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.LOGICCONTROL.DESC: Switches that grant full control of building operations within the colony.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.LOGICCIRCUITS.NAME: <link="LOGICCIRCUITS">Advanced Automation</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.LOGICCIRCUITS.DESC: The only limit to colony automation is my own imagination.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.PARALLELAUTOMATION.NAME: <link="PARALLELAUTOMATION">Parallel Automation</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.PARALLELAUTOMATION.DESC: Multi-wire automation at a fraction of the space.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.MULTIPLEXING.NAME: <link="MULTIPLEXING">Multiplexing</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.MULTIPLEXING.DESC: More choices for Automation signal distribution.

RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.VALVEMINIATURIZATION.DESC: Smaller, more efficient pumps for those low-throughput situations.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.HYDROCARBONPROPULSION.DES: Low-range rocket engines with lots of smoke.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.BETTERHYDROCARBONPROPULSI: Mid-range rocket engines with lots of smoke.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.PRETTYGOODCONDUCTORS.NAME: <link="PRETTYGOODCONDUCTORS">Low-Resistance Conductors</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.PRETTYGOODCONDUCTORS.DESC: Pure-core wires that can handle more <link="POWER">Electrical</link> current without overloading.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.RENEWABLEENERGY.NAME: <link="RENEWABLEENERGY">Renewable Energy</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.RENEWABLEENERGY.DESC: Clean, sustainable <link="POWER">Power</link> production that produces little to no waste.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.BASICREFINEMENT.NAME: <link="BASICREFINEMENT">Brute-Force Refinement</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.BASICREFINEMENT.DESC: Low-tech refinement methods for producing clay and renewable sources of sand.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.REFINEDOBJECTS.NAME: <link="REFINEDOBJECTS">Refined Renovations</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.REFINEDOBJECTS.DESC: Improve base infrastructure with new objects crafted from <link="REFINEDMETAL">Refined Metals</link>.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.GENERICSENSORS.NAME: <link="GENERICSENSORS">Generic Sensors</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.GENERICSENSORS.DESC: Drive automation in a variety of new, inventive ways.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.DUPETRAFFICCONTROL.NAME: <link="DUPETRAFFICCONTROL">Computing</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.DUPETRAFFICCONTROL.DESC: Virtually extend the boundaries of Duplicant imagination.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ADVANCEDSCANNERS.NAME: <link="ADVANCEDSCANNERS">Sensitive Microimaging</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ADVANCEDSCANNERS.DESC: Computerized systems do the looking, so Duplicants don't have to.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SMELTING.NAME: <link="SMELTING">Smelting</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SMELTING.DESC: High temperatures facilitate the production of purer, special use metal resources.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.TRAVELTUBES.NAME: <link="TRAVELTUBES">Transit Tubes</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.TRAVELTUBES.DESC: A wholly futuristic way to move Duplicants around the base.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SMARTSTORAGE.NAME: <link="SMARTSTORAGE">Smart Storage</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SMARTSTORAGE.DESC: Completely automate the storage of solid resources.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SOLIDTRANSPORT.NAME: <link="SOLIDTRANSPORT">Solid Transport</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SOLIDTRANSPORT.DESC: Free Duplicants from the drudgery of day-to-day material deliveries with new methods of automation.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SOLIDMANAGEMENT.NAME: <link="SOLIDMANAGEMENT">Solid Management</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SOLIDDISTRIBUTION.NAME: <link="SOLIDDISTRIBUTION">Solid Distribution</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.HIGHTEMPFORGING.NAME: <link="HIGHTEMPFORGING">Superheated Forging</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.HIGHTEMPFORGING.DESC: Craft entirely new materials by harnessing the most extreme temperatures.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.HIGHPRESSUREFORGING.NAME: <link="HIGHPRESSUREFORGING">Pressurized Forging</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.RADIATIONPROTECTION.NAME: <link="RADIATIONPROTECTION">Radiation Protection</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.RADIATIONPROTECTION.DESC: Shield Duplicants from dangerous amounts of radiation.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SKYDETECTORS.NAME: <link="SKYDETECTORS">Celestial Detection</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SKYDETECTORS.DESC: Turn Duplicants' eyes to the skies and discover what undiscovered wonders await out there.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.JETPACKS.NAME: <link="JETPACKS">Jetpacks</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.JETPACKS.DESC: Objectively the most stylish way for Duplicants to get around.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.BASICROCKETRY.NAME: <link="BASICROCKETRY">Introductory Rocketry</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.BASICROCKETRY.DESC: Everything required for launching the colony's very first space program.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ENGINESI.NAME: <link="ENGINESI">Solid Fuel Combustion</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ENGINESII.NAME: <link="ENGINESII">Hydrocarbon Combustion</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ENGINESII.DESC: Delve deeper into the vastness of space than ever before.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ENGINESIII.NAME: <link="ENGINESIII">Cryofuel Combustion</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ENGINESIII.DESC: With this technology, the sky is your oyster. Go exploring!
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.CRYOFUELPROPULSION.NAME: <link="CRYOFUELPROPULSION">Cryofuel Propulsion</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.CRYOFUELPROPULSION.DESC: A semi-powerful engine to propel you further into the galaxy.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.NUCLEARPROPULSION.NAME: <link="NUCLEARPROPULSION">Radbolt Propulsion</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.NUCLEARPROPULSION.DESC: Radical technology to get you to the stars.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ADVANCEDRESOURCEEXTRACTIO: Bring back souvieners from the stars.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.CARGOI.NAME: <link="CARGOI">Solid Cargo</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.CARGOI.DESC: Make extra use of journeys into space by mining and storing useful resources.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.CARGOII.NAME: <link="CARGOII">Liquid and Gas Cargo</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.CARGOII.DESC: Extract precious liquids and gases from the far reaches of space, and return with them to the colony.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.CARGOIII.NAME: <link="CARGOIII">Unique Cargo</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.CARGOIII.DESC: Allow Duplicants to take their friends to see the stars... or simply bring souvenirs back from their travels.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.NOTIFICATIONSYSTEMS.NAME: <link="NOTIFICATIONSYSTEMS">Notification Systems</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.NOTIFICATIONSYSTEMS.DESC: Get all the news you need to know about your complex colony.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.NUCLEARREFINEMENT.NAME: <link="NUCLEAR">Radiation Refinement</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.NUCLEARRESEARCH.NAME: <link="NUCLEARRESEARCH">Materials Science Research</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.NUCLEARRESEARCH.DESC: Harness sub-atomic particles to study the properties of matter.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.ADVANCEDNUCLEARRESEARCH.D: Harness sub-atomic particles to study the properties of matter even more.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.NUCLEARSTORAGE.NAME: <link="NUCLEARSTORAGE">Radbolt Containment</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.NUCLEARSTORAGE.DESC: Build a quality cache of radbolts.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SOLIDSPACE.NAME: <link="SOLIDSPACE">Solid Control</link>

RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.SPACEGAS.NAME: <link="SPACEGAS">Advanced Gas Flow</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.DATASCIENCE.NAME: <link="DATASCIENCE">Data Science</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.DATASCIENCE.DESC: The science of making the data work for my Duplicants, instead of the other way around.
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.DATASCIENCEBASEGAME.NAME: <link="DATASCIENCEBASEGAME">Data Science</link>
RESEARCH.RESEARCH.TECHS.DATASCIENCEBASEGAME.DESC: The science of making the data work for my Duplicants, instead of the other way around.

ROBOTS.ROBOTS.MODELS.MORB.NAME: <link="STORYTRAITMORBROVER">Biobot</link>
ROBOTS.ROBOTS.MODELS.MORB.DESC:
A Pathogen-Fueled Extravehicular Geo-Exploratory Guidebot (model Y), aka "P.E.G.G.Y."

It can be assigned basic building tasks and digging duties in hazardous environments.
ROBOTS.ROBOTS.MODELS.SCOUT.NAME: Rover
ROBOTS.ROBOTS.MODELS.SCOUT.DESC: A curious bot that can remotely explore new Planetoid locations.
ROBOTS.ROBOTS.MODELS.SWEEPBOT.NAME: <link="SWEEPY">Sweepy</link>
ROBOTS.ROBOTS.MODELS.SWEEPBOT.DESC:
An automated sweeping robot.

Sweeps up <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> debris and <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> spills and stores the material back in its <link="SWEEPBOTSTATION">Sweepy Dock</link>.
ROBOTS.ROBOTS.MODELS.FLYDO.NAME: <link="FETCHDRONE">Flydo</link>
ROBOTS.ROBOTS.MODELS.FLYDO.DESC:
A programmable delivery robot.

Picks up <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> objects for delivery to selected destinations.

ROOMS.ROOMS.CATEGORY.NONE.NAME: None
ROOMS.ROOMS.CATEGORY.FOOD.NAME: Dining

ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.NEUTRAL.NAME: Miscellaneous Room
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.NEUTRAL.DESCRIPTION: An enclosed space with plenty of potential and no dedicated use.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.NEUTRAL.TOOLTIP: This area has walls and doors but no dedicated use
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.LATRINE.NAME: Latrine
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.LATRINE.DESCRIPTION:
It's a step up from doing one's business in full view of the rest of the colony.

Using a toilet in an enclosed room will improve Duplicants' Morale.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.LATRINE.TOOLTIP: Using a toilet in an enclosed room will improve Duplicants' Morale
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.PLUMBEDBATHROOM.NAME: Washroom
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.PLUMBEDBATHROOM.DESCRIPTION:
A sanctuary of personal hygiene.

Using a fully plumbed Washroom will improve Duplicants' Morale.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.PLUMBEDBATHROOM.TOOLTIP: Using a fully plumbed Washroom will improve Duplicants' Morale
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.BARRACKS.NAME: Barracks
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.BARRACKS.DESCRIPTION:
A basic communal sleeping area for up-and-coming colonies.

Sleeping in Barracks will improve Duplicants' Morale.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.BARRACKS.TOOLTIP: Sleeping in Barracks will improve Duplicants' Morale
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.BEDROOM.NAME: Luxury Barracks
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.BEDROOM.DESCRIPTION:
An upscale communal sleeping area full of things that greatly enhance quality of rest for occupants.

Sleeping in a Luxury Barracks will improve Duplicants' Morale.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.BEDROOM.TOOLTIP: Sleeping in a Luxury Barracks will improve Duplicants' Morale
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.PRIVATE_BEDROOM.NAME: Private Bedroom
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.PRIVATE_BEDROOM.DESCRIPTION:
A comfortable, roommate-free retreat where tired Duplicants can get uninterrupted rest.

Sleeping in a Private Bedroom will greatly improve Duplicants' Morale.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.PRIVATE_BEDROOM.TOOLTIP: Sleeping in a Private Bedroom will greatly improve Duplicants' Morale
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.MESSHALL.NAME: Mess Hall
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.MESSHALL.DESCRIPTION:
A simple dining room setup that's easy to improve upon.

Eating at a mess table in a Mess Hall will increase Duplicants' Morale.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.MESSHALL.TOOLTIP: Eating at a Mess Table in a Mess Hall will improve Duplicants' Morale
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.KITCHEN.NAME: Kitchen
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.KITCHEN.DESCRIPTION:
A cooking area equipped to take meals to the next level.

Adding ingredients from a Spice Grinder to foods cooked on an Electric Grill or Gas Range provides a variety of positive benefits.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.KITCHEN.TOOLTIP: Using a Spice Grinder in a Kitchen adds benefits to foods cooked on Electric Grill or Gas Range
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.GREATHALL.NAME: Great Hall
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.GREATHALL.DESCRIPTION:
A great place to eat, with great decor and great company. Great!

Eating in a Great Hall will significantly improve Duplicants' Morale.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.GREATHALL.TOOLTIP: Eating in a Great Hall will significantly improve Duplicants' Morale
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.HOSPITAL.NAME: Hospital
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.HOSPITAL.DESCRIPTION:
A dedicated medical facility that helps minimize recovery time.

Sick Duplicants assigned to medical buildings located within a Hospital are also less likely to spread Disease.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.HOSPITAL.TOOLTIP: Sick Duplicants assigned to medical buildings located within a Hospital are less likely to spread Disease
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.MASSAGE_CLINIC.NAME: Massage Clinic
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.MASSAGE_CLINIC.DESCRIPTION:
A soothing space with a very relaxing ambience, especially when well-decorated.

Receiving massages at a Massage Clinic will significantly improve Stress reduction.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.MASSAGE_CLINIC.TOOLTIP: Receiving massages at a Massage Clinic will significantly improve Stress reduction
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.POWER_PLANT.NAME: Power Plant
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.POWER_PLANT.DESCRIPTION:
The perfect place for Duplicants to flex their Electrical Engineering skills.

Heavy-duty generators built within a Power Plant can be tuned up using microchips from power control stations to improve their <link="POWER">Power</link> production.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.POWER_PLANT.TOOLTIP: Heavy-duty generators built in a Power Plant can be tuned up using microchips from Power Control Stations to improve their Power production
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.MACHINE_SHOP.NAME: Machine Shop
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.MACHINE_SHOP.DESCRIPTION:
It smells like elbow grease.

Duplicants working in a Machine Shop can maintain buildings and increase their production speed.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.MACHINE_SHOP.TOOLTIP: Duplicants working in a Machine Shop can maintain buildings and increase their production speed
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.FARM.NAME: Greenhouse
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.FARM.DESCRIPTION:
An enclosed agricultural space best utilized by Duplicants with Crop Tending skills.

Crops grown within a Greenhouse can be tended with Farm Station fertilizer to increase their growth speed.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.FARM.TOOLTIP: Crops grown within a Greenhouse can be tended with Farm Station fertilizer to increase their growth speed
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.CREATUREPEN.NAME: Stable
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.CREATUREPEN.DESCRIPTION:
Critters don't mind it here, as long as things don't get too crowded.

Stabled critters can be tended to in order to improve their happiness, hasten their domestication and increase their production.

Enables the use of Grooming Stations, Shearing Stations, Critter Condos, Critter Fountains and Milking Stations.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.CREATUREPEN.TOOLTIP: A stable enables Grooming Station, Critter Condo, Critter Fountain, Shearing Station and Milking Station use
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.REC_ROOM.NAME: Recreation Room
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.REC_ROOM.DESCRIPTION:
Where Duplicants go to mingle with off-duty peers and indulge in a little R&R.

Scheduled Downtime will further improve Morale for Duplicants visiting a Recreation Room.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.REC_ROOM.TOOLTIP: Scheduled Downtime will further improve Morale for Duplicants visiting a Recreation Room
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.PARK.NAME: Park
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.PARK.DESCRIPTION:
A little greenery goes a long way.

Passing through natural spaces throughout the day will raise the Morale of Duplicants.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.PARK.TOOLTIP: Passing through natural spaces throughout the day will raise the Morale of Duplicants
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.NATURERESERVE.NAME: Nature Reserve
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.NATURERESERVE.DESCRIPTION:
A lot of greenery goes an even longer way.

Passing through a Nature Reserve will grant higher Morale bonuses to Duplicants than a Park.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.NATURERESERVE.TOOLTIP: A Nature Reserve will grant higher Morale bonuses to Duplicants than a Park
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.LABORATORY.NAME: Laboratory
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.LABORATORY.DESCRIPTION:
Where wild hypotheses meet rigorous scientific experimentation.

Science stations built in a Laboratory function more efficiently.

A Laboratory enables the use of the Geotuner and the Mission Control Station.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.LABORATORY.TOOLTIP:
Science buildings built in a Laboratory function more efficiently

A Laboratory enables Geotuner and Mission Control Station use
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.PRIVATE_BATHROOM.NAME: Private Bathroom
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.PRIVATE_BATHROOM.DESCRIPTION:
Finally, a place to truly be alone with one's thoughts.

Duplicants relieve even more Stress when using the toilet in a Private Bathroom than in a Latrine.
ROOMS.ROOMS.TYPES.PRIVATE_BATHROOM.TOOLTIP: Duplicants relieve even more stress when using the toilet in a Private Bathroom than in a Latrine

SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.BARREN.NAME: Barren Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.BARREN.DESC: Initial scans of this biome yield no signs of either <link="PLANTS">plant life</link> or <link="CREATURES">critters</link>. It is a land devoid of <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">liquids</link> and minuscule <link="ELEMENTSGAS">gas</link> deposits. These dry, dusty plains can be mined for building materials but there is little in the way of life sustaining resources here for a colony.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.BARREN.UTILITY:
The layers of sedimentary rock are predominantly made up of <link="GRANITE">Granite</link> deposits, although <link="OBSIDIAN">Obsidian</link> and <link="IGNEOUSROCK">Igneous Rock</link> are also present. This suggests a history of volcanic activity, though no volcanoes exist here currently.

Veins of <link="IRON">Iron Ore</link> deposits are evident from initial scans, as are deposits of <link="CARBON">Coal</link>. Both are useful in setting up a colony's power infrastructure.

Though it lacks the crucial resources necessary to sustain a colony, there is nothing inherently dangerous here to harm my Duplicants. It should be safe enough to explore.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.FOREST.NAME: Forest Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.FOREST.DESC: Temperate and filled with unique <link="PLANTS">Plant</link> life, this biome contains all the necessities for life support, although not in quantities sufficient to sustain a long term colony. Exploration into neighboring biomes should be a priority.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.FOREST.UTILITY:
Small pockets of <link="OXYROCK">Oxylite</link> and <link="WATER">Water</link> are present in the Forest Biome, but calculations reveal they will only sustain the colony for a limited time.

Analysis shows two native plants which should be prioritized for cultivation: The <link="OXYFERN">Oxyfern</link>, which releases <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> but requires <link="WATER">Water</link>; and the <link="FORESTTREE">Arbor Tree</link> which provides <link="WOOD">Wood</link> as a fuel source.

A symbiotic relationship exists with the <link="FORESTTREE">Arbor Tree</link> and the native <link="SQUIRRELSPECIES">Pips</link> which appear to be the only critter that can find the elusive <link="PLANTS">Arbor Acorns</link>.

This biome is really quite beautiful. I've noted that <link="LIGHTBUGSPECIES">Shine Bugs</link> and <link="LEAFYPLANT">Mirth Leaf</link> both evoke feelings of serenity in my Duplicants.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.FROZEN.NAME: Tundra Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.FROZEN.DESC: The sub-zero temperatures of the Tundra Biome provide rare frozen deposits of <link="ICE">Ice</link> and <link="SNOW">Snow</link>, necessary for a colony's <link="HEAT">Heat</link> regulation needs.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.FROZEN.UTILITY:
Far from devoid of life, this biome contains some much needed plant life, ripe for cultivation. <link="COLDWHEAT">Sleet Wheat</link> provides a nutrient rich ingredient for creating complex foods, though the plants do require sub-zero temperatures to thrive.

Fortunately <link="COLDBREATHER">Wheezewort</link> can been planted on farms to lower surrounding temperatures.

Crucially, small deposits of <link="WOLFRAMITE">Wolframite</link> have been detected here. This is an extremely rare metal that should be preserved for <link="TUNGSTEN">Tungsten</link> production.

Though my Duplicants appear more than happy to work in the Tundra Biome for short periods of time, I will need to provide proper <link="EQUIPMENT">equipment</link> for them to avoid adverse affects to their well-being if they are working here for longer periods.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.JUNGLE.NAME: Jungle Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.JUNGLE.DESC: Initial investigations of the Jungle Biome reveal an ecosystem filled with unique flora but centered around <link="CHLORINE">Liquid Chlorine</link> and <link="HYDROGEN">Hydrogen Gas</link> gas, toxic to Duplicants. When exploring here, it is worth setting up a good system.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.JUNGLE.UTILITY:
The <link="DRECKOSPECIES">Drecko</link> is a relatively benign critter which can be domesticated to aid in textile and food production.

The <link="GLOMSPECIES">Morb</link>'s only function is to produce <link="POLLUTEDOXYGEN">Polluted Oxygen</link> which may be useful when establishing sustainable production loops with other critters.

<link="SWAMPLILY">Balm Lilies</link> would be useful to cultivate for the production of critical medical materials.

<link="SPICEVINE">Pincha Pepperplants</link> greatly improve the nutritional value and quality of a colony's food supply. Because of their unique relationship with gravity, the plants must be orientated upside-down for proper growing. This can be accomplished by using a <link="FARMTILE">Farm Tile</link>.

Given the toxic gases I will have to build a proper <link="BUILDCATEGORYHVAC">Ventilation</link> system to both protect my Duplicants and provide the optimum environments for the native plants and critters.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.MAGMA.NAME: Magma Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.MAGMA.DESC: Temperatures in the Magma Biome can reach upwards of 1526 degrees, making it a reliable source of extreme heat that can be exploited for the purposes of producing <link="POWER">Power</link> and fuel.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.MAGMA.UTILITY:
<link="MAGMA">Magma</link> is source of extreme <link="HEAT">Heat</link> which can be used to transform <link="WATER">Water</link> in to <link="STEAM">Steam</link> or <link="CRUDEOIL">Crude Oil</link> into <link="PETROLEUM">Petroleum</link>. In order to prevent the extreme temperatures of this biome invading other parts of my base, suitable insulation must be constructed using materials with high melting points like <link="CERAMIC">Ceramic</link> or <link="OBSIDIAN">Obsidian</link>.

Though exosuits such as <link="ATMOSUIT">Atmo Suits</link> and <link="JETSUIT">Jet Suits</link> will provide some protection for my Duplicants, there is still a danger they will overheat if spending an extended amount of time in this Biome. I should ensure that suitable medical facilities have been constructed nearby to take care of any medical emergencies.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.MARSH.NAME: Marsh Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.MARSH.DESC: <link="CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN">Polluted Oxygen</link> dominates the atmosphere of the Marsh Biome as it escapes from the <link="SLIMEMOLD">Slime</link> this biome is known for.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.MARSH.UTILITY:
Marsh Biomes contain large amounts of <link="SLIMEMOLD">Slime</link> which can be converted into <link="ALGAE">Algae</link> and provide a valuable resource for growing <link="MUSHROOMPLANT">Dusk Caps</link> as well as feeding to <link="PACUSPECIES">Pacus</link> for producing some higher tier <link="FOOD">food</link>.

Because of the high degree of probability that this biome will infect my Duplicants with <link="SLIMELUNG">Slimelung</link>, it may be prudent to limit access to this area to essential activities only until my Duplicants are able to set up suitable protection.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.METALLIC.NAME: Metallic Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.METALLIC.DESC: A plethora of metals pervade the Metallic Biome making it the go-to destination for a colony ramping up production for technological advancement.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.METALLIC.UTILITY:
<link="GOLDAMALGAM">Gold Amalgam</link>, <link="ALUMINUMORE">Aluminum Ore</link> and <link="COBALTITE">Cobalt Ore</link> are in abundant supply throughout this entire biome. Refining these metals with a <link="METALREFINERY">Metal Refinery</link> will make them available for building advanced technologies.

Though <link="CHLORINEGAS">Chlorine Gas</link> and <link="HYDROGEN">Hydrogen Gas</link> are the prevailing gasses in this biome, <link="OXYROCK">Oxylite</link> exists in rock form and can provide <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> for Duplicants once they uncover it.

<link="DIRT">Dirt</link>, <link="CARBON">Coal</link> and <link="IGNEOUSROCK">Igneous Rock</link> round out the rest of this biome, making it a great deposit of resources for a budding industrialized colony.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.OCEAN.NAME: Ocean Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.OCEAN.DESC: <link="SAND">Sand</link>, <link="SALT">Salt</link> and <link="BLEACHSTONE">Bleachstone</link> abound in this unique <link="BRINE">briny</link> biome.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.OCEAN.UTILITY:
<link="CRABSPECIES">Pokeshell</link> molt is an excellent source of <link="LIME">Lime</link> but much care must be taken with domesticating this species as it can get aggressive around its eggs.

Harvesting <link="SEALETTUCE">Waterweed</link> provides <link="LETTUCE">Lettuce</link> for many higher-tier <link="FOOD">foods</link>.

Any <link="WATER">Water</link> will need to be filtered through a <link="DESALINATOR">Desalinator</link> to remove the <link="SALT">Salt</link> in order to make it useful for my Duplicants. Luckily <link="SALT">Table Salt</link> can be produced using a <link="ROCKCRUSHER">Rock Crusher</link> which, when combined with a <link="DININGTABLE">Mess Table</link>, gives my Duplicants a <link="MORALE">Morale</link> boost.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.OIL.NAME: Oily Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.OIL.DESC: Viscous pools of liquid <link="CRUDEOIL">Crude Oil</link> pepper the <link="CARBONDIOXIDE">Carbon Dioxide</link>-rich environment of the Oil Biome.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.OIL.UTILITY:
Though <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> is more scarce in this biome, it's the perfect place to cultivate flora and fauna that thrive in CO2, such as <link="OILFLOATERSPECIES">Slicksters</link>. These critters can be domesticated as a renewable source of <link="CRUDEOIL">Crude Oil</link>.

<link="DIAMOND">Diamond</link> deposits can occasionally be found in the Oily biome, which will require a Duplicant with the <link="MINING3">Super-Duperhard Digging</link> skill to explore properly.

<link="EVILFLOWER">Sporechids</link> are beautiful, but should only be approached if a Duplicant is properly <link="EQUIPMENT">equipped</link>.

While the dangers of this biome should not be underestimated, the benefits <link="CRUDEOIL">Crude Oil</link> and <link="PETROLEUM">Petroleum</link> will bring to my colony far outweigh the risks.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.RADIOACTIVE.NAME: Radioactive Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.RADIOACTIVE.DESC: A highly volatile environment containing a highly useful resource, this biome is invaluable when venturing into nuclear technologies.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.RADIOACTIVE.UTILITY:
<link="LEADSUIT">Lead Suits</link> are imperative if my Duplicants are going to start exploring this biome as <link="RADIATIONSICKNESS">Radioactive Contaminants</link> are a constant danger here.

<link="BEE">Beetas</link> pose a double threat as they are both highly radioactive and very aggressive. If they can be subdued, <link="BEEHIVE">Beeta Hives</link> provide a great service turning <link="URANIUMORE">Uranium Ore</link> into <link="ENRICHEDURANIUM">Enriched Uranium</link>.

While the Radioactive Biome, and the Beetas contained within it, should be avoided at all costs if my Duplicants do not have the correct protection, my colony will need to trek into this dangerous biome if we are going to build any higher-tier nuclear technologies.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.RUST.NAME: Rust Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.RUST.DESC: The orange-brown oasis of the Rust Biome is home to many unusual flora and fauna. It contains the resources for several intermediate technologies.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.RUST.UTILITY:
When combined with the <link="RUSTDEOXIDIZER">Rust Deoxidizer</link>, <link="RUST">Rust</link> can produce many of a colony's basic needs.

The <link="PUFTBLEACHSTONE">Squeaky Puft</link>, a frequent resident of the Rust biome, is a renewable source of <link="BLEACHSTONE">Bleachstone</link> and can be domesticated for such purposes.

<link="DRECKOS">Dreckos</link> can also sometimes be found in these biomes, which are a great source of <link="PHOSPHORITE">Phosphorite</link> and fibre for making <link="CLOTHING">Textile Production</link>.

Two plants found in this biome, the <link="BEANPLANTSEED">Nosh Bean</link> and the <link="SALTPLANT">Dasha Saltvine</link>, can both produce food that will add significant <link="MORALE">Morale</link> value for my Duplicants.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.SANDSTONE.NAME: Sandstone
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.SANDSTONE.DESC: The Sandstone Biome is a temperate oasis with few inherent dangers. It's the perfect spot to get your colony up and running.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.SANDSTONE.UTILITY:
<link="OXYROCK">Oxylite</link> and <link="BASICFORAGEPLANTPLANTED">Buried Muckroot</link> are in sufficient supply to sustain your colony while you gather more resources.

<link="DIRT">Dirt</link>, <link="ALGAE">Algae</link>, <link="COPPER">Copper</link> and, of course, <link="SANDSTONE">Sandstone</link> provide all the materials to get basic colony essentials built.

Random <link="LIGHTBUGSPECIES">Shine Bugs</link> provide <link="MORALE">Morale</link> boosts for my Duplicants but are not a reliable light source.

<link="HATCHSPECIES">Hatches</link> can be domesticated for food or <link="CARBON">Coal</link>, which will be useful if using a <link="GENERATOR">Coal Generator</link> for power.

All in all, this biome is the perfect starting spot for my colony to establish a base full of essentials, from which they can then venture out and explore.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.WASTELAND.NAME: Wasteland Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.WASTELAND.DESC: While the Wasteland Biome does not look particularly interesting, a pragmatic colony can take advantage of its selection of construction resources.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.WASTELAND.UTILITY:
The prevalance of <link="COPPER">Copper</link>, <link="SANDSTONE">Sandstone</link>, <link="IGNEOUSROCK">Igneous Rock</link> and its <link="IRON">Iron</link>-rich counterpart <link="MAFICROCK">Mafic Rock</link>, make this a fruitful biome to explore for construction material. <link="SAND">Sand</link> is also in abundance here which is useful as a filtering material.

While the wildlife is not in abundance in the Wasteland Biome, the <link="DIVERGENTBEETLE">Sweetle</link> and <link="DIVERGENTWORM">Grubgrub</link> make interesting creatures to domesticate as they co-exist with the <link="WORMPLANT">Grubfruit Plants</link> to produce a much higher quality food than the <link="WORMPLANT">Spindly Grubfruit Plant</link> found in the wild. Additionally, the <link="SULFUR">Sulfur</link> found here works both as food for the GrubGrubs and fertilizer for the Grubfruit Plants.

The abundance of <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> found in the Wasteland Biome makes for a low-risk area to send my Duplicants into to collect useful resources to continue with their construction projects.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.SPACE.NAME: Space Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.SPACE.DESC: The Space Biome is located on the scenic surface of an asteroid. Watch for dazzling meteorites to shower elements down from the sky.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.SPACE.UTILITY: Setting up <link="SOLARPANEL">Solar Panels</link> on the surface will provide a source of renewable energy. However, much care must be taken to ensure <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquids</link> or <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gases</link> are not sucked out into the <link="VACUUM">Vacuum</link> of space. <link="MOLE">Shove Voles</link> are native to this biome, and need to be wrangled or contained or they will infest the colony.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.SWAMP.NAME: Swampy Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.SWAMP.DESC: With its abundance of <link="CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN">Polluted Oxygen</link> and lack of clean <style="KKeyword">Water</style> the Swampy Biome presents some challenges for a budding colony. But, with a little hard work, it can also turn into a great starting biome with some valuable resources.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.SWAMP.UTILITY:
<link="SWAMPFORAGEPLANTPLANTED">Swamp Chard</link> can provide adequate nutrients for my Duplicants while they establish farms, but it cannot be planted or propogated. <link="SWAMPHARVESTPLANT">Bog Buckets</link>, however, provide a sweet source of nutrients that are fairly easy to farm using <link="DIRTYWATER">Polluted Water</link> and require no extra light to grow.

Fortunately <link="DIRTYWATER">Polluted Water</link> is abundant in this biome and will require a <link="WATERPURIFIER">Water Sieve</link> to turn into something my Duplicants can drink. Additionally my Duplicants can use a <link="SLUDGEPRESS">Sludge Press</link> to filter clean water from <link="MUD">Mud</link> (NOTE: <link="TOXICMUD">Polluted Mud</link>, however, does not make clean water).

Meanwhile, rudimentary power can be gained from the energy producing <link="STATERPILLAR">Plug Slugs</link> that inhabit this biome.

Shiny <link="COBALTITE">Cobalt Ore</link> can be found here, providing a adequate source of metal.

While much of this biome is dangerous for a new colony with some deliberate research and careful planning my Duplicants can not only survive but thrive here.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.NIOBIUM.NAME: Niobium Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.NIOBIUM.DESC: The Niobium Biome features only two resources yet, because <link="NIOBIUM">Niobium</link> is an extremely rare and valuable element, it is worth making a special visit.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.NIOBIUM.UTILITY:
By itself, <link="NIOBIUM">Niobium</link> is not a particularly useful resource. But if processed through a <link="SUPERMETALREFINERY">Molecular Forge</link>, it produces the extremely thermal conductive <link="TEMPCONDUCTORSOLID">Thermium</link>, which goes a long way in solving many extreme temperature issues in a colony.

The edges of this biome are filled with <link="OBSIDIAN">Obsidian</link> so a Duplicant with the <link="MINING3">Super-Duperhard Digging</link> skill will be required before my colony can explore here.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.AQUATIC.NAME: Aquatic Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.AQUATIC.DESC: The Aquatic Biome is flush with a huge deposit of precious <link="WATER">Water</link>.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.AQUATIC.UTILITY:
Initially there is very little solid ground in this biome to establish a temporary base, but once a transportation network can be established to send the <link="WATER">Water</link> of the Aquatic Biome to the rest of the colony, the other elements will be easier to reach.

<link="SANDSTONE">Sandstone</link>, <link="MAFICROCK">Mafic Rock</link>, <link="SAND">Sand</link> and <link="SEDIMENTARYROCK">Sedimentary Rock</link> provide readily available construction materials for setting up elementary infrastructure. The presence of <link="OXYROCK">Oxylite</link> provides invaluable <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> which, through careful planning, should be able to sustain any Duplicants working in the area for a limited amount of time.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.MOO.NAME: Moo Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.MOO.DESC: The Moo Biome is the natural habitat of the charismatic <link="MOO">Gassy Moo</link>, a great source of <link="METHANE">Natural Gas</link>.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.MOO.UTILITY:
In addition to <link="METHANE">Natural Gas</link>, the highly toxic <link="CHLORINEGAS">Chlorine</link> is also present in gas form. In fact, Chlorine is present here in <link="ELEMENTSGAS">gas</link>, <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">liquid</link>, and <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">solid</link> states, largely due to the presence of <link="BLEACHSTONE">Bleach Stone</link>.

<link="IGNEOUSROCK">Igneous Rock</link> and its denser form, <link="GRANITE">Granite</link>, provide some useful construction materials, but the real star of this biome are the <link="MOO">Gassy Moos</link> who consume <link="GASGRASS">Gas Grass</link> and excrete <link="METHANE">Natural Gas</link>. While Gassy Moos cannot be bred domestically, Gassy Mooteors regularly fall from space onto this biome, making it the best way to find a reliable source of these elusive creatures.

With no breathable <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> in this biome my Duplicants will need to be properly prepared before they venture too far into its depths.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.REGOLITH.NAME: Regolith Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.REGOLITH.DESC: The Regolith Biome contains a bounty of <link="REGOLITH">Regolith</link> which is very useful as a material for filtration.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.REGOLITH.UTILITY:
Lingering within the layers of Regolith are the pernicious <link="MOLESPECIES">Shove Voles</link> which eat valuable resources and excrete them at half the original mass.

Fortunately these pests can be wrangled up and used as a good food source for my Duplicants. However, extra care must be taken to contain these critters in pens made from either double thick walls or from <link="REFINEDMETAL">Refined Metal</link> since they are capable of burrowing through most other materials.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.ICECAVES.NAME: Ice Cave Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.ICECAVES.DESC: The Ice Cave Biome's extremely low temperatures make thermal regulation the top priority.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.ICECAVES.UTILITY:
The below-freezing climate in this biome keeps elements frozen solid, but once a colony has established the means necessary to melt the abundant <link="ICE">Ice</link> deposits, it should be able to produce enough <link="WATER">Water</link> to meet its needs. Initial scans reveal the presence of <link="CINNABAR">Cinnabar Ore</link> that can be used in <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.

<link="STABLESNOW">Snow</link> is a readily available construction material. Note that its structural integrity may be undermined if surrounding areas become hot enough to trigger a state change.

<link="HARDSKINBERRY">Pikeapple Bushes</link> feed both Duplicants and the native <link="WOODDEER">Flox</link>, a critter whose <link="WOOD">Wood</link>, antlers offer a renewable source of fuel and attractive temperature-stable construction materials.

Although pockets of <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> allow Duplicants to begin the work of colony-building in this biome, the key to long-term survival is the cultivation of <link="BLUEGRASS">Alveo Vera</link> plants. They produce harvestable <link="OXYROCK">Oxylite</link> and their beauty--much like that of the dreamy <link="ICEFLOWER">Idylla Flower</link>--is a wonderful salve for existential dread.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.CARROTQUARRY.NAME: Cool Pool Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.CARROTQUARRY.DESC: The Cool Pool Biome's chilly landscape features plentiful <link="ETHANOL">Ethanol</link> lakes, making it an excellent destination for a colony eager to gather fuel resources.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.CARROTQUARRY.UTILITY:
<link="CARROTPLANT">Plume Squash</link> is a calorie-dense crop that thrives in <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link>, <link="CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN">Polluted Oxygen</link> and <link="CARBONDIOXIDE">Carbon Dioxide</link> environments.

They make up the <link="BELLYSPECIES">Bammoths'</link> entire diet. These gentle giants are a joy to ranch, <link="MEAT">Meat</link>, <link="PHOSPHORITE">Phosphorite</link>, <link="CINNABARORE">Cinnabar Ore</link> and <link="BASICFABRIC">Reed Fiber</link>.

The latter is of particular importance, as my Duplicants will need to wear warmly insulated clothing if they are to survive these low temperatures.

Initial investigations also reveal an abundance of <link="IRONORE">Iron Ore</link> and <link="IGNEOUSROCK">Igneous Rock</link> in this <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link>-rich environment, ideal for industrial projects.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.SUGARWOODS.NAME: Nectar Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.SUGARWOODS.DESC: The <link="SNOW">snow</link>-laden Nectar Biome is home to the massive <link="SPACETREE">Bonbon Tree</link>. This complex plant produces <link="SUGARWATER">Nectar</link>, which can be refined into <link="SUCROSE">Sucrose</link> and <link="STEAM">Steam</link>.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.SUGARWOODS.UTILITY:
<link="SEALSPECIES">Spigot Seals</link> consume this sweet liquid and produce <link="ETHANOL">Ethanol</link> to shore up a colony's fuel supplies. Spigot Seal ranches also yield <link="TALLOW">Tallow</link>, a greasy substance that can be used for  <link="FOOD">Food</link> or refined into <link="CRUDEOIL">Crude Oil</link> to support local <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.

Beneath the <link="SNOW">Snow</link> and <link="ICE">Ice</link> are generous deposits of solid <link="MERCURY">Mercury</link>, a rare metal that can be liquefied for use in industrial cooling systems.

This biome is truly a sight to behold: in addition to the soft charm of the occasional <link="ICEFLOWER">Idylla Flower</link>, there is something quite heartwarming about the way that the <link="LIGHTBUG">Shine Bugs'</link> glowing lights glitter on the frozen landscape.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.GARDEN.NAME: Garden Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.GARDEN.DESC: The Garden biome is a temperate environment with beneficial critters and plants well-suited for <link="FARMING">Farming</link>.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.GARDEN.UTILITY:
This biome is home to <link="STEGOSPECIES">Lumbs</link>, which assist in harvesting edible plants, and pollinator <link="BUTTERFLYSPECIES">Mimikas</link> which boost plant growth speeds.

<link="POWER">Power</link> systems built in this biome will benefit from <link="NICKELORE">Nickel Ore</link> and <link="PEAT">Peat</link> deposits, and with plenty of <link="SHALE">Shale</link> available, there is no lack of construction materials.

Colonists can rely on <link="GARDENFORAGEPLANTPLANTED">Snactus</link> plants for life-sustaining calories in their early days. <link="VINEMOTHER">Ovagro Nodes</link> become efficient <link="FOOD">Food</link> crops when permitted to grow to their full extent, as their <link="WATER">Water</link> requirements do not increase with the number of <link="VINEFRUIT">Ovagro Fig</link>-bearing vines.

New colonies should be able to survive here with relative ease.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.RAPTOR.NAME: Feather Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.RAPTOR.DESC: The chilly <link="FEATHERFABRIC">Feather</link> biome is home to huge, flightless <link="RAPTORSPECIES">Rhexes</link> that can be shorn for <link="CLOTHING">Textile Production</link>.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.RAPTOR.UTILITY:
<link="RAPTORSPECIES">Rhexes</link> are carnivorous critters who prey primarily on <link="CHAMELEONSPECIES">Dartles</link>. While both critters can be harvested for <link="FOOD">Food</link>, the <link="RAPTORSPECIES">Rhexes'</link> meat is too tough to be eaten raw.

This biome's flora includes the massive <link="DINOFERN">Megafrond</link> which enjoys a <link="CHLORINEGAS">Chlorine Gas</link> environment, the <link="DEWDRIPPERPLANT">Dew Dripper</link> which can be processed into <link="MILK">Brackene</link>, and the cooling <link="COLDBREATHER">Wheezewort</link>.

Duplicants working and living in this environment will require protective <link="EQUIPMENT">equipment</link>.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.WETLANDS.NAME: Wetlands Biome
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.WETLANDS.DESC: This hot, sticky biome features plentiful pools of <link="DIRTYWATER">Polluted Water</link>, as well as raw ingredients useful in establishing industrial systems.
SUBWORLDS.SUBWORLDS.WETLANDS.UTILITY:
The carnivorous <link="FLYTRAPPLANT">Lura Plant</link> traps airborne critters such as pesky <link="MOSQUITOSPECIES">Gnits</link> and produces <link="AMBER">Amber</link> that can be converted to <link="NATURALRESIN">Resin</link> used for <link="POLYPROPYLENE">Plastic</link> production. Local foliage also includes <link="KELPPLANT">Seakombs</link>, which can be processed into <link="PHYTOOIL">Phyto Oil</link>.

Aquatic behemoths called <link="PREHISTORICPACUSPECIES">Jawbos</link> prey on <link="PACUSPECIES">Pacus</link> and excrete hefty chunks of <link="RUST">Rust</link>.

UI.UI.WELCOMEMESSAGEBODY:
I've awoken at the target location, but colonization efforts have already hit a hitch. I was supposed to land on the planet's surface, but became trapped many miles underground instead.

Although the conditions are not ideal, it's imperative that I establish a colony here and begin mounting efforts to escape.
UI.UI.WELCOMEMESSAGEBODY_SPACEDOUT:
The asteroid we call home has collided with an anomalous planet, decimating our colony. Rebuilding it is of the utmost importance.

I've detected a new cluster of material-rich planetoids in nearby space. If I can guide the Duplicants through the perils of space travel, we could build a colony even bigger and better than before.
UI.UI.WELCOMEMESSAGEBODY_KF23:
This asteroid is oddly tilted, as though a powerful external force once knocked it off its axis.

I'll need to recalibrate my approach to colony-building in order to make the most of this unusual distribution of resources.
UI.UI.WELCOMEMESSAGEBODY_DLC2_CERES:
The ambient temperatures of this planet are inhospitably low.

I've detected the ruins of a scientifically advanced settlement buried deep beneath our landing site.

If my Duplicants can survive the journey into this frosty planet's core, we could use this newfound technology to build a colony like no other.
UI.UI.WELCOMEMESSAGEBODY_DLC4_PREHISTORIC:
My collision monitoring system has detected an imminent threat to our survival: a huge impactor asteroid is hurtling directly at this planet.

We must make our way to the surface and mount a defense system in time to destroy the incoming asteroid before it destroys us.
UI.UI.WELCOMEMESSAGEBODY_DLC4_PREHISTORIC_S:
Impactor asteroid collision in 10 cycles!

My scans indicate that the impact will trigger the eruption of all geysers that surround our landing site. There are...so many.

Initiate survival procedures immediately.
UI.UI.INCUBATE_CONTINUOUS_TOOLTIP: When checked, this building will continuously incubate eggs of the selected type

UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.WORMHOLE.NAME: Temporal Tear
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.WORMHOLE.DESCRIPTIO: The source of our misfortune, though it may also be our shot at freedom. Traces of Neutronium are detectable in my readings.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.RESEARCHDESTINATION: Our researchers would have a field day with this if they could only get close enough.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.DEBRIS.SATELLITE.DE: An artificial construct that has escaped its orbit. It no longer appears to be monitored.

UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.ASTEROIDS.ROCKYASTE: A minor mineral planet. Unlike a comet, it does not possess a tail.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.ASTEROIDS.METALLICA: A shimmering conglomerate of various metals.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.ASTEROIDS.CARBONACE: A common asteroid containing several useful resources.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.ASTEROIDS.OILYASTER: A viscous asteroid that is only loosely held together. Contains fossil fuel resources.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.ASTEROIDS.GOLDASTER: A rich asteroid with thin gold coating and veins of gold deposits throughout.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.CLUSTERMAPMETEORSHO: Unidentified Object

A cosmic anomaly is traveling through the galaxy.

Its origins and purpose are currently unknown, though a <link="CLUSTERTELESCOPE">Telescope</link> could change that.
Slimy Meteor Shower
A shower of slimy, biodynamic meteors on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
Blizzard Meteor Shower
A shower of cold, cold meteors on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
Ice Meteor Shower
A hailstorm of icy space rocks on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
Icy Nectar Meteor Shower
A hailstorm of sweet, icy space rocks on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid
Copper Meteor Shower
A shower of metallic meteors on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
Iron Meteor Shower
A shower of metallic space rocks on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
Gold Meteor Shower
A shower of shiny metallic space rocks on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
Uranium Meteor Shower
A toxic shower of radioactive meteors on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
Dust Fluff Meteor Shower
A cloud-like shower of dust fluff meteors heading towards the surface of an asteroid.
Dense Dust Meteor Shower
A dark cloud of heavy dust meteors heading towards the surface of an asteroid.
Regolith Meteor Shower
A shower of rocky meteors on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
Oxylite Meteor Shower
A shower of rocky, oxygen-rich meteors on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
Bleach Stone Meteor Shower
A shower of bleach stone meteors on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
Gassy Mooteor Shower
A herd of methane-infused meteors that cause a bit of a stink, but do no actual damage.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.CLUSTERMAPMETEORS.C: A shower of metallic meteors on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.CLUSTERMAPMETEORS.I: A shower of metallic space rocks on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.CLUSTERMAPMETEORS.L: An ancient impactor asteroid on a collision course with the surface of this world.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.DWARFPLANETS.ICYDWA: A terrestrial destination, frozen completely solid.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.DWARFPLANETS.ORGANI: A mass of organic material similar to the ooze used to print Duplicants. This sample is heavily degraded.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.DWARFPLANETS.DUSTYD: A loosely held together composite of minerals.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.DWARFPLANETS.SALTDW: A dwarf planet with unusually high sodium concentrations.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.DWARFPLANETS.REDDWA: An M-class star orbited by clusters of extractable aluminum and methane.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.PLANETS.TERRAPLANET: A planet with a walkable surface, though it does not possess the resources to sustain long-term life.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.PLANETS.VOLCANOPLAN: A large terrestrial object composed mainly of molten rock.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.PLANETS.SHATTEREDPL:
A once-habitable planet that has sustained massive damage.

A powerful containment field prevents our rockets from traveling to its surface.
A small planet covered in large swathes of brown rust.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.PLANETS.FORESTPLANE: A small green planet displaying several markers of primitive life.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.PLANETS.SHINYPLANET: A planet composed of rare, shimmering minerals. From the distance, it looks like gem in the sky.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.PLANETS.CHLORINEPLA: A noxious planet permeated by unbreathable chlorine.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.PLANETS.SALTDESERTP: A sweltering, desert-like planet covered in surface salt deposits.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.PLANETS.DLC2CERESSP: A frozen planet peppered with cinnabar deposits.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.PLANETS.DLC4PREHIST: A destination with extractable resources from another era.
The remains of an obliterated asteroid containing a renewable source of iridium.
The liquid remains of an obliterated asteroid containing a renewable source of Isosap.
The hot metallic remains of an obliterated asteroid containing a renewable source of iridium.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.GIANTS.GASGIANT.DES: A massive volume of <link="HYDROGEN">Hydrogen Gas</link> formed around a small solid center.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.GIANTS.ICEGIANT.DES: A massive volume of frozen material, primarily composed of <link="ICE">Ice</link>.
UI.UI.SPACEDESTINATIONS.GIANTS.HYDROGENGIAN: A massive volume of <link="HELIUM">Helium</link> formed around a small solid center.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.PACUPERCOLATOR.NAME: Percolator
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.PACUPERCOLATOR.DESCRIP: Don't drink from it! There was a pacu... IN the percolator!
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.PACUPERCOLATOR.ARTIFAC:
A coffee percolator with the remnants of a blend of coffee that was a personal favorite of Dr. Hassan Aydem.

He would specifically reserve the consumption of this particular blend for when he was reviewing research papers on Sunday afternoons.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.ROBOTARM.NAME: Robot Arm
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.ROBOTARM.ARTIFACT:
A commercially available robot arm that has had a significant amount of modifications made to it.

The initials B.A. appear on one of the fingers.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.HATCHFOSSIL.NAME: Pristine Fossil
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.HATCHFOSSIL.DESCRIPTIO: The preserved bones of an early species of Hatch.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.HATCHFOSSIL.ARTIFACT:
The preservation of this skeleton occurred artificially using a technique called the "The Ali Method".

It should be noted that this fossilization technique was pioneered by one Dr. Ashkan Seyed Ali, an employee of Gravitas.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.MODERNART.NAME: Modern Art
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.MODERNART.ARTIFACT:
A sculpture of the Neoplastism movement of Modern Art.

Gravitas records show that this piece was once used in a presentation called 'Form and Function in Corporate Aesthetic'.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.EGGROCK.NAME: Egg-Shaped Rock
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.EGGROCK.DESCRIPTION: It's unclear whether this is its naturally occurring shape, or if its appearance as been sculpted.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.EGGROCK.ARTIFACT: The words "Happy Farters Day Dad. Love Macy" appear on the bottom of this rock, written in a childlish scrawl.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.RAINBOWEGGROCK.NAME: Egg-Shaped Rock
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.RAINBOWEGGROCK.DESCRIP:
It's unclear whether this is its naturally occurring shape, or if its appearance as been sculpted.

This one is rainbow colored.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.RAINBOWEGGROCK.ARTIFAC: The words "Happy Father's Day, Dad. Love you!" appear on the bottom of this rock, written in very neat handwriting. The words are surrounded by four hearts drawn in what appears to be a pink gel pen.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.OKAYXRAY.NAME: Old X-Ray
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.OKAYXRAY.DESCRIPTION: Ew, weird. It has five fingers!
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.OKAYXRAY.ARTIFACT:
The description on this X-ray indicates that it was taken in the Gravitas Medical Facility.

Most likely this X-ray was performed while investigating an injury that occurred within the facility.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.SHIELDGENERATOR.NAME: Shield Generator
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.SHIELDGENERATOR.DESCRI: A mechanical prototype capable of producing a small section of shielding.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.SHIELDGENERATOR.ARTIFA:
The energy field produced by this shield generator completely ignores those light behaviors which are wave-like and focuses instead on its particle behaviors.

This seemingly paradoxical state is possible when light is slowed down to the point at which it stops entirely.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.TEAPOT.NAME: Encrusted Teapot
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.TEAPOT.DESCRIPTION: A teapot from the depths of space, coated in a thick layer of Neutronium.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.TEAPOT.ARTIFACT:
The amount of Neutronium present in this teapot suggests that it has crossed the threshold of the spacetime continuum on countless occasions, floating through many multiple universes over a plethora of times and spaces.

Though there are, theoretically, an infinite amount of outcomes to any one event over many multi-verses, the homogeneity of the still relatively young multiverse suggests that this is then not the only teapot which has crossed into multiple universes. Despite the infinite possible outcomes of infinite multiverses it appears one high probability constant is that there is, or once was, a teapot floating somewhere in space within every universe.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.DNAMODEL.NAME: Double Helix Model
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.DNAMODEL.DESCRIPTION: An educational model of genetic information.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.DNAMODEL.ARTIFACT:
A physical representation of the building blocks of life.

This one contains trace amounts of a Genetic Ooze prototype that was once used by Gravitas.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.SANDSTONE.NAME: Sandstone
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.SANDSTONE.DESCRIPTION: A beautiful rock composed of multiple layers of sediment.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.SANDSTONE.ARTIFACT:
This sample of sandstone appears to have been processed by the Gravitas Mining Gun that was made available to the general public.

Note: The Gravitas public Mining Gun model is different than ones used by Duplicants in its larger size, and extra precautionary features added in order to be compliant with national safety standards.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.MAGMALAMP.NAME: Magma Lamp
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.MAGMALAMP.ARTIFACT:
Molten lava and obsidian combined in a way that allows the lava to maintain just enough heat to remain in liquid form.

Plans of this lamp found in the Gravitas archives have been attributed to one Robin Nisbet, PhD.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.OBELISK.NAME: Small Obelisk
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.OBELISK.DESCRIPTION:
A rectangular stone piece.

Its function is unclear.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.OBELISK.ARTIFACT:
On close inspection this rectangle is actually a stone box built with a covert, almost seamless, lid, housing a tiny key.

It is still unclear what the key unlocks.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.RUBIKSCUBE.NAME: Rubik's Cube
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.RUBIKSCUBE.DESCRIPTION: This mystery of the universe has already been solved.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.RUBIKSCUBE.ARTIFACT:
A well-used, competition-compliant version of the popular puzzle cube.

It's worth noting that Dr. Dylan 'Nails' Winslow was once a regional Rubik's Cube champion.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.OFFICEMUG.NAME: Office Mug
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.OFFICEMUG.DESCRIPTION: An intermediary place to store espresso before you move it to your mouth.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.OFFICEMUG.ARTIFACT:
An office mug with the Gravitas logo on it. Though their office mugs were all emblazoned with the same logo, Gravitas colored their mugs differently to distinguish between their various departments.

This one is from the AI department.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.AMELIASWATCH.NAME: Wrist Watch
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.AMELIASWATCH.DESCRIPTI: It was discovered in a package labeled "To be entrusted to Dr. Walker".
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.AMELIASWATCH.ARTIFACT:
This watch once belonged to pioneering aviator Amelia Earhart and travelled to space via astronaut Dr. Shannon Walker.

How it came to be floating in space is a matter of speculation, but perhaps the adventurous spirit of its original stewards became infused within the fabric of this timepiece and compelled the universe to launch it into the great unknown.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.MOONMOONMOON.NAME: Moonmoonmoon
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.MOONMOONMOON.DESCRIPTI: A moon's moon's moon. It's very small.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.MOONMOONMOON.ARTIFACT:
In contrast to most moons, this object's glowing properties do not come from reflecting an external source of light, but rather from an internal glow of mysterious origin.

The glow of this object also grants an extraordinary amount of Decor bonus to nearby Duplicants, almost as if it was designed that way.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.BIOLUMINESCENTROCK.DES: A thriving colony of tiny, microscopic organisms is responsible for giving it its bluish glow.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.BIOLUMINESCENTROCK.ART:
The microscopic organisms within this rock are of a unique variety whose genetic code shows many tell-tale signs of being genetically engineered within a lab.

Further analysis reveals they share 99.999% of their genetic code with Shine Bugs.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.PLASMALAMP.NAME: Plasma Lamp
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.PLASMALAMP.DESCRIPTION: No space colony is complete without one.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.PLASMALAMP.ARTIFACT:
The bottom of this lamp contains the words 'Property of the Atmospheric Sciences Department'.

It's worth noting that the Gravitas Atmospheric Sciences Department once simulated an experiment testing the feasibility of survival in an environment filled with noble gasses, similar to the ones contained within this device.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.MOLDAVITE.NAME: Moldavite
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.MOLDAVITE.DESCRIPTION: A unique green stone formed from the impact of a meteorite.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.MOLDAVITE.ARTIFACT:
This extremely rare, museum grade moldavite once sat on the desk of Dr. Ren Sato, but it was stolen by some unknown person.

Dr. Sato suspected the perpetrator was none other than Director Stern, but was never able to confirm this theory.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.BRICKPHONE.NAME: Strange Brick
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.BRICKPHONE.ARTIFACT:
This cordless phone once held a direct line to an unknown location in which strange distant voices can be heard but not understood, nor interacted with.

Though Gravitas spent a lot of money and years of study dedicated to discovering its secret, the mystery was never solved.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.SOLARSYSTEM.NAME: Self-Contained System
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.SOLARSYSTEM.DESCRIPTIO: A marvel of the cosmos, inside this display is an entirely self-contained solar system.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.SOLARSYSTEM.ARTIFACT:
This marvel of a device was built using parts from an old Tornado-in-a-Box science fair project.

Very faint, faded letters are still visible on the display bottom that read 'Camille P. Grade 5'.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.SINK.NAME: Sink
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.SINK.DESCRIPTION: No collection is complete without it.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.SINK.ARTIFACT:
A small trace of encrusted soap on this sink strongly suggests it was installed in a personal bathroom, rather than a public one which would have used a soap dispenser.

The soap sliver is light blue and contains a manufactured blueberry fragrance.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.ROCKTORNADO.NAME: Tornado Rock
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.ROCKTORNADO.DESCRIPTIO: It's unclear how it formed, although I'm glad it did.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.ROCKTORNADO.ARTIFACT:
Speculations about the origin of this rock include a paper written by one Harold P. Moreson, Ph.D. in which he theorized it could be a rare form of hollow geode which failed to form any crystals inside.

This paper appears in the Gravitas archives, and in all probability, was one of the factors in the hiring of Moreson into the Geology department of the company.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.BLENDER.NAME: Blender
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.BLENDER.DESCRIPTION: Equipment used to conduct experiments answering the age-old question, "Could that blend"?
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.BLENDER.ARTIFACT:
Trace amounts of edible foodstuffs present in this blender indicate that it was probably used to emulsify the ingredients of a mush bar.

It is also very likely that it was employed at least once in the production of a peanut butter and banana smoothie.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.SAXOPHONE.NAME: Mangled Saxophone
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.SAXOPHONE.DESCRIPTION: The name "Pesquet" is barely legible on the inside.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.SAXOPHONE.ARTIFACT:
Though it is often remarked that "in space, no one can hear you scream", Thomas Pesquet proved the same cannot be said for the smooth jazzy sounds of a saxophone.

Although this instrument once belonged to the eminent French Astronaut its current bumped and bent shape suggests it has seen many adventures beyond that of just being used to perform an out-of-this-world saxophone solo.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.STETHOSCOPE.NAME: Stethoscope
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.STETHOSCOPE.DESCRIPTIO: Listens to Duplicant heartbeats, or gurgly tummies.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.STETHOSCOPE.ARTIFACT: The size and shape of this stethescope suggests it was not intended to be used by neither a human-sized nor a Duplicant-sized person but something half-way in between the two beings.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.VHS.NAME: Archaic Tech
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.VHS.DESCRIPTION: Be kind when you handle it. It's very fragile.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.VHS.ARTIFACT:
The label on this VHS tape reads "Jackie and Olivia's House Warming Party".

Unfortunately, a device with which to play this recording no longer exists in this universe.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.REACTORMODEL.NAME: Model Nuclear Power Plant
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.REACTORMODEL.ARTIFACT:
Though this Nuclear Power Plant was never built, this model exists as an artifact to a time early in the life of Gravitas when it was researching all alternatives to solving the global energy problem.

Ultimately, the idea of building a Nuclear Power Plant was abandoned in favor of the "much safer" alternative of developing the Temporal Bow.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.MOODRING.NAME: Radiation Mood Ring
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.MOODRING.ARTIFACT:
A wholly unique ring not found anywhere outside of the Gravitas Laboratory.

Though it can't be determined for sure who worked on this extraordinary curiousity it's worth noting that, for his Ph.D. thesis, Dr. Travaldo Farrington wrote a paper entitled "Novelty Uses for Radiochromatic Dyes".
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.ORACLE.NAME: Useless Machine
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.ORACLE.ARTIFACT:
All of the parts for this contraption are recycled from projects abandoned by the Robotics department.

The design is very close to one published in an amateur DIY magazine that once sat in the lobby of the 'Employees Only' area of Gravitas' facilities.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.GRUBSTATUE.NAME: Grubgrub Statue
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.GRUBSTATUE.DESCRIPTION: A moving tribute to a tiny plant hugger.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.GRUBSTATUE.ARTIFACT:
It's very likely this statue was placed in a hidden, secluded place in the Gravitas laboratory since the creation of Grubgrubs was a closely held secret that the general public was not privy to.

This is a shame since the artistic quality of this statue is really quite accomplished.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.HONEYJAR.NAME: Honey Jar
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.HONEYJAR.DESCRIPTION: Sweet golden liquid with just a touch of uranium.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.HONEYJAR.ARTIFACT:
Records from the Genetics and Biology Lab of the Gravitas facility show that several early iterations of a radioactive Bee would continue to produce honey and that this honey was once accidentally stored in the employee kitchen which resulted in several incidents of minor radiation poisoning when it was erroneously labled as a sweetener for tea.

Employees who used this product reported that it was the "sweetest honey they'd ever tasted" and expressed no regret at the mix-up.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.PLASTICFLOWERS.NAME: Plastic Flowers
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.PLASTICFLOWERS.DESCRIP: Maintenance-free blooms that will outlast us all.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.PLASTICFLOWERS.ARTIFAC:
Manufactured and sold by a home staging company hired by Gravitas to "make Space feel more like home."

This bouquet is designed to smell like freshly baked cookies.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.FOUNTAINPEN.NAME: Fountain Pen
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.FOUNTAINPEN.DESCRIPTIO: It cuts through red tape better than a sword ever could.
UI.UI.SPACEARTIFACTS.FOUNTAINPEN.ARTIFACT:
The handcrafted gold nib features a triangular logo with the letters V and I inside.

Its owner was too proud to report it stolen, and would be shocked to learn of its whereabouts.
UI.UI.KEEPSAKES.CRITTER_MANIPULATOR.NAME: Ceramic Morb
UI.UI.KEEPSAKES.CRITTER_MANIPULATOR.DESCRIP:
A pottery project produced in an HR-mandated art therapy class.

It's glazed with a substance that once landed a curious lab technician in the ER.
UI.UI.KEEPSAKES.MEGA_BRAIN.NAME: Model Plane
UI.UI.KEEPSAKES.MEGA_BRAIN.DESCRIPTION: A treasured souvenir that was once a common accompaniment to children's meals during commercial flights. There's a hole in the bottom from when Dr. Holland had it mounted on a stand.
UI.UI.KEEPSAKES.LONELY_MINION.NAME: Rusty Toolbox
UI.UI.KEEPSAKES.LONELY_MINION.DESCRIPTION: On the inside of the lid, someone used a screwdriver to carve a drawing of a group of smiling Duplicants gathered around a massive crater.
UI.UI.KEEPSAKES.FOSSIL_HUNT.NAME: Critter Collar
UI.UI.KEEPSAKES.FOSSIL_HUNT.DESCRIPTION:
The tag reads "Molly".

On the reverse is "Designed by B363" stamped above what appears to be an unusually shaped pawprint.
UI.UI.KEEPSAKES.MORB_ROVER_MAKER.NAME: Toy Bot
UI.UI.KEEPSAKES.MORB_ROVER_MAKER.DESCRIPTIO:
A custom-made robot programmed to deliver puns in a variety of celebrity voices.

It is also a paper shredder.
UI.UI.KEEPSAKES.GEOTHERMAL_PLANT.NAME: Shiny Coprolite
UI.UI.KEEPSAKES.GEOTHERMAL_PLANT.DESCRIPTIO: A spectacular sample of organic material fossilized into lead. Some things really do get better with age.
UI.UI.KEEPSAKES.VIEWMASTER.NAME: Stereoscope
UI.UI.KEEPSAKES.VIEWMASTER.DESCRIPTION:
A tool used to gaze into frozen moments of time.

One of the images is of a child standing in a field, waving a huge piece of blackened titanium.

UI.UI.FRONTEND.DEMO_OVER_SCREEN.TITLE: Thanks for playing!
UI.UI.FRONTEND.DEMO_OVER_SCREEN.BODY:
Thank you for playing the demo for Oxygen Not Included!

This game is still in development.

Go to kleigames.com/o2 or ask one of us if you'd like more information.

Checked: Sandbox Mode is turned on

Checked: This colony will be a cloud save (Default)

Unchecked: The Printing Pod will only offer Duplicant blueprints

The whole colony will be ravaged by plague if a Duplicant so much as sneezes funny
These Duplicants have an increased chance of contracting diseases from germ exposure
These Duplicants have a decreased chance of contracting diseases from germ exposure
Like diplomatic immunity, but without the diplomacy. These Duplicants will never get sick
Adjusts the minimum morale Duplicants must maintain to avoid gaining stress
The finest of the finest can barely keep up with these Duplicants' stringent demands
Duplicants require higher morale than usual to fend off stress
Duplicants require lower morale than usual to fend off stress
These Duplicants have zero standards and will never gain stress, regardless of their morale
Affects how quickly Duplicants burn calories and become hungry
Your Duplicants are on a see-food diet... They see food and they eat it
Duplicants burn calories quickly and require more feeding than usual
Duplicants burn calories slowly and get by with fewer meals
These Duplicants were printed without tummies and need no food at all
Adjusts Bionic Duplicants' baseline power consumption
These Bionic Duplicants drain batteries like it's their only job
These Duplicants have an increased appetite for power
These Duplicants consume less power than usual
These Bionic Duplicants run on old-school enthusiasm, and barely consume power at all
Adjusts how soon the Demolior asteroid collides with The Prehistoric Planet Pack asteroid

It'll all be over soon

Only 100 cycles until collision

Demolior impacts sooner than usual

150 cycles until collision

Demolior impacts later than usual

300 cycles until collision

Duplicants could probably build a whole new asteroid by the time Demolior impacts this one

500 cycles until collision
Demolior does not exist in this universe and the achievement cannot be earned
New worlds added by mods can be selected here
New asteroid belts added by mods can be selected here
Determines the number of story traits spawned
Zero story traits. Zip. Nada. None
Not zero, but not a lot
Plenty of story traits to go around
Affects how quickly equippable suits wear out
Duplicants have perfected clothes manufacturing and are able to make suits that last forever
Suits are more durable than usual
Suits wear out faster than usual
These Duplicants are no tailors - suits wear out much faster than usual
Affects how susceptible Duplicants are to radiation sickness
Duplicants feel ill at the merest mention of radiation...and may never truly recover
Duplicants are more sensitive to radiation exposure than usual
Duplicants are more resistant to radiation exposure than usual
Duplicants could bathe in radioactive waste and not even notice
Affects how quickly Duplicant stress rises
A strong emotional support system makes these Duplicants impervious to all stress
Duplicants gain stress slower than usual
Duplicants gain stress more quickly than usual
These Duplicants were never taught coping mechanisms... they're devastated by stress as a result
Determines whether Duplicants wreak havoc on the colony when they reach maximum stress
Checked: Duplicants will wreak havoc when they reach 100% stress (Default)
Unchecked: Duplicants will not wreak havoc at maximum stress

UI.UI.FRONTEND.MODESELECTSCREEN.SURVIVAL_DE: Stay on your toes and one step ahead of this unforgiving world. One slip up could bring your colony crashing down.
UI.UI.FRONTEND.MODESELECTSCREEN.NOSWEAT_DES: When disaster strikes (and it inevitably will), take a deep breath and stay calm. You have ample time to find a solution.
Scenarios similar to the classic Oxygen Not Included experience. Large starting asteroids with many resources. Less emphasis on space travel.
Scenarios designed for the Spaced Out! DLC. Smaller starting asteroids with resources distributed across the starmap. More emphasis on space travel.
Alternative gameplay experiences, including experimental scenarios designed for special events.

UI.UI.FRONTEND.LOADSCREEN.CONVERT_TO_CLOUD_:
Converting a colony to use cloud saves will move all of the save files for that colony into the cloud saves folder.

This allows your game platform to sync this colony to the cloud for your account, so it can be played on multiple machines.
UI.UI.FRONTEND.LOADSCREEN.CONVERT_TO_LOCAL_:
Converting a colony to NOT use cloud saves will move all of the save files for that colony into the local saves folder.

<style="KKeyword">These save files will no longer be synced to the cloud.</style>

The game was unable to move all save files to their new location. To fix this, please:

1. Try temporarily disabling virus scanners and malware

2. Turn off file sync services such as OneDrive and DropBox.
3. Restart the game to retry file migration.
If this still doesn't solve the problem, please post a bug in the forums and we will attempt to assist with your issue.

UI.UI.FRONTEND.FEEDBACK_SCREEN.HEADER: We would love to hear from you!
UI.UI.FRONTEND.FEEDBACK_SCREEN.DESCRIPTION:
Let us know if you encounter any problems or how we can improve your Oxygen Not Included experience.

When reporting a bug, please include your log and colony save file. The buttons to the right will help you find those files on your local drive.

Thank you for being part of the Oxygen Not Included community!

UI.UI.FRONTEND.METRICS_OPTIONS_SCREEN.DESCR: Collecting user data helps us improve the game. Players who opt out of data communication will no longer send us crash reports and play data. They will also be unable to receive new item unlocks from our servers, though existing unlocked items will continue to function. For more details on our privacy policy and how we use the data we collect, please visit our privacy center.

UI.UI.FRONTEND.SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.SUDDENMO:
Welcome to the Expressive Upgrade! This update introduces a new Morale system that replaces Food and Decor Expectations that were found in previous versions of the game.

The game you are trying to load was created before this system was introduced, and will need to be updated. You may either:


1) Enable the new Morale system in this save, removing Food and Decor Expectations. It's possible that when you load your save your old colony won't meet your Duplicants' new Morale needs, so they'll receive a 5 cycle Morale boost to give you time to adjust.

2) Disable Morale in this save. The new Morale mechanics will still be visible, but won't affect your Duplicants' stress. Food and Decor expectations will no longer exist in this save.
UI.UI.FRONTEND.SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.NEWAUTOM:
The following buildings have acquired new automation ports!

Take a moment to check whether these buildings in your colony are now unintentionally connected to existing <link="LOGICWIRE">Automation Wire</link>s.
UI.UI.FRONTEND.SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.MERGEDOW: BREATH OF FRESH AIR UPDATE CHANGES

Oxygen Not Included has had a major update since this save file was created! In addition to the multitude of bug fixes and quality-of-life features, please pay attention to these changes which may affect your existing colony:
•Fridges are more effective for early-game food storage •Both freezing temperatures and a sterile gas are needed for total food preservation.
•Deodorizer now requires 5w Power. •Duplicants will get Stinging Eyes from gasses such as chlorine and hydrogen.
•Many simulation bugs have been fixed. •This may change the effectiveness of certain contraptions and Steam Turbine setups.
•The Oxygen Mask Station has been added to aid early-game exploration. •Use the new Meter Valves for precise control of resources in pipes.
UI.UI.FRONTEND.SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.SPACESCA: There have been significant changes to Space Scanners and Telescopes since this save file was created! Meteor showers have been disabled for 20 cycles to provide time to adapt.
Please note these changes which may affect your existing colony:

•<indent=20px>Automation is synced between all Space Scanners targeting the same object.</indent>
•<indent=20px>Network quality based on the total percentage of sky covered.</indent>
•<indent=20px>Industrial machinery no longer impacts network quality.</indent>

•<indent=20px>Telescopes have a symmetrical scanning range.</indent>
•<indent=20px>Obstructions block visibility from the blocked tile out toward the outer edge of scanning range.</indent>
UI.UI.FRONTEND.SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.U50_CHAN: There have been significant changes to critters since this save file was created! Please check on your ranches.
•<indent=20px>Critter moods have been expanded to include miserable and satisfied states: Miserable stops reproduction. Satisfied gives full metabolism and default reproduction.</indent>

•<indent=20px>Pacus have received a number of bug fixes and changes affecting their reproduction: Now correctly Confined when flopping or in less than 8 tiles of liquid. Easier to feed due to a rebalanced diet.</indent>

•<indent=20px>Suit checkpoints now have an automation port to disable them so Duplicants can pass through. Some checkpoints may now be unintentionally connected to existing <link="LOGICWIRE">Automation Wire</link>s.
•<indent=20px>Meter valves no longer continuously reset when receiving a green signal.</indent>

UI.UI.STARMAP.ANALYSIS_DESCRIPTION:
Use a Telescope to analyze space destinations.

Completing analysis on an object will unlock rocket missions to that destination.
UI.UI.STARMAP.RESEARCH_DESCRIPTION: Gather Interstellar Research Data using Research Modules.
UI.UI.STARMAP.NO_ROCKETS_HELP_TEXT:
Rockets allow you to visit nearby celestial bodies.

Each rocket must have a Command Module, an Engine, and Fuel.

You can also carry other modules that allow you to gather specific resources from the places you visit.

Remember the more weight a rocket has, the more limited it'll be on the distance it can travel. You can add more fuel to fix that, but fuel will add weight as well.
