UI.UI.CODEX.TITLE: DATABASE
UI.UI.CODEX.CODEX_DISCOVERED_MESSAGE.TITLE: New Log Entry
UI.UI.CODEX.CODEX_DISCOVERED_MESSAGE.BODY: I've added a new entry to my log: {codex}
UI.UI.CODEX.GEYSERS.DESC:
Geysers and Fumaroles emit elements at variable intervals. They provide a sustainable source of material, albeit in typically low volumes.

The variable factors of a geyser are:

    • Emission element 
    • Emission temperature 
    • Emission mass 
    • Cycle length 
    • Dormancy duration 
    • Disease emitted
UI.UI.DEVELOPMENTBUILDS.TESTING_TOOLTIP:
This game is currently running a Test version.

(ClickType/Click) for more info.
UI.UI.DEVELOPMENTBUILDS.TESTING_MESSAGE:
This game is running a Test version of Oxygen Not Included. This means that some features may be in development or buggier than normal, and require more testing before they can be moved into the Release build.

If you encounter any bugs or strange behavior, please add a report to the bug forums. We appreciate it!
UI.UI.DEVELOPMENTBUILDS.ALPHA.LOADING.TITLE: Welcome to Oxygen Not Included!
UI.UI.DEVELOPMENTBUILDS.ALPHA.LOADING.BODY:
This game is in the early stages of development which means you're likely to encounter strange, amusing, and occasionally just downright frustrating bugs.

During this time Oxygen Not Included will be receiving regular updates to fix bugs, add features, and introduce additional content, so if you encounter issues or just have suggestions to share, please let us know on our forums: <u>http://forums.kleientertainment.com</u>

A special thanks to those who joined us during our time in Alpha. We value your feedback and thank you for joining us in the development process. We couldn't do this without you.

Enjoy your time in deep space!

- Klei
UI.UI.DEVELOPMENTBUILDS.ALPHA.LOADING.BODY_:
This DLC is currently in active development, which means you're likely to encounter strange, amusing, and occasionally just downright frustrating bugs.

 During this time Spaced Out! will be receiving regular updates to fix bugs, add features, and introduce additional content.

 We've got lots of content old and new to add to this DLC before it's ready, and we're happy to have you along with us. Enjoy your time in deep space!

 - The Team at Klei
UI.UI.DEVELOPMENTBUILDS.PREVIOUS_UPDATE.BOD: Whoops! You're about to opt in to the Previous Update branch. That means opting out of all new features, fixes and content from the live branch. This branch is temporary. It will be replaced when the next update is released. It's also completely unsupported: please don't report bugs or issues you find here. Are you sure you want to opt in?
UI.UI.DEVELOPMENTBUILDS.DLC_BETA.TITLE: Welcome to Oxygen Not Included
UI.UI.DEVELOPMENTBUILDS.DLC_BETA.BODY: You're about to opt in to the beta for The Bionic Booster Pack DLC. This free beta is a work in progress, and will be discontinued before the paid DLC is released. Are you sure you want to opt in?

UI.UI.JOBSSCREEN.TOGGLE_ADVANCED_MODE_TOOLT: Errand Proximity Settings Enabling Proximity settings tells my Duplicants to always choose the closest, most urgent errand to perform. When disabled, Duplicants will choose between two high priority errands based on a hidden priority hierarchy instead. Enabling Proximity helps cut down on travel time in areas with lots of high priority errands, and is useful for large colonies.

UI.UI.USERMENUACTIONS.READLORE.SEARCH_POD:
I search my incoming message history and find a single entry. I move the odd message into my database.

New Database Entry discovered.
UI.UI.USERMENUACTIONS.READLORE.ALREADY_SEAR: I already took everything of interest from this. I can check the Database to re-read what I found.
UI.UI.USERMENUACTIONS.READLORE.SEARCH_CABIN:
One intact document remains - an old yellowing newspaper clipping. It won't be of much use, but I add it to my database nonetheless.

New Database Entry discovered.
UI.UI.USERMENUACTIONS.READLORE.SEARCH_STERN:
There's an old magazine article from a publication called the "Nucleoid" tucked in the top drawer. I add it to my database.

New Database Entry discovered.
UI.UI.USERMENUACTIONS.READLORE.ALREADY_SEAR: The desk is eerily empty inside.
UI.UI.USERMENUACTIONS.READLORE.SEARCH_TELEP:
While scanning the antiquated computer code of this machine I uncovered some research notes. I add them to my database.

New Database Entry discovered.

Incongruously placed research notes are hidden within the operating instructions of this device. I add them to my database.

New Database Entry discovered.
UI.UI.USERMENUACTIONS.READLORE.SEARCH_CRYO_:
There are some safety instructions included in the operating instructions of this Cryotank. I add them to my database.

New Database Entry discovered.
UI.UI.USERMENUACTIONS.READLORE.SEARCH_PROPG:
There's a handwritten note taped to the back of this poster. I add it to my database.

New Database Entry discovered.
UI.UI.USERMENUACTIONS.READLORE.SEARCH_COMPU:
I search through the computer's database and find an unredacted e-mail.

New Database Entry unlocked.

After searching through the computer's database, I managed to piece together some files that piqued my interest.

New Database Entry unlocked.

Searching through the computer, I find some recoverable files that are still readable.

New Database Entry unlocked.

The computer looks pristine on the outside, but is corrupted internally. Still, I managed to find one uncorrupted file, and have added it to my database.

New Database Entry unlocked.

The computer was wiped almost completely clean, except for one file hidden in the recycle bin.

New Database Entry unlocked.

I search the computer, storing what useful data I can find in my own memory.

New Database Entry unlocked.

This computer is broken and requires some finessing to get working. Still, I recover a handful of interesting files.

New Database Entry unlocked.
Unfortunately, the computer's hard drive is irreparably corrupted.
The computer was wiped clean before I got here. There is nothing to recover.
Some intact files are available on the computer, but nothing I haven't already discovered elsewhere. I find nothing else.
The computer has nothing of import.

Someone's left a solitaire game up. There's nothing else of interest on the computer.

Also, it looks as though they were about to lose.
The background on this computer depicts two kittens hugging in a field of daisies. There is nothing else of import to be found.
The user alphabetized the shortcuts on their desktop. There is nothing else of import to be found.
The background is a picture of a golden retriever in a science lab. It looks very confused. There is nothing else of import to be found.
This user never changed their default background. There is nothing else of import to be found. How dull.

New Database Entry discovered.

I look for anything of interest within the abandoned machinery and add what I find to my database.

New Database Entry discovered.

I look around and recover an old file.

New Database Entry discovered.

There's a three-ringed binder inside. I scan the surviving documents.

New Database Entry discovered.

A discarded journal inside remains mostly intact. I scan the pages of use.

New Database Entry discovered.

A single page of a long printout remains legible. I scan it and add it to my database.

New Database Entry discovered.

A few loose papers can be found inside. I scan the ones that look interesting.

New Database Entry discovered.

I find a memory stick inside and copy its data into my database.

New Database Entry discovered.
I look around but find nothing of interest.

UI.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.EAT.NAME: Mealtime
UI.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.EAT.DESCRIPTION:
EAT:
During Mealtime Duplicants will head to their assigned mess halls and eat.
UI.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.SLEEP.NAME: Sleep
UI.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.SLEEP.DESCRIPTION:
SLEEP:
When it's time to sleep, Duplicants will head to their assigned rooms and rest.
UI.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.WORK.NAME: Work
UI.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.WORK.DESCRIPTION:
WORK:
During Work hours Duplicants will perform any pending errands in the colony.
UI.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.RECREATION.NAME: Recreation
UI.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.RECREATION.DESCRIP:
HAMMER TIME:
During Hammer Time, Duplicants will relieve their <link="STRESS">Stress</link> through dance. Please be aware that no matter how hard my Duplicants try, they will absolutely not be able to touch this.
UI.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.HYGIENE.NAME: Hygiene
UI.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.HYGIENE.DESCRIPTIO:
HYGIENE:
During <link="HYGIENE">Hygiene</link> hours Duplicants will head to their assigned washrooms to get cleaned up.
UI.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.HYGENE.NAME: Bathtime
UI.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.HYGENE.DESCRIPTION:
During Bathtime shifts my Duplicants will take care of their hygienic needs, such as going to the bathroom, using the shower or washing their hands.

Once they're all caught up on personal hygiene, Duplicants will head back to work.
UI.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.HYGENE.NOTIFICATION_TO: During <style="KKeyword">Bathtime</style> shifts my Duplicants will take care of their hygienic needs, such as going to the bathroom, using the shower or washing their hands.
UI.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.WORKTIME.NAME: Work
UI.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.WORKTIME.DESCRIPTION:
During Work shifts my Duplicants must perform the errands I have placed for them throughout the colony.

It's important when scheduling to maintain a good work-life balance for my Duplicants to maintain their health and prevent Morale loss.
UI.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.WORKTIME.NOTIFICATION_: During <style="KKeyword">Work</style> shifts my Duplicants must perform the errands I've placed for them throughout the colony.
UI.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.RECREATION.NAME: Downtime
UI.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.RECREATION.DESCRIPTION:
During Downtime my Duplicants they may do as they please.

This may include personal matters like bathroom visits or snacking, or they may choose to engage in leisure activities like socializing with friends.

Downtime increases Duplicant Morale.
UI.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.RECREATION.NOTIFICATIO: During <style="KKeyword">Downtime</style> shifts my Duplicants they may do as they please.
UI.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.SLEEP.NAME: Bedtime
UI.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.SLEEP.DESCRIPTION:
My Duplicants use Bedtime shifts to rest up after a hard day's work.

Scheduling too few bedtime shifts may prevent my Duplicants from regaining enough Stamina to make it through the following day.
UI.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.SLEEP.NOTIFICATION_TOO: My Duplicants use <style="KKeyword">Bedtime</style> shifts to rest up after a hard day's work.

WORLD_TRAITS.WORLD_TRAITS.MISALIGNED_START.DESCRIPTIO: The <link="HEADQUARTERS">Printing Pod</link> didn't end up in the asteroid's exact center this time... but it's still nowhere near the surface

WORLDS.WORLDS.SURVIVAL_CHANCE.TITLE: Survival Chance: {0}
WORLDS.WORLDS.SANDSTONE_DEFAULT.NAME: Terra
WORLDS.WORLDS.SANDSTONE_DEFAULT.DESCRIPTION:
A promising location with a balanced variety of resources.

<smallcaps>Terra meets all the requirements for Duplicant life and holds no surprises. It's an ideal location for a first attempt at establishing a colony.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.SANDSTONE_FROZEN.NAME: Rime
WORLDS.WORLDS.SANDSTONE_FROZEN.DESCRIPTION:
A frigid location marked by inhospitably low temperatures throughout.

<smallcaps>Rime's low temperatures will make finding water and establishing farms or ranches problematic. However, the wide spectrum of minerals and cool environment could lead to thriving industry.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.FOREST_DEFAULT.NAME: Arboria
WORLDS.WORLDS.FOREST_DEFAULT.DESCRIPTION:
A location with a natural abundance of trees.

<smallcaps>Colonizing Arboria will require careful planning right from the start. Because of its lack of metals, finding biological solutions to problems is a must.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.FOREST_HOT.NAME: Aridio
WORLDS.WORLDS.FOREST_HOT.DESCRIPTION:
A location with oppressively hot temperatures.

<smallcaps>Temperatures on Aridio are much higher than expected. While resources are abundant, maintaining food and infrastructure could be difficult as our colony warms.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.FOREST_LUSH.NAME: Verdante
WORLDS.WORLDS.FOREST_LUSH.DESCRIPTION:
A lush location rich in wildlife and life-sustaining resources.

<smallcaps>Establishing a foothold on Verdante will be challenging due to reduced food and oxygen options. However, abundant biological and mineral resources should afford excellent long-term growth.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.BADLANDS.NAME: The Badlands
WORLDS.WORLDS.BADLANDS.DESCRIPTION:
A barren location with an overabundance of mineral resources.

<smallcaps>The rocky terrain of The Badlands poses no immediate threats, but sparse resource availability will make expansion and technological progress challenging.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.OASIS.NAME: Oasisse
WORLDS.WORLDS.OASIS.DESCRIPTION:
A desolate location with a cache of life-sustaining water trapped beneath the surface.

<smallcaps>A wide underground desert will pose temperature threats and strain the resources of a colony on Oasisse. However, surviving the challenge should present great industrial opportunities.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.OCEANIA.NAME: Oceania
WORLDS.WORLDS.OCEANIA.DESCRIPTION:
A location with vast quantities of undrinkable salt water.

<smallcaps>Oceania is quite stable and resource rich, but the majority of the area is covered in a saltwater ocean. Careful expansion and resource usage should lead to a successful colony.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.VOLCANIC.NAME: Volcanea
WORLDS.WORLDS.VOLCANIC.DESCRIPTION:
A location rife with molten lava pockets and intense heat.

<smallcaps>Volcanea would be perfect if it wasn't for the volcanoes. Digging carefully and managing the temperatures in our colony will be essential to success.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.HELICONA.NAME: Helicona
WORLDS.WORLDS.HELICONA.DESCRIPTION:
Due to its highly elliptical orbit around its host star, this rock is cold. Oh so very cold.

<smallcaps></smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.THE_ROCK.NAME: The Rock
WORLDS.WORLDS.MOON_BARREN.NAME: Barren Moon
WORLDS.WORLDS.MOON_BARREN.DESCRIPTION:
A smaller planetoid in orbit around a larger, resource rich world.

<smallcaps>Barren Moons are rich in minerals, but Duplicants will need to branch out into space early to find the resources the colony needs to stay alive.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.IDEALLANDINGSITE.NAME: Irradiated Forest Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.IDEALLANDINGSITE.DESCRIPTION:
A sandstone and forest world with significant radiation.

<smallcaps>Irradiated Forest Asteroids have an abundance of metal for the taking if Duplicants can withstand the planetoid's radiation.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.METALHEAVYLANDINGSITE.NAME: Irradiated Marsh Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.METALHEAVYLANDINGSITE.DESCRIPTION:
A marshy world with significant radiation.

<smallcaps>Irradiated Marsh Asteroids have an abundance of metal for the taking if Duplicants can withstand the planetoid's radiation.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLASANDSTONEDEFAULT.NAME: Terra Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLASANDSTONEDEFAULT.DESCRIPTI:
A promising location with a balanced variety of resources.

<smallcaps>Terra meets all the requirements for Duplicant life and holds no surprises. It's an ideal location for a first attempt at establishing a colony.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLAFORESTDEFAULT.NAME: Verdante Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLAFORESTDEFAULT.DESCRIPTION:
A lush location rich in wildlife and life-sustaining resources.

<smallcaps>Establishing a foothold on Verdante will be challenging due to reduced food and oxygen options. However, abundant biological and mineral resources should afford excellent long-term growth.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLASWAMPDEFAULT.NAME: Squelchy Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLASWAMPDEFAULT.DESCRIPTION:
A large, polluted swamp world.

<smallcaps>Squelchy Asteroids are a great mass of frozen slush and wasteland. With a short distance to the surface, inter-world travel can be achieved quickly.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLAVOLCANIC.NAME: Volcanea Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLAVOLCANIC.DESCRIPTION:
A location rife with molten lava pockets and intense heat.

<smallcaps>Volcanea would be perfect if it wasn't for the volcanoes. Digging carefully and managing the temperatures in our colony will be essential to success.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLAARBORIA.NAME: Arboria Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLAARBORIA.DESCRIPTION:
A location with a natural abundance of trees.

<smallcaps>Colonizing Arboria will require careful planning right from the start. Because of its lack of metals, finding biological solutions to problems is a must.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLAARIDIO.NAME: Aridio Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLAARIDIO.DESCRIPTION:
A location with oppressively hot temperatures.

<smallcaps>Temperatures on Aridio are much higher than expected. While resources are abundant, maintaining food and infrastructure could be difficult as our colony warms.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLASANDSTONEFROZEN.NAME: Rime Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLASANDSTONEFROZEN.DESCRIPTIO:
A frigid location marked by inhospitably low temperatures throughout.

<smallcaps>Rime's low temperatures will make finding water and establishing farms or ranches problematic. However, the wide spectrum of minerals and cool environment could lead to thriving industry.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLAOASIS.NAME: Oasisse Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLAOASIS.DESCRIPTION:
A desolate location with a cache of life-sustaining water trapped beneath the surface.

<smallcaps>A wide underground desert will pose temperature threats and strain the resources of a colony on Oasisse. However, surviving the challenge should present great industrial opportunities.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLAOCEANIA.NAME: Oceania Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLAOCEANIA.DESCRIPTION:
A location with vast quantities of unpotable salt water.

<smallcaps>Oceania is quite stable and resource rich, but the majority of the area is covered in a saltwater ocean. Careful expansion and resource usage should lead to a successful colony.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLABADLANDS.NAME: The Badlands Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.VANILLABADLANDS.DESCRIPTION:
A barren location with an overabundance of mineral resources.

<smallcaps>The rocky terrain of The Badlands poses no immediate threats, but sparse resource availability will make expansion and technological progress challenging.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.SWAMPYLANDINGSITE.NAME: Irradiated Swampy Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.SWAMPYLANDINGSITE.DESCRIPTION:
A small swampy world with a radioactive core.

<smallcaps>Irradiated Swamps have a high concentration of rare swampy and radioactive resources but are also chocked full of dangers.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.FORESTMOONLET.NAME: Folia Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.FORESTMOONLET.DESCRIPTION:
A small moon with a forest start.

<smallcaps>Folia Asteroids have plenty of organic material but Duplicants will have to venture outside their starting biome quickly to find any metal.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.TERRAMOONLET.NAME: Terrania Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.TERRAMOONLET.DESCRIPTION:
A balanced variety of resources on a smaller sandstone world.

<smallcaps>Terrania Asteroids have everything needed to start a colony in a compact area. With a short distance to the surface, inter-world travel can be achieved quickly.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.WARPOILYSWAMP.NAME: Oily Swamp Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.WARPOILYSWAMP.DESCRIPTION:
A partially frozen world with an oily core.

<smallcaps>While Oily Swamp Asteroids are largely swampy, they also contain a great deal of rust.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.WARPOILYSANDYSWAMP.NAME: Oily Sandy Swamp Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.WARPOILYSANDYSWAMP.DESCRIPTION:
A mildly frozen world with an oily core.

<smallcaps>While Oily Sandy Swamp Asteroids are largely swampy, they also contain a great deal of wasteland.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.OILRICHWARPTARGET.NAME: Rusty Oil Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.OILRICHWARPTARGET.DESCRIPTION:
A rusty world with an oily core.

<smallcaps>Duplicants must sift through a great deal of rust and ocean to reach the prize of this planetoid's oil.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.MEDIUMRADIOACTIVEVANILLAWARPPLANE:
A large-ish partially frozen world with a radioactive core.

<smallcaps>While Radioactive Swamp Asteroids are largely swampy, they also contain a great deal of rust.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.MEDIUMFORESTYRADIOACTIVEVANILLAWA:
A large-ish forested asteroid with a frozen radioactive core.

<smallcaps>While Radioactive Forest Asteroid are largely foresty, they also contain a great deal of rust.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.MEDIUMSANDYRADIOACTIVEVANILLAWARP:
A large-ish terra world with a radioactive core.

<smallcaps>The Radioactive Terra Asteroid is fairly dry and sandy, but does contain areas of jungle.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.MEDIUMSWAMPY.NAME: Stinko Swamp Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.MEDIUMSWAMPY.DESCRIPTION:
A large-ish, polluted swamp world.

<smallcaps>Stinko Swamp Asteroids are full of swampy and marshy areas, but also contain a variety of other biomes diverse enough to keep a determined colony supplied with essentials.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.MEDIUMSANDYSWAMP.NAME: Radioactive Terrabog Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.MEDIUMSANDYSWAMP.DESCRIPTION:
A large-ish terra world with a radioactive core.

<smallcaps>The Radioactive Terrabog Asteroid is fairly dry and sandy, but does contain swampy areas with a partially frozen surface.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.MEDIUMFORESTYWASTELAND.NAME: Glowood Wasteland Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.MEDIUMFORESTYWASTELAND.DESCRIPTIO:
A large-ish forested asteroid with a frozen radioactive core.

<smallcaps>While Glowood Wasteland Asteroids are largely foresty, they also contain a great deal of rust and wasteland.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.STRANGERICHSANDSTONE.NAME: Rocky Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.STRANGERICHSANDSTONE.DESCRIPTION:
A petite rocky world with an oily core.

<smallcaps>Though it looks deceptively nondescript from space, readings from this planet suggest a strong fuel source lurks somewhere beneath the surface.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.SULFURMOONLET.NAME: Brimstonia Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.SULFURMOONLET.DESCRIPTION:
A smaller landmass with a distinct odor.

<smallcaps>Brimstonia Asteroids contain an abundant supply of Sulfur.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.NIOBIUMMOONLET.NAME: Superconductive Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.NIOBIUMMOONLET.DESCRIPTION:
A small location with an abundance of solid Niobium.

<smallcaps>Superconductive Asteroids offer rich veins of Niobium to Duplicants that can withstand its molten rivers of magma.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.OILYMOONLET.NAME: Viscosia Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.OILYMOONLET.DESCRIPTION:
A small location with an abundance of fossil fuels.

<smallcaps>Viscosia Asteroids are filled with valuable crude oil, natural gas, and ethanol deposits at the expense of other essential resources. Early expansion to other planetoids will be essential for survival.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.MARSHYMOONLET.NAME: Marshy Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.MARSHYMOONLET.DESCRIPTION:
A small location with an abundance of marshland.

<smallcaps>While Marshy Asteroids offer an abundance of organic resources like Slime Mold and Algae, their air quality poses a significant disease risk for Duplicants.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.TUNDRAMOONLET.NAME: Tundra Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.TUNDRAMOONLET.DESCRIPTION:
A small frozen planetoid with sub-zero temperatures.

<smallcaps>Duplicants that travel to Tundra Asteroids will need to wear protective gear due to its harsh environment.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.SWAMPMOONLET.NAME: Quagmiris Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.SWAMPMOONLET.DESCRIPTION:
A large, polluted swamp world.

<smallcaps>Quagmiris Asteroids are a great mass of frozen slush and wasteland. With a short distance to the surface, inter-world travel can be achieved quickly.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.MOOMOONLET.NAME: Moo Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.MOOMOONLET.DESCRIPTION:
A small world with unique local lifeforms.

<smallcaps>Moo Asteroids are the natural breeding ground of Gassy Moos due to their abundance of Gas Grass and Methane.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.WATERMOONLET.NAME: Water Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.WATERMOONLET.DESCRIPTION:
A small, water-submerged world.

<smallcaps>Water Asteroids possess a variety of liquid resources and are a natural source of Graphite, but Duplicants should come prepared for a swim.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.REGOLITHMOONLET.NAME: Regolith Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.REGOLITHMOONLET.DESCRIPTION:
A small, cold world with plenty of craters.

<smallcaps>Regolith Asteroids have frequent meteor showers and are chock-full of Regolith, an incredibly useful filtration material. </smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.MINIMETALLICSWAMPY.NAME: Metallic Swampy Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.MINIMETALLICSWAMPY.DESCRIPTION:
A small swampy world with an abundance of renewable metal.

<smallcaps>Metallic Swampy Asteroids have a high concentration of metal and a swampy, polluted atmosphere.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.MINIFORESTFROZEN.NAME: Frozen Forest Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.MINIFORESTFROZEN.DESCRIPTION:
A frigid location marked by inhospitably low temperatures throughout.

<smallcaps>The Frozen Forest Asteroid's low temperatures will make finding water and establishing farms or ranches problematic.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.MINIBADLANDS.NAME: The Desolands Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.MINIBADLANDS.DESCRIPTION:
A barren location with an overabundance of mineral resources and oil.

<smallcaps>The rocky terrain of The Desolands poses no immediate threats, but the limited variety of resources will make expansion and technological progress challenging.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.MINIFLIPPED.NAME: Flipped Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.MINIFLIPPED.DESCRIPTION:
An asteroid in which the surface is molten hot lava and the core is livable.

<smallcaps>The lava surface of the Flipped Asteroid will make it challenging to start a rocketry program.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.MINIRADIOACTIVEOCEAN.NAME: Radioactive Ocean Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.MINIRADIOACTIVEOCEAN.DESCRIPTION:
An irradiated world with renewable water sources.

<smallcaps>Both the radioactive biome and the ocean biome present unique challenges yet considerable payoffs.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.STRANGE_ASTEROID_KF23.NAME: Skewed Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.STRANGE_ASTEROID_KF23.DESCRIPTION:
A tilted world, at once strange and...strangely familiar. Its singular terrain is consistent across all universes.

This resistance to the fluidity of temporal shifts has the cosmos buzzing, as individual colonies compare notes on successes, failures and the bizarre redistribution of resources.

<smallcaps>Released for Klei Fest 2023.
WORLDS.WORLDS.TINYSTART.NAME: Tiny Start FOR DEVS
WORLDS.WORLDS.TINYSTART.DESCRIPTION: A cozy little starter location, just for devs.
WORLDS.WORLDS.TINYEMPTY.NAME: Tiny Empty FOR DEVS
WORLDS.WORLDS.TINYEMPTY.DESCRIPTION: A fun-sized 'fixer upper', perfect for game devs.
WORLDS.WORLDS.BIGEMPTY.NAME: Big Empty FOR DEVS
WORLDS.WORLDS.BIGEMPTY.DESCRIPTION: A big ol' biome-free spacerock for claustrophobic devs.
WORLDS.WORLDS.TINYSURFACE.NAME: Tiny Surface FOR DEVS
WORLDS.WORLDS.TINYSURFACE.DESCRIPTION: A cute little Dev location, with scenic space views.
WORLDS.WORLDS.TINYMAGMA.NAME: Tiny Magma FOR DEVS
WORLDS.WORLDS.TINYMAGMA.DESCRIPTION: A small hellscape just for devs.
WORLDS.WORLDS.TINYICE.NAME: Tiny Ice FOR DEVS
WORLDS.WORLDS.TINYICE.DESCRIPTION: A tiny ice cold world for dev snow forts.
WORLDS.WORLDS.TINYFOREST.NAME: Tiny Forest FOR DEVS
WORLDS.WORLDS.TINYFOREST.DESCRIPTION: A petite forest world for nature loving devs.
WORLDS.WORLDS.TWINMOONLET.NAME: Tiny Twin Asteroid FOR DEVS
WORLDS.WORLDS.TWINMOONLET.DESCRIPTION: Two small dev worlds for the price of one.
WORLDS.WORLDS.CERESBASEGAME.NAME: Ceres
WORLDS.WORLDS.CERESBASEGAME.DESCRIPTION:
A frosty location with sub-zero temperatures throughout.

<smallcaps>Duplicants who work in Ceres's sub-zero temperatures will need to wear or build warming equipment. Abundant natural fuel sources could lead to a well-powered colony.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.CERESBASEGAMESHATTERED.NAME: Blasted Ceres
WORLDS.WORLDS.CERESBASEGAMESHATTERED.DESCRIPTIO:
The heavily damaged remnants of a frosty location with sub-zero temperatures throughout.

<smallcaps>Exploring the rubble of Blasted Ceres's sub-zero temperatures is particularly challenging, yet natural fuel sources provide a valuable payoff.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.CERESCLASSICSHATTERED.NAME: Blasted Ceres
WORLDS.WORLDS.CERESCLASSICSHATTERED.DESCRIPTION:
The heavily damaged remnants of a frosty location with sub-zero temperatures throughout.

<smallcaps>Exploring the rubble of Blasted Ceres's sub-zero temperatures is particularly challenging, yet natural fuel sources provide a valuable payoff.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.MINISHATTEREDSTART.NAME: Ceres Mantle Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.MINISHATTEREDSTART.DESCRIPTION:
A battered chunk of a smaller frosty starting world with sub-zero temperatures throughout.

<smallcaps>Surviving Ceres Mantle's frigid landscape is no easy task, but natural fuel sources provide a valuable payoff.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.MINISHATTEREDWARP.NAME: Sweet Ceres Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.MINISHATTEREDWARP.DESCRIPTION:
A small, snow-laden world rich with oil and nectar resources.

<smallcaps>Sub-zero temperatures pose unique challenges but the potential for power production is very valuable.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.MINISHATTEREDGEO.NAME: Ceres Core Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.MINISHATTEREDGEO.DESCRIPTION:
A molten mini asteroid with a failed experiment buried inside.

<smallcaps>Extremely high temperatures threaten colony safety but could yield an unimaginably powerful payoff.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.CERESSPACEDOUT.NAME: Ceres Minor
WORLDS.WORLDS.CERESSPACEDOUT.DESCRIPTION:
A smaller frosty starting world with sub-zero temperatures throughout.

<smallcaps>Duplicants who work in Ceres's sub-zero temperatures will need to wear or build warming equipment. Abundant natural fuel sources could lead to a well-powered colony.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.CERESCLASSIC.NAME: Ceres Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.CERESCLASSIC.DESCRIPTION:
A frosty starting world with sub-zero temperatures throughout.

<smallcaps>Duplicants who work in Ceres's sub-zero temperatures will need to wear or build warming equipment. Abundant natural fuel sources could lead to a well-powered colony.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.CERESMIXING.NAME: Ceres Fragment
WORLDS.WORLDS.CERESMIXING.DESCRIPTION:
A fragment of a frosty starting world with sub-zero temperatures throughout.

<smallcaps>Duplicants who work in sub-zero temperatures will need to wear or build warming equipment. Abundant natural fuel sources could lead to a well-powered colony.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.PREHISTORICBASEGAME.NAME: Relica
WORLDS.WORLDS.PREHISTORICBASEGAME.DESCRIPTION:
An endangered location with abundant food resources.

<smallcaps>Relica's biodiversity makes reliable food production more attainable for new colonies. Construction materials and fuels are also ample. Surface defence must be prioritized to minimize damage from an incoming impactor asteroid.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.PREHISTORICSHATTERED.NAME: RelicAAAA<sup>AAAGHH</sup>
WORLDS.WORLDS.PREHISTORICSHATTERED.DESCRIPTION:
A geyser-rich location that will be struck by an impactor asteroid almost immediately.

<smallcaps>Impact-related damage will trigger the eruption of this world's unusually high number of geyers. Colonies that survive the volatile aftermath will reap the benefits of the abundant natural resources released into the environment.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.PREHISTORICCLASSIC.NAME: Relica Asteroid
WORLDS.WORLDS.PREHISTORICCLASSIC.DESCRIPTION:
An endangered starting world with abundant food resources.

<smallcaps>Relica's biodiversity makes reliable food production more attainable for new colonies. Construction materials and fuels are also ample. Surface defence must be prioritized to minimize damage from an incoming impactor asteroid.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.PREHISTORICSPACEDOUT.NAME: Relica Minor
WORLDS.WORLDS.PREHISTORICSPACEDOUT.DESCRIPTION:
A smaller endangered starting world with abundant food resources.

<smallcaps>Relica's biodiversity makes reliable food production more attainable for new colonies. Construction materials and fuels are also ample. Surface defence must be prioritized to minimize damage from an incoming impactor asteroid.</smallcaps>
WORLDS.WORLDS.PREHISTORICMIXING.NAME: Relica Fragment
WORLDS.WORLDS.PREHISTORICMIXING.DESCRIPTION:
A fragment of a prehistoric starting world.

<smallcaps>Its biodiversity makes reliable food production more attainable for new colonies. Construction materials and fuels are also ample. </smallcaps>
